June 15, 2020 version **5.1.0 (27838.0614)**Download Type: Manual

Changes to existing features


* **Ask all to unmute for meetings of 200 participants or fewer**The meeting host can now ask all participants to unmute for meetings with 200 participants or fewer. This option is available in the host controls by clicking Participants, then More. This feature requires the desktop client 5.1.0 for the participants you are unmuting, as well as the host. If participants are on the Zoom client 5.0.5 or earlier, they will stay muted and not be prompted to unmute.

pageTitle: Launching an external app or URL for inbound calls
body:
You can set up the Zoom desktop client to automatically launch an external app or URL when you receive a call. You can also insert parameters to pass details about the inbound caller like their caller ID. For example, you could use this feature can be used to pass customer information to a CRM system.

This article covers:


* [Specifying the parameters for launching an app or URL](#h_01ETRFFWDNTZ90F4WAHZSMMM74)
* [Parameters](#h_01ETRFG0S9H48KDDF09VAVX0JH)
* [Examples](#h_01ETRFG6ZH2XFXEFE0HYCYNV88)

pageTitle: Pre-configure SSO login domains for Office 365 add-in
body:
1. Download the [manifest file for the Outlook Add-in](https://zoom.us/office365/add-in/manifest.xml).
2. Open the manifest file in a text editor.
3. Replace the current value in %value% with **c7740fe1-f1ea-4869-9bec-fc827930b38f**.
For example if your manifest file lists the ID  as *a7ca6c74-33fb-43a4-a3e4-781078f0eff5*, change the line to **c7740fe1-f1ea-4869-9bec-fc827930b38f**.
4. Find the following lines in the Manifest (they will appear two times):
<bt:Url DefaultValue="https://zoom.us/office365/schedule" id="messageReadTaskPaneUrl"/



5. Replace those lines with above, with the following lines respectively:



6. Modify the newly added lines by replacing "%ssodomain%" with your domain. For example, if your Vanity Url is mycompany.zoom.us, replace "%ssodomain%" with "mycompany".


7. Save the file.

* [Logitech Tap + Logitech Nuc System](https://www.logitech.com/en-us/product/zoom-rooms)
* [Logitech Strong USB](https://www.logitech.com/en-gb/product/strong-usb)
* [PC Wall Mount](https://www.logitech.com/en-us/product/pc-mount)
* Tap [Table Mount](https://www.logitech.com/en-us/product/tap-table-mount), [Riser Mount](https://www.logitech.com/en-us/product/tap-riser-mount) or [Wall Mount](https://www.logitech.com/en-us/product/tap-wall-mount) (Optional)

You must have a Zoom webinar license to host a spectator event. If you don't have a webinar license, the **Only Host, Alternative Hosts, or invited Panelists can turn on video and audio** option when [creating an event](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360049497492#h_01EMJ9R8JA45EM6T8BW3THM16G) will not be a selectable option.

You can purchase a webinar license by visiting your [account's Billing page](https://zoom.us/billing#webinar) or by [contacting sales](https://zoom.us/contactsales). You can assign the webinar license after purchasing one.

pageTitle: How do I get the install log for macOS?
body:
You may be required by Technical Support to submit the install log if you experienced an installation issue.


1. Go to **Finder**.
2. Click **Go** (Top Menu Bar), then **Computer**.
3. Then on the Search box, type **Console**.
4. Then double click on **Console**.
5. Then under **~/Library/Logs**, scroll to the bottom, you will find **zoom.us**, open to access **zoominstall.log**.
6. Copy the text in the install log send to Zoom support.

pageTitle: Changing the video layout (Active Speaker View and Gallery View)
body:
You can switch any of the layouts (except floating the thumbnail window) to full screen mode by double-clicking your Zoom window.

You can exit full screen by double-clicking again or using the **Esc** key on your keyboard.

**Note**: In older versions of macOS, click **Meeting** and **Enter Fullscreen** in the Top Menu bar.

![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/mac/enter-fullscreen-option.png)

1. On the Rooms page of the A4B web console, click the name of the room you created.
2. Verify that the status is **Synced** in the **Alexa Devices** section of the page.
3. Verify that the **parent account linked with scope value** appears on the **Skills** page.
4. Scroll to the **Smart home devices** section of the page.
5. Click the **Discover devices** button**.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/zoom-rooms/alexa/discover-devices.png)**
6. Verify that the Echo device is listed under **Smart home devices**. This confirms that A4B has found the skill adapter that you configured.

pageTitle: Getting Started on Windows and Mac
body:
Select the **Contacts** tab to view and manage your contacts.

![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/generic/contacts/contacts-tab.png)


* **Directory** tab: View a directory of all your contacts, including [starred](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115004055706), external, and [auto answer](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203736135) contacts. If your organization has Zoom Rooms, you will also see a list of Zoom Rooms.
* **Channels** tab: View a directory of your channels (used for group messaging). Starred channels appear at the top of the list.
* Add icon ![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/generic/meetings/add-icon.png): Show options for [contacts](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115004055706) and [channels](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/200912909). You can add a contact, create a contact group, create a channel, or join a channel.

1. Sign in to the Zoom web portal.
2. Click **Phone**.
3. Click the **[Recording](https://zoom.us/pbx/page/telephone/myZoomTelephony#/my-cloud-phone/recordings)** tab.
4. Use these options to search and identify recordings:


	* Use the search box at the top to filter call history by a contact name or phone number.
	* If your admin granted you access to a phone user's or call queue's recording, use the **Recording (All)** drop-down menu to filter call recordings by the owner.
	* Outgoing recorded calls are marked with this icon:
	![](https://assets.zoom.us/generic-images/common-buttons-and-icons/filled/outbound-call-icon.png)
5. Click the following options to manage call recordings:


	* Play icon: Play a recording in the web portal.
	![](https://assets.zoom.us/generic-images/common-buttons-and-icons/filled/play-button.png)
	* **Download**: Save the recording as an MP3 file.
	* **Delete**: Delete the selected call recording. To delete several entries at once, click the check box beside the contact name/number and click **Delete**.

**New and Enhanced Features**


* **Meeting/Webinar Features**


	+ **Sharing Key Ease of Use**Users who visit share.zoom.us and click Share Screen will be prompted to download the client if they have not already done so. The client will launch automatically after installed and display the “enter sharing key” interface.
	+ **Saving Chats in Meetings**Admins can disable the ability to save chats in Zoom meetings on the Zoom web portal. Attendees will still be able to use the chat feature when saving chats is disabled.
	+ **Multiple participants can share their screen simultaneously**Hosts can choose to have multiple participants share their screens. To make full use of this feature, dual monitors are recommended for participants. During a meeting, the host clicks the arrow next to the Share Screen button to control this feature. Note that participants on mobile devices only see the most recently shared screen.
	+ **Reduced Volume for Enter/Exit Chime**
	+ **Support for Screensharing with Linux Antergos**
* **Meeting Features**


	+ **Closed Captioning in Breakout Sessions**Closed Captioning can now be utilized in Breakout Sessions.
	+ **Settings to Use PMI for Scheduled and Instant Meetings**For newly created Zoom users, started or scheduled meetings will use PMI if the web settings Use PMI for Scheduled Meetings and Use PMI for Instant Meetings are enabled.
* **Webinar Features**


	+ **Allow Call-In Attendees to Unmute in Webinar**The webinar host can now allow attendees who have called in to the meeting by telephone to unmute themselves by clicking Allow to Talk in the Attendee list.
* **Chat Features**


	+ **Indicator that a Message Did Not Send**If a chat message was not successfully sent, an indicator icon will be displayed on the name of the chat or recipient, indicating that the message did not go through.
	+ **Descriptions and Usage Hints for Slash Commands**Slash Commands will now display descriptions and usage hints before being selected to help users more easily identify the command they need.
	+ **Personal Space for Note Taking**Write messages to yourself to take notes and save links within the Zoom chat window.
	+ **Send Code snippet over chat**Copy and paste bits of code over chat and preserve the code formatting. This must be enabled by the account owner or admin and requires a separate package download.
	+ **Block a User**Users can now block another user on chat to prevent them from sending them chat messages.
* **Phone Features**


	+ **Support for Zoom Phone**Zoom Phone features have been added to the Zoom Linux client. Users can make and receive calls, access in-call controls, view call history, and check their voicemail.
	+ **Upgrade a Zoom Phone Call to a Meeting**Zoom Phone users can now upgrade the call to a video meeting with one click/tap.
* **General Features**


	+ **Shortcut to Switch Tabs**Users can now switch from one Zoom tab to the next, such as from Home to Chat, by entering CTRL + Tab.
	+ **Accessibility Enhancements**

**Resolved Issues**


* Minor Bug Fixes

July 16, 2019 Version **2.9.265650.0716**Download type: Manual

**Resolved Issues**


* Minor Bug Fixes

July 14, 2019 Version **2.8.264592.0714**Download type: Manual

**New and Enhanced Features**


* **Meeting/Webinar Features**


	+ **Confirm Starting Video When Joining a Meeting**Before joining a meeting with video on, users will now be shown their video preview and given the options to join with or without video. They can also check to always join with video without displaying the preview first.

**Resolved Issues**


* Minor Bug Fixes

June 16, 2019 Version **2.8.252201.0616**Download type: Manual

**New and Enhanced Features**


* **Meeting Features**


	+ **Log In from Waiting Room**Users will now have the option to log in while they are waiting to be admitted to the meeting from the waiting room if the host utilizes the waiting room for guest participants only. This will allow users on the same account to be automatically admitted to the meeting after logging in.

**Resolved Issues**


* Minor Bug Fixes

May 19, 2019 Version **2.8.222599.0519**Download type: Manual

**Resolved Issues**


* Minor Bug Fixes

April 14, 2019 Version **2.8.183302.0415**Download type: Manual

**New and Enhanced Features**


* **Meeting Features**


	+ **Option to Disable Chat During a Meeting**The meeting host can now disable the participants from using the chat once the meeting has started.
	+ **Call a CRC device without Starting a Meeting**Zoom users with a CRC license can now call an H.323/SIP device without starting a meeting first.
* **Meeting/Webinar features**


	+ **Consent to Being Recorded Confirmation**Once enabled through meeting settings, meeting participants will be notified that their meeting is being recorded and will have the option to consent to being recorded or leave the meeting. The recording consent information will be included in the Active Host report.
	+ **Automatically Save Whiteboard**The host can now automatically save the whiteboard when sharing is stopped. This setting is available at the account, group, and user level.
	+ **Show Which Participant is Annotating**The meeting host can now see which participant is annotating by hovering over the annotation.
	+ **Display an Indicator for Audio Watermark**When a meeting or webinar is utilizing the audio watermark feature, an indicator icon will now be displayed to meeting participants to inform them that this feature is being used.
* **General Features**


	+ **Accessibility Enhancements**
* **Chat Features**


	+ **Star Individual Messages**You can now star files while viewing the All Files channel to access the files more easily at a later time.
	+ **Star Contacts and Chat Channels**Star Contacts and Chat Channels so that they are always easily accessible at the top of your Zoom chat window.

**Resolved Issues**


* Resolved an issue where Brasilia’s time zone was displaying incorrectly
* Resolved an issue where Zoom was crashing for some Linux users after annotating
* Minor Bug Fixes

January 20, 2019 Version **2.7.162522.0121**Download type: Manual

**New and Enhanced Features**


* **Meeting/Webinar Features**


	+ **Audio Watermark**If an attendee records the meeting, their personal information can now be embedded in the audio as an inaudible watermark. This option requires enabling "Only signed-in users can join the meeting" or "Only signed-in users with specified domains can join meetings".
	+ **Screen Sharing Enhancements**
	
	
		- **Ability to Stop a Participant’s Share**The host can now stop a participant’s screen share by going to the Participant List and selecting More next to the sharing participant’s name.
		- **Improvements for Direct Share**While direct sharing to a Zoom Room, the green screen share indicator bar will now automatically hide when the mouse is not moving and reappear when the mouse moves.
	+ **Annotation Enhancements**
	
	
		- **Indicator that a Participant is Annotating**The host can now identify which participants are annotating by viewing the participants list. The participants who are annotating will have an indicator in the color they are using to annotate.
		- **Support for Multiple Pages on Whiteboard**Hosts can now enable multiple pages for whiteboard. If enabled, they can create new pages, close pages, and navigate between multiple pages.
	+ **Allow Removed Participants to Rejoin**Hosts can now allow meeting participants and webinar panelists to rejoin after they have been removed. This feature needs to be enabled on the web under Meeting, Group, or Account Settings.
	
	
	+ **Improvements to the Raise Hand Feature**The raise hand feature will now prompt users to link their audio if necessary to make it easier to speak in the meeting.
	+ **Support for Scheduling a Meeting or Webinar as Public**Hosts can now schedule a meeting as public through the Zoom client to share it on the calendar of public events.
* **Meeting Features**


	+ **Warning When Scheduling a Meeting Longer than 40 minutes**Basic users will now be warned if they schedule a meeting longer than 40 minutes through the Zoom client or mobile app.
	+ **Breakout Room Enhancements**
	
	
		- **Set a Timer for Breakout Rooms**Hosts can now set a timer for breakout rooms. Once the configured time has passed, the breakout rooms will automatically close and users will be returned to the main session. Hosts can also choose to be notified when the time ends.
		- **Ability to Force Participants into Breakout Rooms**The hosts can now force participants to join the breakout rooms from the main session.
		- **Ability to Disable Returning to the Main Session**The host can now prevent participants from returning to the main session from the breakout room. They will return to the main session when the host closes the breakout rooms manually or the set time expires.

**Resolved Issues**


* **Minor Bug Fixes**

Participants have the ability to raise their hand, signal yes or no, indicate to go faster or slower, and use emojis. The host has the ability clear all non-verbal feedback indicators at any time.
	+ **Improved First Join Experience**
* **Meeting/Webinar features**

	+ **Reduction of Typing/Keyboard Noise**

	+ **Delete a message**You can delete a message that you sent at any time. The message is removed from the IM application so that recipients no longer have access to it within Zoom. Only the sender sees a notification that the message was deleted.

During a call, you can use the following in-call controls. These controls are the same across Windows, macOS, Android, and iOS.

**Note**:


* If you're [accessing in-call controls in the Zoom Room controller](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205369035#h_571d768a-621d-40c1-ab00-46d93dd6267e), you can access all controls, except for starting a call recording.
* On the desktop client, you can use some in-call controls with [keyboard shortcuts](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205683899).

![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/generic/phone/in-call-controls.png)

**Mute** / **Unmute**: Mute or unmute your mic.

**Keypad**: Display a dial pad to enter numbers during the call. For example, the dial pad allows you to select an option during an interactive answering machine or to enter an extension number.

**Audio**: Open [audio settings](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362623-Changing-Settings-in-the-Desktop-Client-or-Mobile-App) and change the volume of your speaker or mic.

**Add Call**: Display a dial pad to enter a number and add another person to the call (three-way call). Each person will remain on a separate line. Click or tap their name or number to switch between each person.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/generic/phone/three-way-call-switch-call.png)To merge the calls and enable three-way calling, click or tap the merge icon and select the person or number to merge with.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/generic/phone/three-way-call-merge-call.png)

**Hold** / **Unhold**: Place the call on hold or resume the call. The receiving party will hear music while they're on hold. You can [customize your hold music](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360028212652) in the Zoom web portal. While the call is on hold, you can use [call flip](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360034613311) to switch the call to another device (Zoom desktop app, mobile client, or desk phone).

**Transfer**: [Transfer the call](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360028786771) to another number. You can also transfer the call to voicemail.

**Record**: Start or stop recording the call. You may hear an audio prompt notifying both parties that the call will be recorded (the audio prompt can be disabled by the admin). If your admin disabled call recording or enabled automatic recording, the **Record** button will be inaccessible. You can still [access existing recordings](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360021336671). [Play and manage your recordings](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360021336671-Viewing-Call-History-and-Recordings) using the desktop client, mobile app, or web portal.

The following scenarios affect call recordings:


* If you [transfer the call](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360028786771), the recording will end when you select a transfer option. This applies when transferring to external or internal contacts. If you select **Warm Transfer**, you can start the recording again to record the portion before you complete the transfer.
* If you [add a call](#add-call) after starting a recording, the recording will continue for the initial call. The recording will end when you merge the calls to start a three-way call. You can start a new call recording after merging the calls.
* If you [add a call](#add-call) while automatic call recording is enabled, the recording will continue for the initial call. Zoom Phone will also automatically start a new recording for the added call. When you merge the call, the new recording will continue for the merged call.
* If you [elevate the call to a Zoom meeting](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360026902831), the call recording (ad hoc or automatic) will end.
* If another phone user [takes over a call](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360044804711), your ad hoc or automatic recording will end. If the phone user taking over the call also has automatic recording enabled, a new recording will begin for that user.

**Meet**: [Elevate the call to a Zoom meeting](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360026902831).

**More**: Access the following controls.


* **Switch to Carrier** (only available in the mobile app): If you're experiencing a weak signal, [switch the call to your phone carrier](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360054698331).
* **Park**: [Park the call](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360042175291) for another phone user to pick it up.
* **Invite to Meeting**: [Invite the call participant to a meeting](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360026902831#h_01EEBH4QZ5Q8P2XSS358ZBVTPM) by using the meeting ID.
* **Hand off to Room**: [Hand off the phone call](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360052739931) to a Zoom Room.
* **Minimize**: Minimize the in-call controls while continuing the call so you can continue using the Zoom desktop client or mobile app.

**To Spotlight a Video**


1. At the top of your screen, hover over the video of the participant you want to spotlight and click **...**
2. From the menu, choose **Spotlight for Everyone**.
 ![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/generic/in-meeting/spotlight-video-first.png)
3. (Optional) To spotlight additional participants (up to 9 total), follow steps 1 and 2 again as needed, clicking on **Add Spotlight** instead.
 ![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/generic/in-meeting/spotlight-video-additional.png)

**To Cancel a Spotlight**


1. Click **Remove Spotlight** in the upper-left corner of the video area.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/generic/in-meeting/spotlight-remove.png)
2. This will return the meeting to Active Speaker.

**Spotlight when I speak**

Spotlight when I speak is a feature that will display your video on your own screen when you are in Active Speaker Video Layout and are talking. This can be useful if you are [recording locally](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362473-Local-Recording).

To enabled this setting:


1. Login to the desktop client
2. Click your profile picture then click **Settings**.
 ![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/generic/home/settings-button-under-profile-pic.png)
3. Click the **Video** tab.
 ![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/generic/settings/video-tab.png)
4. Check ****Spotlight my video when I Speak**.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/generic/settings/spotlight-my-video-when-i-speak.png)**

subTitles: Local storage on Zoom Room computer
body:
When using the attendee count feature for Zoom Rooms, the Zoom room computer will store and count images to generate a participant count temporarily. These files are temporarily stored in the following locations:

**Windows**: %appdata%\ZoomRooms\logs\FaceCount

**macOS**: ~/Library/Logs/ZoomRooms/faceCount

These files will be removed under the following conditions:


1. When the meeting or counting has finished.
2. When logging out of the Zoom Room.
3. During the Zoom Room's startup process.
4. If the setting is disabled.

Generally, VAT is invoiced by the supplier that is selling goods or services and collected from the customer.  Subsequently, the supplier reports and remits the collected VAT to the General Authority of Zakat and Tax (“GAZT”) in the KSA.

If you are a business customer, you should provide your VAT Number to Zoom (see ‘How do I enter my VAT Number?’ below for details on how to do this).  If the VAT number is valid then no VAT will be charged on the supplies made to you by Zoom.  If you do not have a VAT number, then VAT will be charged on the supplies made to you by Zoom.

For a system that a teacher can use for one-to-many engagement with their students from their desktop, consider the following hardware setups as options for distance learning. The setup will typically consist of a fixed computer or laptop with webcam, integrated speakers and an external microphone. A headset may be used instead of speakers and microphone if desired.  Additional devices may include USB document cameras or shared tablets for whiteboarding and document sharing.  If computer-based sharing is important, a secondary monitor may be helpful to organize your content and share specific components.

pageTitle: Quick start guide for the Zoom web client
body:
1. Sign in to the Zoom web portal.
2. Click **HOST A MEETING** in the top-right corner next to your profile picture, then select an option to start a video-on, video-off, or screen share only meeting.
3. If prompted to open the Zoom desktop client, click **Cancel**.
4. Click the **Join from your Browser** link.
**Note**: If you don't see this option, make sure to enable [Join From Browser](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115005666383).

Follow these steps to create a single phone dial-in contact.


1. Sign in to the Zoom web portal.
2. In the navigation panel, click **Account Management** then [**Phone Dial-in Contacts**](https://zoom.us/account/phonecontact).
3. Click **Add Contact**.
4. Enter the required information:


	* **Display Name**: The contact's name that's displayed to other meeting participants.
	* **Phone Number**: The contact's phone number that consists of the following components. Do not insert a plus sign (+) or dashes (-). For example, enter **14081231234** to specify the number **+1 (408) 123-1234**.
	
	
		+ Country code
		+ Area code
		+ Phone number
5. (Optional) Click **Add Another** and repeat step 4 to add more contacts.


6. Click **Save**.

pageTitle: Requesting a number port in South Africa
body:
1. Download and complete the required [Customer Instruction Form](https://assets.zoom.us/docs/number-port-requests/south-africa/South-Africa-Customer-Instruction-Form.docx) remembering to paste this onto your business letter headed paper.
2. Send an email to [numberportingemea@zoom.us](mailto:numberportingemea@zoom.us) and include the following:


	* Required subject line 'South Africa number port'.
	* Completed and hand-signed [Customer Instruction Form](https://assets.zoom.us/docs/number-port-requests/south-africa/South-Africa-Customer-Instruction-Form.docx).
	* Recent telephone bill relating to your porting numbers which should be dated within the last 30 days.
3. Zoom will review and confirm receipt of the request.


4. Zoom will send a request to our local partner in South Africa to validate the porting numbers are transferrable. Once the numbers are confirmed as transferrable, we will send you the porting Letter of Authorisation (LOA) to complete and hand-sign.
5. Zoom will send a request to your losing provider to validate the information on the LOA as the transfer request is dependent on your losing provider. If accepted, Zoom and the losing provider will work together to schedule the number port. Once approved, the numbers will be available for you to [manage in the Zoom web portal](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360020808292).

You can change IM settings that apply to all IM groups:


1. Sign in to the Zoom web portal.
2. In the navigation menu, click **Account Management** then **[IM Management](https://zoom.us/account/imgroup)**.
3. Click the **IM Settings** tab.
4. Navigate to the setting you want to change.
5. Click the lock icon ![](https://zoom-support-cdn.s3.amazonaws.com/images/en-us/web/generic/lock-unlocked-icon.png) to lock a setting if you want to prevent it from being changed in user settings.

**Note**:


* Some settings are dependent on certain prerequisites. If you do not see a setting listed for, review the article on the setting to see if your account meets those prerequisites.
* If a user belongs to multiple IM groups, the locked setting takes precedence. If the setting is not locked, then the most restrictive setting takes precedence.

Allow users in the account to share these in chat:


* **[Screen capture](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/202920879)**
* **[File transfer](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/202920879)**


	+ **Only allow specified file types** (optional): Specify the file types that users can send in chat. Zoom desktop client version 5.4.0 or higher is required.
	+ **Maximum file size** (optional): Specify the maximum file size (MB) that users can send in chat and [in-meeting chat](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203650445). Zoom desktop client version 5.4.0 or higher is required.
* **[Animated GIF images](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/202920879)**

pageTitle: Quick start guide for the Zoom web client
subTitles: Starting a scheduled meeting or webinar
body:
1. Sign in to the Zoom web portal.
2. In the navigation menu, click **Meetings** or **Webinars**.
3. Click the meeting you want to start.
4. Click **Start this Meeting** in the top-right corner.
5. If prompted to open the Zoom desktop client, click **Cancel**.
6. Click the **Join from your Browser** link.
**Note**: If you don't see this option, make sure to enable [Join From Browser](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115005666383).

* **Additional Outbound Caller ID for User**: Control phone users' access to [outbound caller ID numbers](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360031768431#h_7c6a5c5b-92cc-421a-91b7-14799a9ab1da).
* **Show Outbound Caller ID for Internal Calls**: Show the direct phone number of internal inbound calls from [call queues](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360021524831) or [auto receptionists](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360021121312). In other words, when a user dials an internal extension with an auto receptionist or call queue number as the [caller ID](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360031768431), the receiver will see the selected outbound caller ID. If this setting is disabled, call notifications only show the extension number.

If you have [simultaneous screen sharing](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115000424286-Sharing-Multiple-Screens-Simultaneously) on, multiple participants will be able to share a whiteboard at once. However, to see two whiteboards at once, or your own whiteboard and another participant's, you will need to have [dual monitors](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362583-How-To-Use-a-Dual-Monitor-Display) enabled.

pageTitle: Setting up Zoom Rooms with Google Calendar
subTitles: Preparing to integrate Google Calendar with Zoom Rooms
body:
1. Sign in to your Google account as an administrator.
2. Create a dedicated user who can manage all calendar resources.
 See the Google support article, [Add users individually](https://support.google.com/a/answer/33310?hl=en) for instructions on how to add this user.
3. Create or locate a calendar resource for each Zoom Room.
 See the Google support article, [Add a calendar resource](https://support.google.com/a/answer/1033925) for instructions.
4. Open the Google Calendar app.
 Make sure that you can see the calendar resource for each room under **My calendars**.

pageTitle: Getting started as an OnZoom Attendee
subTitles: Registering for a free OnZoom event
body:
1. Sign in to [OnZoom](https://onzoom.com).
2. Click on the free event you want to register for.
3. Click the **Register** button.
**Note**: If you selected a free event-series, click **Entire Series**. If you selected a drop-in event, click **Drop-In**.
4. Depending on the event type you selected—single event, series, or drop-in—when the registration window opens:


5. If you selected a single event: click the **+** button to add the number of tickets you want; click the **-** button to remove the tickets you don't want.


6. If you selected a series event: click the **+** button to add the number of series tickets you want; click the **-** button to remove the series tickets you don't want.
7. If you selected a drop-in event: click the **+** button next to the session you want to register for to add the number of tickets you want; click the **-** button to remove the tickets you don't want.
**Note**: If there are multiple sessions, add tickets to the sessions you want to register for.


8. Click the **Checkout** button.


9. You will be taken to the checkout window. Before placing your order:


10. If you bought one ticket, enter the email address that you want the ticket to be sent to.


11. If you bought multiple tickets, enter the email address that you want each ticket to be sent to.
**Note**: Multiple tickets cannot be sent to the same email address.
12. If you want to remove a ticket, click **Delete Ticket**.


13. Click the **Place Order** button to complete your purchase.
Once the order confirmation page appears, you can [sync the event to your calendar](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360050554531).



**Note**: Your avatar during a free event will be the initials of your OnZoom account name; avatars for free events cannot be changed.

pageTitle: New updates for Zoom Rooms for macOS
body:
* **In-meeting features**


	+ **Security features**Meeting hosts can tap the security option while in a meeting to easily access the following features: lock meeting, enable Waiting Room, disable chat, disable participant renaming, disable screen sharing for others, remove participant, report a participant.
	+ **Report a participant**Meeting hosts can tap the security option while in a meeting to report a participant to Zoom trust and safety for inappropriate behavior.
	+ **Host selection when leaving a meeting**The host will be prompted to assign a new host before leaving the meeting.
	+ **Waiting Room**Hosts in direct share meetings or phone calls will be able to allow or prevent participants from joining their meetings when Waiting Room is enabled.
	+ **Meeting information**Users can view the numeric password which is used for phone and H323/SIP call-in participants. The numeric password is displayed with the phone dial in number on the meeting information screen.
	+ **Starting a test meeting while not signed in**Users must accept Zoom’s Terms of Service and Privacy Policy via pop-up message before starting a test meeting in a Zoom Room that is not signed in.
* **Management features**


	+ **Recording consent customization**Admins can customize the message that appears asking participants for their consent to be recorded.
	+ **Logs**Admin users can enable a web setting that allows Zoom support to submit logs to Zoom on behalf of the admin, or have the logs automatically uploaded in the event of a crash.
* **Scheduling display features**


	+ **Scheduling a password protected meeting**Users can choose to schedule a password protected meeting and customize the meeting password from a scheduling display. If passwords are required for scheduled meetings, a password will be generated automatically and cannot be disabled from the scheduling display.

pageTitle: May 2020: Updated passcode and security settings
body:
As a part of the passcode changes, the following settings will be enforced for all meetings. Due to this change, the settings will be **removed** from the web portal, and **will be a required setting when scheduling**:


* Require a passcode for Personal Meeting ID (PMI)
* Require a passcode when scheduling new meetings
* Require a passcode for instant meetings
* Require passcode for participants joining by phone
* Require passcodes for Zoom Room meetings

While the passcode is required, it can still be set by the host or there is the option to have it randomly generated automatically. These changes are being made to prevent unwanted participants from joining your meeting or webinar.

If you do not already have passcodes set for your currently scheduled meetings or webinars before this change takes effect, we recommend deleting the existing meeting and scheduling a new meeting and re-sending the invite to your participants.

Manually entering a meeting/webinar ID will always prompt the user to enter the passcode. By default, Zoom embeds the passcode into meeting/webinar links, if participants click the link they will not be prompted to enter a passcode when joining. However, you can disable this setting at the account, group, or user level by turning off the setting [Embed passcode in-meeting link for one-click join](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360033559832).

pageTitle: Setting up and using two-factor authentication (2FA)
body:
1. Sign in to the Zoom web portal.
2. In the navigation menu, click **Advanced** then **Security**.
3. Make sure the **Sign in with Two-Factor Authentication** option is enabled.
4. Select one of these options to specify users to enable 2FA for:


	* **All users in your account**: Enable 2FA for all users in the account.
	* **Users with specific roles**: Enable 2FA for roles with the specified [roles](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115001078646). Click the pencil icon, select the roles, then click **OK**.
	* **Users belonging to specific groups**: Enable 2FA for users that are in the specified [groups](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/204519819). Click the pencil icon, select the groups, then click **OK**.
5. Click **Save**.
**Note**: You can share the [instructions to set up 2FA](#h_c44a023e-d930-4620-b0e8-da3a742bdbb9) with your users.

There are **3** types of users:


* **Basic**: A basic user is user without a paid license. A basic user can host meetings with up to 100 participants. If 3 or more participants join, the meeting will time out after 40 minutes. They cannot utilize user and account add-ons such as large meeting, webinar, or conference room connector.
* **Licensed**: A licensed user is a paid account user who can host unlimited meetings on the public cloud. By default, they can host meetings with up to 100 participants and large meeting licenses are available for additional capacity. Licensed users have these additional features available:


	+ Customize Personal Meeting ID
	+ Record to the Zoom cloud
	+ Be an alternative host
	+ Assign others to schedule and schedule on behalf of
	+ Utilize account add-ons such as conference room connector
	+ Be assigned user add-ons such as large meeting, webinar, or personal audio conference
	+ Customize Personal Link, if on a business or education account
* **On-prem**: A on-prem user is a paid account who can host unlimited meetings with the on-premise meeting connector. On-prem users have these additional features:


	+ Customize Personal Meeting ID
	+ Use the recording connector, if configured for their account
	+ Be an alternative host
	+ Assign others to schedule and schedule on behalf of
	+ Utilize account add-ons such as room connector
	+ Be assigned user add-ons such as large meeting, webinar, or personal audio conference
	+ Customize Personal Link, if on a business or education account

You can find your user type on your [profile](https://zoom.us/profile) page. If you are an admin or account owner, you can view user types for all users under your account on the [User Management](https://zoom.us/account/user) page.

subTitles: How is Zoom determining which customers KSA VAT applies to?
body:
If you have not provided a KSA VAT number and you are resident in KSA Zoom will charge KSA VAT on it supplies to you.

Zoom will treat any customers with a ‘Sold To’ address as being resident in KSA.  This information is subject to cross-referencing against other data to verify that the ‘Sold to’ country is accurate.

It is your responsibility as a customer to ensure that your sold to address is accurate.

subTitles: What if I have an RFC and forget to enter it?
body: The RFC may be updated at any time into Zoom’s billing portal.  Once the RFC is entered it will show on your next invoice.  Zoom will not credit and reissue historic invoices where an RFC is not shown, as such, its important to make sure your RFC is included in your Zoom account.

subTitles: ¿Qué debo hacer si soy agente de retención del IVA y olvidé informar a Zoom?
body:
La confirmación del estado de agente de retención del IVA en Colombia se puede introducir en cualquier momento en el portal de facturación de Zoom.Si introduce "VAT Agent" o "Agente de retención del IVA" antes de que se expida la próxima factura, Zoom no le aplicará el IVA.Si no se ha introducido el estado de "VAT Agent" o "Agente de retención del IVA" antes de que se expida la próxima factura, se le aplicará el IVA.

Si ha introducido su estado de agente de retención del IVA y anteriormente se le cobró el IVA en sus facturas, podrá solicitar a Zoom el reembolso de ese impuesto respecto de cualquier factura expedida dentro de los treinta días anteriores a proporcionar un número de identificación fiscal válido.  Sin embargo, no se devolverá el IVA de ninguna factura fuera de ese plazo de treinta días.

pageTitle: Using the web-based Zoom Rooms controller
body:
With the web Zoom Rooms controller, a Zoom Rooms admin can remotely control Zoom Rooms from anywhere in the world allowing for remote assistance, configuration, or even troubleshooting. For example, you can use the web-based controller to:


* Test a new Zoom Room setup
* Troubleshoot an issue with a Zoom Room
* Help room participants troubleshooting an issue during a meeting or phone call

This article covers:


* [Limitations](#h_01EQVV2AEH394YB0Z8MN53WF2R)
* [Accessing the web-based controller](#h_01EQVV2F6AQZH6WDC1VN6PRBBX)

subTitles: New updates for Virtual Room Connector (VRC)
body: * **AES 256-bit GCM encryption support** Zoom is upgrading to the AES 256-bit GCM encryption standard, which offers increased protection of your meeting data in transit and resistance against tampering. This provides confidentiality and integrity assurances on your Zoom Meeting, Zoom Video Webinar, and Zoom Phone data. This feature will be automatically enabled for all accounts on May 30. For H.323/SIP devices, GCM encryption will be used between the Cloud Room Connector and the Meeting connector, to ensure codec compatibility.

**Note**: These privileges will only apply to the [specified target call queues](#h_01EFHY1XYS0AZS6WM2BKA8M1GS).


* **Manage Basic Information**: [View or edit basic information](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360021524831) including name, phone number, extension number, time zone, prompt language and site.
* **Configure Automatic Call Recording**: View or edit the [policy setting for automatic call recordings](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360033511872).
* Voicemail Access: View and play [voicemail](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360021524831#h_01e1f9ab-18dd-441b-a7d8-12b05288108a).


	+ Download: Download voicemail.
	+ Delete: Delete voicemail.
* Recording Access: View and play [recordings](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360038521091).


	+ Download: Download recordings.
	+ Delete: Delete recordings.
* Call Log: View or edit [call log](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360021114452) entries for the target call queues.


* All Other Features: View or edit all other features and settings not covered by the privileges above.

subTitles: Are there any VAT obligations for me as a customer?
body:
Customers who carry out activities that are subject to VAT in Chile may need to self-assess VAT on the services purchased from Zoom.

If you checked the box indicating that you carry out activities that are subject to VAT in Chile and entered a valid Chilean Tax ID number in the Zoom billing portal no VAT will be charged to you.

You are required to notify Zoom if there is a change in your VAT status by unchecking the box indicating that you are carrying out activities subject to VAT in Chile and removing the Chilean Tax ID number from the Zoom billing portal.

Call park allows phone users to place a call on hold and let another phone user to resume the call from any phone or Zoom client. After parking a call, Zoom Phone generates a retrieval code. Any other phone user can use the retrieval code to resume the call. Admins can set routing rules if parked calls are not answered after a specified amount of time.

This article covers:

pageTitle: Common issues and questions for porting
body:
When [requesting to port your phone numbers,](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/sections/360007663452) you may come across these common porting issues. Read this article for common porting issues and how to resolve them.

**Note**: To make the porting process easier, submit the Customer Service Record (CSR) of the losing provider when you submit a porting request.

This article covers:


* [Best practices](#h_ca8ebe20-5c43-4157-8f73-f0d66db37e80)

pageTitle: This Zoom Account Does Not Exist
body:
**Overview**

If you receive the message "This Zoom Account Does Not Exist" when attempting to reset your password, this means that there is no account found with the provided email address and a Zoom-specific password. There are 4 login methods: email address and Zoom-specific password, Google login, Facebook login, and Single Sign-on (SSO). Your account may exist with a different login type or the email address may be spelled incorrectly.

[![badlogin.gif](https://support.zoom.us/hc/article_attachments/115018361326/badlogin.gif)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/article_attachments/115018361326/badlogin.gif)

**Instructions**

If you receive this message when trying to reset your password and may not have an existing Zoom account, you can [sign-up](https://zoom.us/signup) for a free account.

If you should have an account under this email address, check the following:


* Confirm that the email address is spelled correctly
* Try logging in with Google or Facebook
* If part of a business or education account, try logging in with Single Sign-on (SSO) at your vanity URL, eg. myorganization.zoom.us

**Reset Facebook Password**

If you need to reset your Facebook password, see the **[Facebook Password Help Center](https://www.facebook.com/help/213395615347144).**

**Reset Google Password**

If you need to reset your Google password, please see the **[Gmail Password Help Center](https://support.google.com/mail/answer/41078?hl=en).**

**Reset Single Sign-On Password**

If you need to reset the password for your Single Sign-On account, you will need to reach out to your organization's IT department or the department who issued your login.

1. Click the Windows icon![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/misc/windows/windows-8-start-icon.png) in the taskbar.
2. Click the **down arrow**, in the bottom left corner, to access **All Apps**.
3. Scroll to the apps until you see Zoom, then click **Start Zoom**.

subTitles: Adding poll questions using the web portal
body:
1. Sign in to the Zoom web portal.
2. Go to the [**Meetings**](https://zoom.us/profile/setting) page and click on your scheduled meeting. If you do not have a scheduled meeting, [schedule a meeting](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362413-How-Do-I-Schedule-Meetings-) now.
3. Scroll to the bottom to find the **Poll** option.
4. Click **Add** to begin creating the poll.
5. Enter a title and your first question.


	* (Optional) Click the **Anonymous** check box to make the poll anonymous, which will keep the participant's polling information anonymous in the meeting and in the reports.
	* Select whether you want the question to be single choice (participants can only choose one answer) or multiple choice (participants can choose multiple answers).
6. Type in the answers to your question and click **Save** at the bottom.


7. If you would like to add a new question, click **Add a Question** to create a new question for that particular poll.

* Business, Education, or Enterprise account
* Vanity URL
* IT/Webmaster who is familiar with [HTML/CSS](http://www.w3schools.com/css/)

pageTitle: Streaming a Meeting or Webinar on YouTube Live
subTitles: Enabling Youtube Live Streaming for Meetings
body:
To enable all members of your organization to live stream meetings on Youtube:


1. Sign in to the Zoom web portal as an administrator with the privilege to edit account settings.
2. Click **Account Management** > [**Account Settings**](https://zoom.us/account/setting).
3. Toggle the **Allow live streaming the meetings** under **In Meeting (Advanced)**, and enable **Youtube.**![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/web/my-meeting-settings/enable-live-stream-meeting.png)
4. (Optional) If you want to make this setting mandatory for all users in your account, click the lock icon, and then click **Lock**to confirm the setting.

1. Sign in to the Zoom web portal.
2. In the navigation panel, click **Room Management**, then click [**Cisco/Polycom Rooms**](https://go.zoom.us/interop#/interop/rooms).
3. Click the [**Rooms**](https://go.zoom.us/interop#/interop/rooms) tab.![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/h.323-sip/room-management/rooms-tab.png)
4. Click **Edit** next to the room you want to edit.![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/h.323-sip/room-management/edit-room.png)

pageTitle: Using file sharing integrations (Box, Google Drive, Microsoft OneDrive and SharePoint)
subTitles: Sharing a file in a chat or in-meeting chat
body:
You can share a file in chat or in-meeting chat. Shared files are not directly uploaded to Zoom chat. Instead, this will create a shareable link for the file and post it in chat. Contacts in the chat can click the file to open a browser and view the file using the third-party file sharing service.


1. Sign in to Zoom desktop client or mobile.
2. Access chat or in-meeting chat:


	* **Chat**: Click or tap the **Chat** tab.
	* [**In-meeting chat**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203650445): Start or join a meeting, then click or tap **Chat** in the [meeting controls](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360021921032).
3. Access the option to share a file:


	* **Desktop client**: Click **File** then click the file sharing service.
	* **Mobile app**: Tap the plus icon (**+**), then tap **File**.
4. Click or tap **Connect**.


5. Follow the on-screen instructions to authorize Zoom to access your account.
You will see a web page with your files.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/integration/office-365/onedrive/files-shareable-in-chat.png)
6. Select the file you want to share.
**Note**: If you're sharing a SharePoint file, you need to select the SharePoint site before viewing the file directory.
7. In the bottom panel. select one of these sharing options:


	* **Anyone in your organization**: Only members in your organization can click the link to view or download the file.
	**Note**:
	
	
		+ If you're sharing a Google Drive file, enter your organization's domain.
		+ If you're sharing a OneDrive and SharePoint file, this option is only available for work or school accounts.
	* **Anyone with the link**: Anyone with the link can view or download the file.
8. Click or tap **Choose**.
The file's permissions will change so that others can access it.


9. When prompted by your browser, click or tap the option to open Zoom.
Zoom will post a link to the shared file. Contacts in the chat can click the link to open a browser and view the file in the third-party file sharing service.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/generic/chat/shared-onedrive-file.png)

**Note**: By sharing the file, you are changing the file permissions in the third-party file sharing service. If you no longer want to share a file and need to revert permissions, sign in to your third-party file sharing account.

After enabling SMS at the account level, you can [access policy settings](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360033511872) to enable SMS at the phone user or [site](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360020809672) level.

subTitles: الأسئلة الشائعة - ضريبة القيمة المضافة في المملكة العربية السعودية
إذا كان لديّ رقم ضريبة القيمة المضافة ونسيت إدخاله، ما الذي سيترتبعلى ذلك؟
body:
يمكن إدخال رقم ضريبة القيمة المضافة في أي وقت.إذا تم إدخال الرقم قبل إصدار الفاتورة التالية، فلن تفرض Zoom ضريبة القيمة المضافة على الفاتورة التالية أو الفواتير المستقبلية الصادرة لك.إذا لم يتم إدخال رقم ضريبة القيمة المضافة حتى وقت إصدار الفاتورة التالية، فسيتم فرض ضريبة القيمة المضافة حتى يتم إدخال رقم صالح لضريبة القيمة المضافة.

إذا تم إدخال رقم صالح لضريبة القيمة المضافة وكانت هناك ضريبة قيمة مضافة تم فرضها على الفواتير الصادرة لك سلفًا، فقد تعمل Zoom، بناءً على طلبك، على رد أي ضريبة قيمة مضافة مدرجة في الفواتير الصادرة في الثلاثين يومًا السابقة لتقديم رقم صالح لضريبة القيمة المضافة. ولكن لن يتم رد ضريبة القيمة المضافة على أي فواتير صادرة خارج نطاق فترة الثلاثين يومًا هذه.

pageTitle: Setting Up the Polycom Trio as a Zoom Rooms Controller
body:

If you purchased a Polycom Trio for Zoom Rooms kit with Zoom pre-configured or the Trio is displaying the Zoom Room Controller pairing interface as shown below, follow these steps:

pageTitle: New Updates for Zoom Connector for Cisco/Polycom
body:
* Minor Bug Fixes

March 16, 2020 Version **4.1.69**

The attendee controls appear at the bottom of your screen, except for Leave meeting which appears at the top-right corner.

![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/mobile/generic/attendee-controls.png)

**Mute** / **Unmute**: Mute or unmute your microphone.

**Video**: Start and stop your own video.

**Share**: Start a screen share. You'll be able to select what you want to share. [Learn more.](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362153-How-Do-I-Share-My-Screen-)

**Participants**: See who's currently in the meeting. The participants list also gives you access to these options:


* Tap your name if you want to rename yourself or raise your hand.
* **Invite**: [Invite others to join](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362183) your meeting.

**More**:


* [Non-verbal feedback](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115001286183) icons (if enabled by the host: Tapping an icon will notify the host by placing the icon beside your name in the participants list. For example, the hand icon places the raise hand icon beside your name and simulates a hand raise.
* **Chat:** Access the chat window to [chat with other participants](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203650445).
* **View Full Transcript**: If Live Transcription has been enabled by the host, you can view the full transcript here.
* **Raise Hand**
* **Meeting Settings**: Access to some personal settings related to the meeting you are currently participating in.
* **Virtual Background**: Configure and enable the [virtual background feature](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/210707503).

Companion mode integrates Zoom meetings with your provisioned desk phone. With companion mode, you can do the following:


* Join a scheduled Zoom meeting and use your desk phone as the audio device.
For example: You can join a meeting after seeing a calendar notification. After joining the meeting using the Zoom desktop client, you can press the Zoom meeting key on your desk phone to join audio using your desk phone.
* Receive a meeting invite and join the meeting using your desk phone as the audio device.
For example: A colleague using the Zoom desktop client invites you to an instant meeting. You will see an incoming call on your desk phone and accept it to join audio using your desk phone. You can also accept the meeting invite on the desktop client to enable video and screen sharing.

This article covers:


* [Adding the line key for companion mode](#h_01EK3KQRDM9PXGAJ6SXQD07VAN)
* [Joining a scheduled Zoom meeting and using your desk phone as the audio device](#h_01EK3KQW1D80N2K4B7G065PTRJ)
* [Receiving a meeting invite and joining the meeting using your desk phone as the audio device](#h_01EK3KR04H5GQ15Z2R4851VV14)
* [Recommended meeting settings](#h_01EKBAGFKNGQQ3CKER41PFWYQP)


	+ [Waiting Room](#h_01EKBAKX50CKWBR674AY1ZJQXY)
	+ [Video preview](#h_01EKBAM1ZA5MMY6S90BVEX7RQF)
	+ [Computer audio](#h_01EKBAM6ECCTH4CFYZKVDX9ZH6)

* Resolves an issue where users are not able to see all uploaded digital signage content
* Resolves an issue where some webinar registrants are prompted to register repeatedly when automatic approval is enabled
* Resolves an issue where a subset of users received email reminders for webinars in the wrong language
* Minor bug fixes

December 22, 2019

**Resolved Issues (Zoom Phone)**


* Minor Bug Fixes

December 15, 2019

**New and Enhanced Features**


* **Admin Features**


	+ **Select Assigned Phone Numbers to be Replaced with Ported Numbers**During the Zoom Phone porting process, account owners and admins can select which assigned phone numbers will be replaced when porting is complete.
	+ **Contact Center Integration with Talkdesk**Account owners and admins can use an auto receptionist to route calls to a Talkdesk contact center.

**Resolved Issues**


* Minor Bug Fixes

December 9, 2019

Resolved Issues


* Minor Bug Fixes

December 1, 2019

**Changes to Existing Features**


* **Managed Domain Improvements**If you sign in with an email address that belongs to an account with managed domain that you are not already a part of, you will be prompted to join the account or change your email address.

**New and Enhanced Features**


* **Admin Features**


	+ **Customize Recording Consent Message**Account owners and admins can now customize the recording consent pop up message. This includes customizing the title and description of up to 130 characters, as well as adding a link. For users to see the customized recording consent message, they will need to be on Zoom Client 4.6.0 or higher.
	+ **Support for 15-digit Extension Numbers**Account owners and admins can set [extension numbers](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360021058071#h_4f82eef6-339f-4445-8a75-a335bb37d237) that are up to 15-digits. Long extension numbers can be distinguished from direct phone numbers.
	+ **International Phone Number Formats**Phone numbers are correctly formatted based on the associated country.
	+ **View IP Address of Desk Phones**Account owners and admins can view the [IP address of provisioned desk phones](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360021119092#h_9bdc41cf-d021-4dcc-9efe-9befe665d2d1).
	+ **Site Admin Role**Account owners and admins can [assign phone users to manage settings for specific sites](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360020809672#h_dbe188d2-abe9-4e8f-a09f-46bc90bd8000).
	+ **Shared Global Directory**Account owners and admins can [create a shared global directory](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360037050092) by importing contacts in a CSV file.
	+ **Filter Zoom Phone Usage Metrics by Site**If they created multiple sites, account owners and admins can [filter metrics for call queues and phone users by site](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360021086452#h_2307c34e-9846-414c-863e-76aa00d36f05).
	+ **Phone Number Validation**Account owners and admins can only add valid phone numbers when [adding numbers to the blocked list](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360021146872) or [setting up call forwarding](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360021058071#h_076bca43-21be-48dc-8709-aeb0028e4571).
	+ **Customize Audio Prompt for Automatic Call Recordings**Account owners and admins can [customize the audio prompt](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360037567431) that notifies both parties that the call will be recorded.
	+ **Batch Resync Desk Phones**Account owners and admins can [resync several provisioned desk phones](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360021119092#h_e5d9f0c5-45ca-42c3-8fca-f2ade393e823) at once.
	+ **Buy a Specific Amount of Direct Phone Numbers**Account owners and admins can [buy all phone numbers in the search results](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360020808292#h_007ec8c2-0914-4265-8351-96ab23efa3ad) instead of individually selecting each number.
	+ **Filter Call Quality Data by Site**Account owners and admins can [view call quality data for a specific site](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360021086452#h_6670f72b-cf1c-427b-bc42-0101c883384a) if they have [multiple sites](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360020809672).
	+ **View Headset Model in Call Quality Data**Account owners and admins can [view the headset model in call quality data](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360021086452#h_6670f72b-cf1c-427b-bc42-0101c883384a) to help troubleshoot issues with hardware.
	+ **Support for Zero Touch Provisioning of AudioCodes Phones**[Supported AudioCodes phones](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360001299063) will automatically configure themselves out of the box using [zero touch provisioning (ZTP)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360033223411) after they are added in the Zoom web portal.
	+ **Display SIP Zone of Single Site Accounts**If the account does not have multiple sites, account owners and admins can [view the SIP zone](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360025846692). The SIP zone automatically selected based on the emergency address.
	+ **International Phone Number Formats**Phone numbers are correctly formatted based on the associated country.
	+ **Manage Desk Phone Templates**Account owners and admins can [add, edit, or delete custom phone templates](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360035817952) to change phone settings during provisioning.
	+ **Search Phone Numbers by City**Account owners and admins can [search for available phone numbers by city](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360020808292#h_007ec8c2-0914-4265-8351-96ab23efa3ad), making it easy to identify cities that share the same area code.
	+ **Enhanced Call Log**[Call log](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360021114452) entries for call queues and auto receptionists show how incoming calls were routed.
	+ **Customize Queue Music for Call Queues**Account owners and admins can [customize the audio that plays when an inbound call to a call queue is placed on hold](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360021524831#music-on-hold). The setting for audio that plays while routing to an available member has been renamed to **Audio While Connecting**.
	+ **Contact Center Integration with Genesys**Account owners and admins can use an [auto receptionist](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360021121312) to route calls to a Genesys contact center.
* **User Features**


	+ **Change the Maximum Ring Duration Before Routing to Voicemail**Users can [change how long calls will ring before they are routed to their voicemail](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360021325712#max-wait-time).
	+ **International Phone Number Formats**Phone numbers are correctly formatted based on the associated country.
	+ **Phone Number Validation**Users can only add valid phone numbers when adding numbers to the [blocked list](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360021325712#blocked-list) or setting up [call forwarding](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360021325712#business-hours).
	+ **Change Caller ID for Line Keys**Users with a desk phone can [change the caller ID number for their lines](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360036860751). They can select the default caller ID number, the company number, a call queue number, or they can hide their caller ID.
	+ **Customize Display Name for Line Keys**Users with a desk phone can [customize the display name for each line key](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360036860751). This helps identify line keys if they have access to multiple direct numbers or shared lines.

**Resolved Issues**


* Minor Bug Fixes

November 24, 2019

**Changes to Existing Features**


* **Enhanced Authentication Options for Joining a Meeting**The settings “Only signed in users can join meetings” and “Only signed in users with specific domains can join meetings” are now available as “Only authenticated users can join meetings”. Once this setting is enabled, the admin can set authentication requirements for users to join a meeting and define authentication profiles. These settings are now also available at the group and user level. For accounts currently using the existing settings, the settings will be renamed on the web portal, but the requirements to join a meeting will remain the same.
* **Restrict Cloud Recording Views to Signed in Users or by Domain**Account owners and admins can now require cloud recording viewers to be signed in to a Zoom account or signed in to a Zoom account with a specific domain, in place of the setting “Share cloud recordings only with members of my account”. Authentication profiles can also be used to configure who can view cloud recordings.

**New and Enhanced Features**


* **Language Interpretation for Meetings and Webinars**Meeting hosts can now designate interpreters for their Zoom meeting or webinar on the Zoom web portal or during a Zoom session. Interpreters will hear the main audio channel and can speak into the language channel which they’ve been assigned. Participants choose which audio channel they would like to hear. This feature requires participants to be on Zoom Client 4.5 or later.
* **Admin Features**


	+ **View and Edit Job Title and Location/Address under User Management**Account owners and admins can now view and edit account members job titles and locations/addresses under User Management.
	+ **Authentication Profiles for Meeting Participants and Recording Access**Account owners and admins can now create authentication profiles at the account or group level which require meeting participants to sign in before joining a Zoom meeting or viewing a cloud recording. Authentication profiles can require that a user is signed in to Zoom or requiring that they are signed in to a Zoom account with a specific domain.
* **User Features**


	+ **Meeting Templates**Users can now save meeting settings as a template and when scheduling a meeting, use saved templates to create a new meeting with the same settings. This cannot be used with Personal Meeting ID (PMI).
	+ **Email Template for Inviting Attendees to a Webinar without Registration**Account owners and admins can now customize the email for inviting attendees that the webinar host copies from the webinar details page in Email Branding for groups.
* **Web Client Features**


	+ **Support for Co-host**Users on the web client can now be assigned co-host functionality.
	+ **Screen Sharing Enhancements**
	
	
		- **Switch between Simultaneous Screen Shares**If multiple participants are sharing their screen, users joined from the web client can switch between the shared screens.
		- **Web Setting to Limit Screen Sharing to the Host Only**The web client will now follow the web setting to only allow the host to share their screen within a meeting or webinar.
	+ **Accessibility Enhancements**

November 18, 2019

November 17, 2019

**Changes to Existing Features**


* **Waiting Room for Zoom Rooms**Zoom Rooms can now use waiting rooms as a host or participant. As the host, the Zoom Room can see who joins and admit them to the meeting. If the waiting room feature is locked at the account level, waiting room will be used for Zoom Rooms. If the setting is on but not locked for accounts, the feature will be off and can be enabled at the room level. This feature requires Zoom Rooms for Mac version 4.3.0 (446.0130) or higher or Zoom Rooms for PC 4.5.0 (1032.0906) or higher.
* **Zoom Rooms Trial Changes**At the end of a Zoom Rooms trial period, account owners and admins will now be warned that the trial has expired, instead of automatically purchasing Zoom Rooms licenses for the account. To continue using Zoom Rooms, they can purchase licenses via the Billing page of the Zoom web portal.
* **Automatically Restrict Registrants for Fee-based Webinars**For fee-based webinars using the Paypal integration, registration will automatically be restricted once the webinar license capacity is reached. The webinar host will receive an email notifying them when the number of registrants reaches 80% of the webinar capacity.
* **ISO-3166 country list for Webinar Registration**Webinar registration will now utilize country codes that leverage the International Organization for Standardization (ISO) 3166 standard.

**New and Enhanced Features**


* **Administrator Features**


	+ **Customize Email Templates for Groups**Account owners and admins can now customize email templates at the group level. This feature is available for Business, Education, and API plans.
	+ **Limit Screen Sharing to Applications Only**Account owners and admins can now limit screen sharing to applications only, preventing the host and participants from sharing their entire Desktop. This can be enabled and locked at the account or group level. This setting requires participants to be on the Zoom Desktop Client 4.6 or later, which will be released in December 2019.
	+ **Chat Announcements**Account owners and admins can now choose specific users to send one-way announcements to everyone in the same account. You can add up to 50 users who can send announcements. This setting requires users to be on the Zoom Client 4.6 or later, which will be released in December 2019.
	+ **Set Chat as the Default Tab for First-time Users**Account owners and admins can now set chat to be the default tab the first time that users open their Zoom client. This feature requires the Zoom Desktop Client Version 4.5. or higher.
	+ **Specify File Types for In-Meeting File Transfer**Account owners and admins can now choose which file types can be shared within a Zoom meeting.
	+ **Option to Embed Meeting Password in Join Link or Require Manual Entry**Account owners and admins can now choose if they want to embed the meeting password in the join link for a one-click meeting join experience or require participants to manually enter the password when joining a meeting or webinar. By default, this setting will be enabled.
	+ **Lock Personal Link Name**Account owners and admins can now enable a web setting to prevent account members from changing their personal link name. If enabled, only admins can change members’ personal links and members cannot set new personal link names.
	+ **Exclude Users and Groups from SAML Mapping Rules**Individual users and groups can now be excluded from specific SAML mapping rules. This can be configured on the SAML Response Mapping page of Single Sign On.
	+ **Additional SAML Mapping Fields**Account owners and admins can now map users’ company names, job titles, and location/addresses via SSO.
	+ **View SAML Response Logs**Account owners and admins can now view SAML response logs on their Zoom web portal to troubleshoot SSO issues.
	+ **Setting to Show One Person Meetings in Dashboard**Account owners and admins can now view one person meetings in Dashboard by enabling the web setting **Show one person meetings on Dashboard and Reports**.
	+ **SIP Connected Audio in Dashboard**Dashboard will now indicate if a user joined via SIP audio dial-in or call-out.
	+ **Setting to Hide H.323 Devices from the Contacts List**Account owners and admins can now choose whether or not to show H.323 contacts in the contacts list from the IM Management page.
	+ **Setting for Zoom Rooms Advanced Noise Suppression**Zoom Rooms admins can now enable Advanced Noise Suppression on the web, to eliminate background noise. This setting can also be enabled or disabled on the Room Controller.  This setting requires users to be on Zoom Rooms Controller Version 4.6 or later, which will be released in December 2019.
	+ **Enhanced Invoice History**Account owners and admins with billing access can now export multiple invoices at once and sort invoice history by the invoice date or due date.
	+ **Reactivate Cancelled Plans**Account owners and admins with billing access can now reactivate plans that had been cancelled within the Zoom web portal.
	+ **List Department in the Active Host Report and Dashboard**User’s departments will now be listed in the active host reports and dashboard to more easily view meeting statistics across departments.
* **User Features**


	+ **Import Webinar Registrants**Webinar hosts can now import a CSV file of webinar registrants. This import includes the first name, last name, and email address of the attendee. Up to 100 attendees can be imported at once.
	+ **Speaker Names Displayed in Transcription Files**Speaker names will now be included in transcription (VTT) files to more easily identify which participant was speaking.
	+ **Job Title and Location on My Profile**Users can now set and edit a job title and location on their user profile page.
	+ **Webinar Reports Accessible Up to One Year**Attendee, Performance, Q&A, and polling reports for webinars will now be available for one year after the date of the webinar.

October 27, 2019

**New and Enhanced Features**


* **Administrator Features**


	+ **Disable Auto-Delete for a Cloud Recording**Admins can now disable auto-delete for specific cloud recordings under Recording Management. If an admin disables auto-delete for a cloud recording, it can still be manually deleted or they can re-enable auto-delete.
	+ **Setting to Disable Recovery of Deleted Cloud Recordings**Admins can now choose if they want deleted recordings to be stored in the Trash for 30 days after deletion, or if cloud recordings should be permanently deleted immediately. This is configured at the account level and by default, recordings will be stored in the Trash.
	+ **Setting to Restrict Screen Sharing to Host**Admins can now enable a setting on the web portal which will restrict screensharing to the host only and/or only allow the host to start a new share when someone else is sharing. This setting is available at the account, group, and user level and can be locked for the account or a group.
	+ **Group Setting for Message Archiving with Smarsh**Admins can now configure Zoom chat message archiving and storage with Smarsh for a group of users.
	+ **Granular Dashboard Permission**Admins can now create custom roles to access individual tabs of Dashboard, such as the Zoom Rooms or Webinar tab. Admins can also give some users advanced permissions, such as the ability to Join as an Assistant or end the meeting.
	+ **Zoom Device Management (ZDM)**Admins can now enroll Apple and Windows devices in ZDM. Zoom Device Management is Zoom Room’s mobile device management tool, which allows admins to perform certain actions on enrolled devices. For more information, see [Getting Started with Zoom Device Management](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360032285752-Getting-Started-with-Zoom-Device-Management-ZDM-).
