September 29, 2019

**Changes to Existing Features**


* **Admin Features**


	+ **Require Passwords for all Meetings**Admins can require users to create a password when scheduling Zoom meetings. This feature will only apply to newly scheduled meetings and instant meetings, although admins can also choose to set a password for all previously scheduled meetings if needed. The meeting password is embedded into the join URL, so this should not affect users joining by clicking on a Zoom link. This feature is on by default for all accounts, but can be enabled or disabled for the entire account, groups of users, or specific users. [Learn more about the new password settings.](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360033331271)
	+ **Control Desk Phone Web Server**Provisioned desk phone’s web servers are disabled by default. Account owners and admins can enable desk phones’ web servers in the Zoom web portal.

**New and Enhanced Features**


* **Admin Features**


	+ **Sort SAML Mapping Rules**Account owners and admins can now sort SAML mapping rules by clicking the up or down arrow, add new SAML rules by clicking the plus sign or delete existing ones by clicking the minus sign.
	+ **Assign Zoom Room Admins and Group Admins via SAML Mapping**Account owners and admins can now configure SAML mapping rules to assign users to be Zoom Room admins or admins of a particular group.
	+ **Setting to Randomize Client Feedback Survey**Admins can now enable a setting to randomize the client feedback survey. When enabled, the survey will be randomly displayed after meetings, instead of after every single meeting.
	+ **Private IP Addresses for CRC devices in Dashboard**The Meetings page of Dashboard will now display the private IP addresses for CRC devices, in addition to the public IP address for each participant. This will help admins more accurately troubleshoot potential network issues.
	+ **Webinar Attendee QoS in Dashboard**Account owners and admins can now view detailed connection information, such as packet loss and latency for webinar attendees.
	+ **View Zoom Room Usage by Check-in in Dashboard**Dashboard will now show information about checked in and released zoom rooms for admins to better understand Zoom Room utilization.
	+ **Export List of Softphone Users**Account owners and admins can now export a list of softphone users.
	+ **Change Site of Common Area Phones**Account owners and admins can change the site of common area phones without re-provisioning.
	+ **Email Notifications for Offline Desk Phones**Account owners and admins can enable user email notifications when assigned desk phones are offline for a specific amount of time.
	+ **Resend Zoom Phone Invitation Email**Account owners and admins can resend the invitation email to users that have not activated their Zoom Phone account.
	+ **Zoom Phone Usage Reporting**Account owners and admins can view phone usage statistics including calls received, calls made, missed calls, calls forwarded to voicemail, and average call time.
	+ **Share Voicemail Inbox of Call Queues and Auto Receptionists**If a call queue or auto receptionist routes to a voicemail inbox, account owners and admins can share the inbox with phone users.
	+ **Repeat IVR Menu Prompt**By default, IVR menus allow callers to dial star (*) to repeat the IVR menu prompt. If the caller repeats the IVR menu prompt more than three times, account owners and admins can set an option to disconnect or route the call.
	+ **Assisted Provisioning of AudioCodes Devices**Account owners and admins can start the provisioning process for the following AudioCodes IP phones: 405, 405HD, 420HD, 440HD, and 445HD.
	+ **Support for Emergency Addresses in the UK or Australia**If account owners and admins have the main company number in the UK or Australia, they can enter an emergency address located in the respective country.
	+ **Specify Ring Duration for Call Queues**Account owners and admins can specify the ring duration of call queue members if the call distribution method is set to sequential or rotating.
	+ **Control Outbound Caller ID**Account owners and admins can prevent users from changing their outbound caller ID.
	+ **Set International Calling Rules**Account owners and admins can enable or disable international calling at the account or user level.
	+ **Automatic Call Recording**Account owners and admins can automatically record outbound and/or inbound calls for specific users.
	+ **Set Call Recording Rules**Account owners and admins can enable or disable call recording at the account or user level.
	+ **Call Delegation and Shared Lines**Account owners and admins can assign a delegate to make and receive phone calls on behalf of another phone user.
* **User Features**


	+ **Use Same Password for Telephone and CRC Participants**If a user creates a meeting password using only numbers, the same password will be used for telephone and CRC participants.
	+ **Additional Meeting and Webinar Registration Report Options**When generating a registration report, users can now select if they want the report to include all attendees, only approved attendees, or only denied attendees.
	+ **Additional Webinar Attendee Report Field**The webinar attendee report will now list the maximum number of concurrent attendees.
	+ **Callout and Call Me Support for Brunei**
	+ **Support for iPadOS 13**
	+ **Forward Calls to Extension or Direct Phone Number**Users can forward calls during business or closed hours to a phone user, common area phone, call queue, or auto receptionist in the same organization.
	+ **Support for Multiple Lines on Desk Phones**Users with desk phones that support multiple lines can select a line for outbound calling and use the associated direct phone number as their caller ID. The user’s default outbound caller ID will be the default line.
	+ **Share Voicemail Inbox**Users can allow other phone users to view and manage their voicemail inbox.
	+ **Access Settings for Call Queue Managers and Auto Receptionist Operators**Users that are assigned as a call queue manager or auto receptionist operator can access call queue and auto receptionist settings.
	+ **Require Users to Dial 1 Before Forwarding Call**Users that set up call forwarding can require callers to dial 1 before calls are connected. Users will hear an audio prompt with the instructions.
* **Integration Features**


	+ **Support for Canadian Dollars with the PayPal Integration**
	+ **Changes to Panopto ID in Audit Logs**Changes to a user’s Panopto ID will now be displayed in the account audit logs.

August 17, 2019

**Changes to Existing Features**


* **Integrations on Zoom Marketplace**Zoom Marketplace is now the preferred place for integrations. Previously setup integrations are still accessible through the integrations tab, but any new integration setup will require visiting the Marketplace. Existing integrations are encouraged to start using Marketplace integration apps instead of older versions.

**New and Enhanced Features**


* **Admin Features**


	+ **Saving Chats in Meetings**Admins can disable the ability to save chats in Zoom meetings. Attendees will still be able to use the chat feature when saving chats is disabled.
	+ **Zoom Room Dashboard**The Zoom Rooms Dashboard will now display Mac and Windows OS build numbers, version information and computer names.
	+ **Zoom Support Chat Option**Admins can disable user access to Zoom Support chat if the account is using a vanity URL. This is meant for organizations who want to direct their users to contact their own IT department.
	+ **Zoom Room Under Construction Status**Admins can set a Zoom Room’s status to “Under Construction” and avoid receiving alerts on the Zoom Room dashboard about a room being built or tested.
	+ **Additional Attributes for OKTA**User group and User role can now be used as attributes with SCIM2 mapping.
	+ **Cloud Recording Password**Admins can require a password to be auto-generated for all shared cloud recordings. After generation, the user who owns the recording can change the password if desired.  The admin can enable this requirement for the entire account, groups of users, or specific users.
	+ **Manage Toll dial-in numbers**In addition to current controls for selectively enabling premium audio services for Toll-Free and Call-Me countries, Admins can now also control Toll numbers at the account and group level
	+ **Regional Audio Optimization**For telephone attendees to meetings, Administrators can now set regional audio preferences at the account, group, and user level. Intended for use by multinational customers, this setting will enable telephony audio bridging for meetings to occur in the region closest to the host.
	+ **Option to Restrict Sending Zoom Rooms for Touch Annotation to Contacts Only**Admins can choose to only allow annotations to be sent to contacts within their Zoom account or allow annotations to be sent to contacts and email addresses.
* **User Features**


	+ **Pre-Assign Breakout Rooms**The meeting host can pre-assign users to specific breakout rooms. They can add the users by email address on the web or they can import a user list from a CSV. Users need to be logged in to their Zoom account to be correctly assigned to the right breakout room.
	+ **Change to PMI Notification**When a user schedules a meeting with PMI, a notice will appear informing the user that the PMI settings will change if a different configuration is selected.
	+ **Zoom Sharing Key Ease of Use**Users who visit share.zoom.us and click Share Screen will be prompted to download the client if they have not already done so. The client will launch automatically after installed and display the “enter sharing key” interface.
	+ **Meeting Cancellation From Outlook**Users can delete scheduled Zoom meetings from Outlook without having to delete the same meetings from the web or client.
	+ **Join Meeting Workflow on iOS Devices**iOS devices will prompt users to download the Zoom app upon first use instead of immediately redirecting users to the app store.
* **Web Client Features**


	+ **Allow Call-In Attendees to Unmute in Webinar**The webinar host can now allow attendees who have called in to the meeting by telephone to unmute themselves by clicking Allow to Talk in the Attendee list.

		- GET /v2/metrics/meetings/{meetingId}/participants
		- GET /v2/metrics/webinars/{webinarId}/participants
	+ **Added new query parameter (“notify\_registrants”) to Webinar APIs**
	
	
		- *PATCH /v2/webinars/{webinarId}*
	+ **Added rate limit to Meeting APIs. A maximum of 100 meetings can be created/updated for a single user in one day.**
	
	
		- *POST /v1/meeting/create*
		- *POST /v1/meeting/update*
		- *POST /v2/users/{userId}/meetings*
		- *PATCH /v2/meetings/{meetingId}*

**Resolved Features**


* Resolved an issue where a cookie usage message prevented registration on some mobile devices.
* Resolved an issue where users were unable to complete a purchase.
* Resolved an issue where active Zoom Room displays were listed as disconnected on the web dashboard.
* Resolved an issue where admins were unable to upload .CSV user lists.
* Minor Bug Fixes

You can view details about registration in PayPal.


1. Sign in to your [PayPal account](https://paypal.com/).
2. Under **Completed**, locate the name of the registrant that you would like to view full details for. Click on their transaction.[![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/integration/paypal/completed-payment.png)](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/integration/paypal/completed-payment.png)Full details about the transaction will now be displayed.![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/integration/paypal/transaction-details.png)

pageTitle: Setting up speed dial and busy lamp field (BLF)
body:
If you're an admin, you can access line key settings for any phone user or common are phone in the account.


1. Sign in to the Zoom web portal.
2. In the navigation menu, click **Phone System Management** then **[Users & Rooms](https://zoom.us/pbx/page/telephone/phoneUsers#/users)**.
3. Click the **Users** or **Common Area Phones** tab.
4. Click the name of the phone user or common area phone.
5. Click the **User Settings** tab (for phone users) or **Settings** tab (for common area phones).
6. In the **Keys & Positions** section, click **View or Edit**.
7. Click **Manage Key**.

**Note**:


* Some models with certain revision numbers are not supported. Refer to the [AudioCodes website](https://online.audiocodes.com/zoom-supported-models) for more information.
* For the 450HD, Zoom Phone only supports the generic SIP version. If you have Skype for Business (SfB) firmware, contact AudioCodes support to convert it to generic SIP.

**Overview**

The Zoom Skype for Business (Lync) Plugin allows Lync users 2010, 2013 and Skype for Business users to initiate a Zoom meeting from the contact list. If joining a webinar, users joining through Skype for Business/Lync will join as panelists.

This article covers:


* [Installation Procedure](#install)
* [How to start a Zoom meeting](#start)
* [How to start a Zoom meeting while in a Skype chat session](#startfromchat)

**Prerequisites**


* Zoom Client must be [3.5.16903.0522](/hc/en-us/articles/201361953) or higher
* [Zoom Skype for Business plugin](/hc/en-us/articles/204488669)
* Windows 7 or higher
* Lync 2010 and 2013

**Installation Procedure**


1. Install Skype for Business.
2. Download and install the Zoom Lync Plugin from the [Zoom Download Center](https://zoom.us/download).
3. Download and install the Zoom Client from the [Zoom Download Center](https://zoom.us/download).

**Note**: You will need to restart Skype for Business in order for the plugin to appear.

**How to start a Zoom Meeting**

Note: The following will require you to log into your Zoom account


1. Open Skype for Business and login.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/integration/office-365/skype-for-business/default-screen.png)
2. Right click on the user you wish to hold a video meeting with.
3. Select **Start Zoom Meeting** to start a Zoom meeting session with your contact.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/integration/office-365/skype-for-business/start-zoom-meeting.png)
4. This will automatically open up Zoom and start the meeting. If you are not signed it, it will require you to sign in, then start the meeting once you have signed in.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/windows/sign-in.png)

**How to start a Zoom meeting while in a Skype chat session**

Note: The following will require you to log into your Zoom account


1. Open a chat window with the user you with to chat with.
2. Select the **...** icon
3. Click on **Start Zoom Meeting** to activate a Zoom meeting session with this user
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/integration/office-365/skype-for-business/start-meeting-from-chat.png)

* Zoom Desktop Client


	+ Windows: 4.4.52570.0415 or higher
	+ macOS: 4.4.52551.0414 or higher
	+ Linux: 3.0.285090.0826 or higher
* Zoom Mobile App


	+ Android: 4.4.52504.0411 or higher
	+ iOS: 4.4.0 (52578.0415) or higher
* Zoom Rooms controller


	+ Android: 4.6.0 (40654.1216) or higher
	+ iOS: 4.6.0(214.1214) or higher
* Zoom Phone license

subTitles: Zoom, Türkiye Cumhuriyeti KDV uygulamasına tabi olan müşterileri nasıl tespit ediyor?
body:
Ürün ve hizmetlerin ülkede ikamet etmeyen ESH tedarikçileri tarafından sağlandığı durumlarda (Zoom bu kapsamdadır), B2C müşterilerin konumunun tespiti ile ilgili
olarak Türkiye Cumhuriyeti KDV Mevzuatında açık bir yönerge bulunmamaktadır.

Uygulamada, KDV kapsamı, B2C müşterisinin ikamet yerine ve ödeme anında seçilen uluslararası ülke koduna göre belirlenir.

Buna göre Zoom, “Sold To” (Satış Yeri) adresi bulunan tüm müşterilerin Türkiye’de ikamet ettiğini kabul ederek muamelede bulunur. Bu bilgiler, “Satış Yeri” olarak belirtilen ülkenin doğruluğunu teyit etmek amacıyla diğer verilerle çapraz kontrole tabidir.

Satış yeri adresinizin doğruluğundan emin olmak müşteri olarak sizin sorumluluğunuzdur.

pageTitle: How to set your iPad into "Supervised Mode"
body:
"Supervised Mode" allows you to manage your device remotely.


1. Download the latest version of **Apple Configurator 2** from the **App Store.**
2. Connect your device to the computer using a USB cable and select **Trust** when prompted on your iPad.
3. Turn off **Find My iPad** (Settings → Apple ID → iCloud).
4. Select **Prepare** icon on Apple Configurator 2.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/zoom-rooms/mdm/iPad-prepare.png)


5. Prepare with **Manual Configuration** and select **Supervise device,** **Allow devices to pair with other computers
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/zoom-rooms/mdm/iPad-prepare1.png)**


6. Choose a server if you are already enrolled in an MDM, otherwise select **Do not enroll in MDM.** This process is allowing for your device to be supervised, not enrolling you in Zoom's MDM
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/zoom-rooms/mdm/iPad-prepare2.png)


7. Create or select an organization
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/zoom-rooms/mdm/iPad-prepare3.png)


8. Choose which steps will be presented to the user in Setup Assistant and select **Prepare**. **Show all steps** recommended.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/zoom-rooms/mdm/iPad-prepare4.png)


9. Follow the Setup Assistant instructions on your iPad to finish setting your device into “**Supervised Mode**”. To verify your device is in supervised mode, navigate to Settings.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/zoom-rooms/mdm/iPad-prepare5.png)

subTitles: What if I am a VAT agent and forget to inform Zoom?
body:
Confirmation of your status as a VAT agent in Colombia can be entered at any time into Zoom’s billing portal.  If you have entered “VAT Agent” or “Agente de IVA” before the next invoice is issued, Zoom will not charge VAT.  If no “VAT Agent” or “Agente de IVA” status has been entered at the time the next invoice is issued, VAT will be charged.

If VAT agent status is entered and VAT has previously been charged on the invoices issued to you, then upon request by you, Zoom may refund any VAT included on invoices issued in the thirty days prior to a valid TAX ID number being provided.  However, VAT will not be refunded on any invoices issued outside of this thirty-day period.

* **Minor bug fixes**
* **Security enhancements**

* Audio-Visual Integration VS Cloud/Software system with integrated Audio System


	+ Complex Hardware Solution VS Simplified Hardware solution with the same user experience.
* Guides:


	+ [Zoom Rooms for Existing Room Systems: Codec Replacement Guide](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115005863963-Zoom-Rooms-for-Existing-Room-Systems)
	+ Pro AV - DSP Integrated Zoom Rooms
	
	
		- [Zoom Rooms for ProAV Rooms (7-13 people)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115005841223-Zoom-Rooms-for-ProAV-Rooms-7-13-people-)
		- [Zoom Rooms for ProAV Rooms (9-19 people)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115005856506-Zoom-Rooms-for-ProAV-Rooms-9-19-people-)
		- [Zoom Rooms For ProAV (All Hands Space)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115005848043-Zoom-Rooms-For-ProAV-All-Hands-Space-)

AV switching and control is no longer necessary as peripheral inputs are rarely a requirement in the conference room (ie. Bluray players, physical HDMI/VGA connections etc).  Now Zoom can be the wireless video solution to display a laptop and the switching system can be eliminated.

When control systems are necessary for environmental control (ie. Shades/Lighting), the [ZR-CSAPI is available to allow control of the ZR computer via a 3rd party controller](https://marketplace.zoom.us/docs/guides/zoom-rooms/zoom-rooms-cli).

Below you will see traditional AV switching environments with control systems and multiple switched inputs vs a DSP-integrated Cloud-Based system:

**Traditional Integration**

**(AV System - Codec as Peripheral Device)**

**Zoom Rooms Integrations**

**(Zoom Room as AV System)**

[![AV_System_Old.png](https://support.zoom.us/hc/article_attachments/360000386586/AV_System_Old.png)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/article_attachments/360000386586/AV_System_Old.png)  [![AV_System_-_New.png](https://support.zoom.us/hc/article_attachments/360000386546/AV_System_-_New.png)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/article_attachments/360000386546/AV_System_-_New.png)

Learn more about [Zoom Room Integrator Certification](https://certification.university.zoom.us/).

For any more details on Zoom Room integration, please send an email to: [integrator@zoom.us](mailto:integrator@zoom.us)

subTitles: How do I enter my VAT ID?
body:
To enter the VAT ID number, please follow these steps:


1. Sign into the Zoom Portal
2. Under Account Management, choose the Billing page
3. Under Billing Contact, choose to edit the VAT Number (which appears after the Billing Contact Address field)
4. Enter your VAT ID number and save

subTitles: Scheduling a meeting from Google Calendar
body:
1. Use a web browser to sign in to Google Calendar.
2. Click **Create** or click a time slot on the calendar for your meeting.
3. Enter your meeting details, like the title, location, and guest list. Click **More option** if needed.
**Note**: Only changes to the topic, date, time, and time zone will will sync to the meeting in the Zoom web portal and client/app. All other meeting details will only apply to the Google Calendar event.
4. In the **Add video conferencing** dropdown menu, select **Zoom Meeting**.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/integration/google/add-conferencing-dropdown-zoom-meetings.png)Google Calendar will add the join options for the Zoom meeting.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/integration/google/add-conferencing-zoom-meeting-details.png)
5. Click **Save**.
**Note**: The meeting settings are applied based on your [web portal settings](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115005756143). You can [edit the meeting settings](#h_01EKNMKP25Q590Q7Z5HF04DJDD) for a scheduled meeting.

If you are experiencing issues in you Zoom Rooms utilizing TesiraFORTÉ, follow this article to diagnose and fix the issue.

Products affected:


* All TesiraForte Models
* Devio CR-1 (Discontinued)

Products **NOT** affected:


* Tesira EX-UBT
* Devio SCR-20
* Devio SCR-25

**Symptom**: Audio stops working in one or both directions between a Mac mini and TesiraFORTÉ USB port. Rebooting the TesiraFORTÉ or Mac Mini resolves the issue temporarily.

**Diagnosis**: Apple has modified how it handles Asynchronous Sync, which causes issues on this specific hardware version of USB.

**Resolution**: Disable asynchronous support of the USB port in the Biamp Tesira software. (You may need to contact your AV integrator to perform this change):

[**![image001.png](https://support.zoom.us/hc/article_attachments/360028293471/image001.png)**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/article_attachments/360028293471/image001.png)

pageTitle: Using the audio library to change custom and default audio
body:
You can use the Zoom Phone audio library to select. record, or upload custom audio for various Zoom Phone prompts. These prompts are usually played before routing the call.

This article covers:


* [Limitations](#h_2e33ffdc-b6ec-4903-9108-b7f847aeb01b)
* [Changing default audio settings](#h_01EFFP73QHV204VR991BNKWE7J)
* [Changing custom audio settings](#h_1269bd68-5f28-4c35-b88c-c645d875b192)


	+ [Auto receptionists](#h_4db41150-33dc-4a91-9223-7bd7371f83c3)
	+ [IVRs](#h_08efb903-dedb-40a0-aae0-38ca1330271d)
	+ [Call queues](#h_98bb9967-ae13-4810-a430-505d0be1afa4)
	+ [Phone users](#h_ec25c65e-37f8-4513-89cd-8552bfb2e9b8)
	+ [Account-level audio](#h_2a98a51c-f958-4290-ac73-c8bf2e8c5fda)
* [Recording custom audio](#h_f7c57e99-a5f0-47a7-9d54-9e96b133d7a5)


* [Uploading an audio file](#h_8eb126b9-fb3f-4f16-a84e-a0260e9ee31d)

* Minor bug fixes

February 2, 2020

* **Administrator features**


	+ **Setting to require a password for Personal Audio Conference** Account owners and admins can now enable a setting to require a password for Personal Audio Conferences. This setting is available at the account and group and can be locked at the account or group level. This setting will be visible at the user level so that users can see if it is enabled for their Personal Audio Conferences.
* **User features**


	+ **Setting to allow participants to join from multiple devices for meetings with registration** If registration is enabled for a meeting, the host can now choose if they want to allow participants to join from multiple devices. This is under the Registration Options in the meeting details.
* **Developer features**


	+ Added support for private recordings to be downloaded using OAuth access token.
	
	
		- Account-Level Apps will need “recording:read:admin, recording:write:admin, recording:parent” scopes.
		- User-Level Apps will need “recording:read, recording:write” scopes.
		- A user with recording management permission can view private recordings recorded by another user in the same account.
	+ Added a new field (show\_previous\_occurrences) to Get a Meeting API.
	
	
		- *GET /meetings/{meetingId}*
	+ Added a new field(waiting\_room) in Account Settings and Lock Settings APIs.
	
	
		- *GET /accounts/{accountId}/settings*
		- *PATCH /accounts/{accountId}/settings*
		- *GET /accounts/{accountId}/lock\_settings*
		- *PATCH /accounts/{accountId}/lock\_settings*
	+ Added new fields (guest\_only\_to\_place\_in\_waiting\_room,auto\_admit\_participants\_with\_specified\_domains,admit\_participants\_with\_specified\_domains) in Account, Group, User Settings APIs.
	
	
		- *GET /accounts/{accountId}/settings*
		- *PATCH /accounts/{accountId}/settings*
		- *GET /groups/{groupId}/settings*
		- *PATCH /groups/{groupId}/settings*
		- *GET /users/{userId}/settings*
		- *PATCH /users/{userId}/settings*
	+ Added new fields(room\_connector\_list,meeting\_connector\_list) in Create a Sub Account and Update Account Options APIs.
	
	
		- *POST /accounts*
		- *PATCH /accounts/{accountId}/options*

* Minor bug fixes

February 23, 2020 version **4.6.6 (17944.0223)**Download Type: Manual

pageTitle: Granting OnZoom access by account Admin
body:
* Zoom desktop client


	+ Windows: **5.3.0 (52651.0920)** or higher
	+ macOS: **5.3.0 (52651.0920)** or higher
* Pro, Business, Enterprise, or Education account

Dec 16, 2013 Version number: **2.5.34846.1216**


* Fixed dll error during Win XP installation

Dec 14, 2013 Version number: **2.5.34803.1214**

V2.5 **New Features**:


* A [new look and feel](/entries/21875028-Points-of-Interest)
* [Personal Meeting ID](/entries/33249526-What-is-Personal-Meeting-ID-) and URL
* [Schedule on behalf](/entries/32749297-What-is-Scheduling-Privilege-) of another host
* [Attendee on-hold](/entries/32775248-What-is-Attendee-On-Hold-)
* H.323/SIP attendee can view gallery layout, join before host and passcode-protected meetings
* Support up to [100 video participants](/entries/32784183-What-is-a-Large-Meeting- "Link: https://zoomus.zendesk.com/entries/32784183-What-is-a-Large-Meeting-") (add-on feature)
* [Toll-free](/entries/32791178-What-is-Toll-Free-Audio-Conferencing-) dial-in numbers for audio conferencing (add-on feature)
* View-only client for webinar attendee (beta)

V2.5 **Enhancements**:


* New [screen sharing](/entries/21875028-Points-of-Interest) layout
* Improved Window 8 screen sharing experience
* [Recording](/entries/23023498-How-do-I-record-a-meeting-) supports gallery view
* [Recording](/entries/23023498-How-do-I-record-a-meeting-) supports screen share and video in one view
* Resize video window during screen sharing
* Optimized 1:1 dual monitor layout

Nov 4, 2013 Version number **2.0.31403.1104**

**Enhancements:**


* 3rd and later attendee that joins with Gmail/Work Email login will see the audio selection dialog pop-up

**Fixes:**


* Clients on meeting connector may fail to start a meeting from the internal network. [Also update [meeting connector](/entries/26961467-New-Updates-for-Meeting-Connector).]
* An issue with launching Outlook 2003 on WinXP 64bits
* Audio bug fixes

Oct 17, 2013 Version number: **2.0.30025.1017**

**Bug fixes:**


* Fixed an issue with Facebook login

Sep 27, 2013 Version number: **2.0.28860.0927**

**Enhancements:**


* Screen sharing meeting disables audio, attendee must select audio option
* Added ICS 1.0 support when scheduling via Outlook 2003
* Audio quality improvement when recording

**Bug fixes:**


* Chat to individual will default back to individual

Aug 26, 2013 Version number: **2.0.27343.0826**

**Enhancements:**


* Shortcuts for annotations
* Display Participant ID in window title
* Login to claim host role during meeting

**Bug fixes:**


* Record audio from telephone participants
* Share computer audio with no microphone
* Other bug fixes

Jul 29, 2013 Version number: **2.0.26494.0729**

**New Features**


* Ability to convert (.zoom) recording to MP4 manually
* Host can edit participant's display name
* Added second pin video for dual monitor

**Enhancements:**


* In-meeting menu bar layout changes


* Participants, Chat, Record in menu bar


* Audio and Video options
* One-click to disconnect computer audio (speaker and mic)


* Fit-to-window during screen sharing is default


* Option to disable in-meeting chat
* 40-minute meeting title display
* Bug fixes

Jun 9, 2013 Version number: **2.0.24622.0608**


* Bug fixes

Jun 3, 2013 Version number: **2.0.24278.0602**


* Resolved an issue with proxy server

Jun 1, 2013 Version number: **2.0.24227.0531**

Release 2.0 adds the following new features:


* Global "[teleconferencing](/entries/24083096-How-do-i-join-by-teleconferencing-)" (PSTN) dial-in access
* Start an instant ["Screen Share Meeting"](/entries/24002292--How-do-i-start-an-instant-screen-share-meeting- "Link: https://support.zoom.us/entries/24002292--How-do-i-start-an-instant-screen-share-meeting-")
* Video ["Gallery View"](/entries/21889592-How-can-i-view-my-zoom-video-window-screen-) for up to 25 participants
* Dual stream for ["Dual Monitor"](/entries/23795403-How-to-use-dual-monitor-display)
* ["Spotlight a speaker"](/entries/24082916-How-do-i-spotlight-a-speaker-) as the primary active speaker
* Share computer ["Audio during Screen Sharing"](/entries/24081406-Will-my-audio-play-through-screen-sharing-)
* Give "[mouse/keyboard](/entries/24339207-How-do-I-give-mouse-and-keyboard-control-)" control during screen sharing
* ["Annotations"](/entries/24056313-Screen-sharing-and-Annotation-for-Windows-) during screen sharing (Windows)
* Connect with H.323/SIP room systems via r[oom connector](/entries/23644506-Getting-Started)
* ["Usage Report"](/entries/23846453-Daily-and-Usage-Report) per meeting (Pro users)

Release 2.0 enhances the following features:


* Schedule meetings to start with video or start with screen share
* Alert tone when an attendee joins the meeting
* Record a meeting as a single MP4 file
* Email notification when attendees join before host
* Linked emails to a single account
* Login as host when in a meeting

body:
* Security enhancements

January 12, 2020 Version **4.6.2 (40691.0112)**

You can use the add-on to schedule a Zoom meeting from Gmail. The add-on will auto populate the meeting topic with the email topic. After you schedule a meeting from Gmail, Zoom will send join details to the sender of the email.


1. Use a web browser to sign in to Gmail.
2. Open an email.
3. In the right-side panel, click the Zoom logo.
Zoom will auto populate the meeting topic with the email subject.
4. Change the [meeting settings](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362413) as needed.
5. (Optional) In the **Mail options** section, enter email addresses to send the join details to.
**Note**:


	* These email address will be sent a email with the join details, not a Google Calendar invite. To send a Google Calendar invite, [edit the scheduled meeting](#h_01EKNMKP25Q590Q7Z5HF04DJDD) or [schedule a meeting from Google Calendar](#h_d98b7aea-a3a0-408e-9ca9-8458adb32f5a).
	* Join details will be automatically sent to the sender of the email.
6. Click **SCHEDULE MEETING**.

When you schedule a meeting, you can save its settings so they can be used as a template for scheduling future meetings. The template includes settings like enabling join before host, automatic recording, language interpretation, and alternative hosts. For recurring meetings, you also have the option to save the recurrence schedule as part of the template.

After you save a meeting as a template, you can select that template when you want to create a meeting with similar settings. You can select from up to 40 saved-meeting templates.

This article covers:


* [Creating a meeting template](#h_3970d0b0-228d-4322-be20-d35517ae51ec)
* [Scheduling a meeting from a template](#h_86f06cff-0852-4998-81c5-c83663c176fb)

1. Dial the IP address provided to you in the meeting invitation (requires Room Connector port add-on).
2. Enter the meeting ID via touch (DTMF) tones followed by #. Or you can use dial strings, such as 192.168.10.55##000111000 to join directly in to the meeting. Please see [Getting Started With Cloud Room Connector](/hc/en-us/articles/201363273-Getting-Started-With-Cloud-Room-Connector) for more information.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/h.323-sip/enter-meeting-id-3.PNG)

pageTitle: Using the nomadic emergency services dashboard
body:
Displays the share of users that have [nomadic emergency services enabled](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360042699912#h_f7a21a11-3350-4d69-a304-96ea7eb01a0e) and allowed location sharing in the Zoom desktop client. In other words, after enabling nomadic emergency services, the user clicked **Allow** when prompted to allow Zoom access to their location.

Hover over a portion of the pie chart then click **Drill in** to view a list of phone users that allowed or disallowed location sharing. For users that disallow location sharing, you can re-trigger the prompt.

* **Administrator features**


	+ **Setting for participants invited by the host or co-host to bypass the Waiting Room**Account owners and admins can enable a setting for participants invited by the host or co-host to bypass the Waiting Room. This setting is available at the account, group, and user level and can be locked at the account or group level. This setting is turned off by default. This requires client/app version 5.4.0 or higher.
	+ **Setting for reporting abuse during a meeting**Account owners and admins of verified Education and Business can enable or disable a setting that allows hosts to report participants for inappropriate behavior during a meeting. This setting requires client version 5.4.2 or higher.
	+ **Setting for reporting abuse in past webinars**Account owners and admins of verified Education and Business can enable or disable a setting that allows hosts to report participants for inappropriate behavior for past webinars.
	+ **Enhanced audit logs for recordings**The audit logs for recordings show if recordings were downloaded using an API access token or Webhook payload token.
	+ **Zoom Rooms support for video Virtual Background with green screen**Account owners and admins can enable video Virtual Background with green screen for Zoom Rooms. This requires Zoom Rooms version 5.3.0, which is planned for release in November 2020.
	+ **Virtual receptionist / kiosk mode for Zoom Rooms**Account owners and admins can enable kiosk mode for specific Zoom Rooms. This allows visitors to easily connect to a virtual receptionist. This requires Zoom Rooms version 5.3.0, which is planned for release in November 2020. This feature is in beta and needs to be enabled by Zoom.
	+ **Custom display names for Zoom Rooms devices**Account owners and admins can set custom display names for the display, scheduling display, and controller in a Zoom Room. The display name is used when the room name is too long to properly show. This requires Zoom Rooms version 5.3.0, which is planned for release in November 2020.
	+ **Display emergency status alert**Organizations with Emergency Call Notifications enabled can quickly update the content of digital signage Zoom Rooms to display an alert message. This requires Zoom Rooms version 5.3.0, which is planned for release in November 2020.
	+ **Hide caller ID**Administrators can choose to hide the outbound caller ID for their Zoom Rooms by configuring their settings for Zoom Phone. This requires Zoom Rooms version 5.3.0, which is planned for release in November 2020.
	+ **Specify guest name and email for Zoom Rooms Microsoft Teams integration**If Zoom Rooms direct guest join for Microsoft Teams is enabled, account owners and admins can specify a guest name and email that is passed to Microsoft Teams. This requires Zoom Rooms version 5.2.1 or higher.
* **User features**


	+ **Improved security notifications**Users will receive confirmation emails after certain actions are performed (password change, phone number updates, host key change).
* **Developer features**


	+ **Replaced “page\_number” with “next\_page\_token” in the following APIs.**
	
	
		- *GET /v2/metrics/zoomrooms*
		- *GET /v2/report/users*
		- *GET /v2/report/telephone -GET /v2/sip\_phones*
	+ **Added a new batch API for creating meeting polls.**
	
	
		- *POST /v2/meetings/{meetingId}/batch\_polls*
	+ **Added a new response field(“uuid”) in Telephone Reports API.**
	
	
		- *GET /v2/report/telephone*
	+ **Added a new request field(“auto\_approve”) in the Add Meeting Registrant API.**
	
	
		- *POST /v2/meetings/{meetingId}/registrants*
	+ **Added a new response field(“channel\_settings”) in List Channels API.**
	
	
		- *GET /v2/chat/users/{userId}/channels*
	+ **Added support for audit logs when downloading recordings through API access token.**
	
	
	+ **Added new error message in Get Webinar Absentess API.**
	
	
		- *GET /v2/past\_webinars/{WebinarUUID}/absentees*
		
		
			* 300 Invalid Occurrence.

pageTitle: Customizing line keys for direct phone numbers and shared lines
body:
If you're a Zoom Phone admin, you can access line key settings for phone users' desk phones or common area phones.


1. Sign in to the Zoom web portal.
2. In the navigation menu, click **Phone System Management** then **[Users & Rooms](https://zoom.us/pbx/page/telephone/phoneUsers#/users)**.
3. Click the **Users** or **Common Area Phones** tab.
4. Click the name of the phone user or common area phone.
5. Click the **User Settings** or **Settings** tab.
6. In the **Keys & Positions** section, click **View or Edit**.
7. Click **Manage Keys**.

pageTitle: Recording good-quality audio to ensure accurate transcripts
body:
* Keep the background noise to the minimum.
* Ask the participants to speak clearly into the microphone, and refrain from shuffling papers, typing loudly, or talking among themselves.
* Check where you place the microphone. If your meeting involves many people sitting together sharing the same dial-in, place the microphone near the participants who are talking.
* Choose an external microphone over a built-in one for better sound quality.

subTitles: How does Zoom determine which customers are subject to VAT?
body:
Zoom will generally apply Mexican VAT if any of the following conditions are met:


1. The location of the “Sold To” contact address entered by the customer is in Mexico.
2. The payment to Zoom is made through an intermediary located in Mexico.
3. The IP address used by the electronic device of the customer corresponds to the range of addresses assigned to Mexico.
4. The customer has provided to Zoom a telephone number with the Mexican country code.

pageTitle: Quick start guide for Yealink T4 and T5 series phones
body:
1. While in a call, press **Transfer** or press the transfer button ![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/cloud-phone/yealink/generic/transfer-button.png).
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/cloud-phone/yealink/t46s/in-call-controls.png)
2. Dial the number you want to transfer to. To transfer to an internal Zoom Phone user, dial their extension number.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/cloud-phone/yealink/t46s/transfer-call.png)
3. Choose a transfer method:


	* **Blind transfer**: Press **B Transfer** to immediately transfer the call and hang up.
	* **Warm transfer**: Press **Send** to place the call on hold while you complete the transfer. This option is useful if you need to navigate an automated answering machine for the caller or if you want to speak to the receiving party before your call is transferred. Tap **Transfer** to complete the transfer.
	![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/cloud-phone/yealink/t46s/warm-transfer.png)

Zoom allows you to schedule meetings with multiple occurrences, so that each occurrence uses the same meeting ID and settings. You can schedule these meetings in daily, weekly, and monthly increments. You can also set a recurring meeting to be used at any time. Meeting IDs for recurring meetings expire 365 days after the meeting was last started.

For more info on scheduling meetings in general and all of the meeting settings, see our documentation on [scheduling meetings](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362413-How-Do-I-Schedule-Meetings-).

**Note**:


* For a better experience, see the Zoom add-on for [Google Calendar (web or mobile)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360020187492) or [Outlook (desktop or web)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115005223126) if you use one of these calendar services to schedule meetings.
* Recurring meetings cannot be scheduled with your [Personal Meeting ID (PMI)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362843-What-is-Personal-Meeting-ID-PMI-and-Personal-Vanity-URL-PVU-) since your PMI is reserved so that you can start or schedule a meeting at anytime
* Meetings can have up to 50 recurring sessions, so if you need more than 50 recurrences, use the **No Fixed Time** option.

Windows/Mac

Account owners and admins can link multiple Zoom accounts together to create an organization. Once linked as an organization, these accounts will be able to search contacts, chat, meeting, and make phone calls (if eligible for Zoom Phone). If you link your accounts as an organization, account members will not need to manually add contacts from linked accounts in order to communicate with them.

Each Zoom account can only be part of one organization. If you invite a Zoom account to join your organization which is already part of another organization, the request will be rejected.

The account who created the organization is the owner of the organization and is the only one who can delete the organization. Linked accounts can invite other accounts, but the organization owner will need to approve this invitation before it is sent.

This article covers:


* [Creating a new organization](#h_ddc07864-44c8-4531-af72-22851dc4e76b)
* [Managing linked accounts as the owner](#h_3161ce15-d56a-45f9-a977-48f3c4e98f4e)
* [Linking to an existing account](#h_848c1dab-ecfa-4fb1-becf-07695eaaa80d)

* Organizations can send Information Barrier policies from their 3rd party system to Zoom.
* The last-known sync of policies will be shown in Zoom Web portal.

* Users blocked by information barriers cannot search or chat with one another.
* Group chats and channels are removed for users who have information barriers applied with other members of the group.

1. Sign in to the Zoom web portal as an administrator with the privilege to edit groups.
2. Click **User Management** and then select [**Group Management**](https://zoom.us/account/group).
3. Click the name of the group, then click the **Settings** tab.
4. On the **Meeting** tab, locate the **Non-verbal feedback** setting under the **In Meeting (Basic)** section and verify that is enabled.
5. If the setting is disabled, click the toggle to enable it. If a verification dialog displays, choose **Turn On** to verify the change.
6. **Note**: If the option is grayed out, it has been locked at the account level, and needs to be changed at that level.
7. (Optional) If you want to make this setting mandatory for all users in this group, click the lock icon, and then click **Lock** to confirm the setting.
**Note**: While Raise Hand is a form of nonverbal feedback, the **Raise Hand** option is not controlled by the **Non-verbal feedback** option and cannot be disabled.

pageTitle: Installing Zoom on Windows 10 Creators Update
body:
1. Open the **Start Menu**.
2. Click on the **Settings** icon.
 ![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/windows/start-menu-settings-icon.png)
3. Click on **Apps.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/windows/apps-settings-icon.png)**
4. Change Installing apps to **Warn me before installing apps from outside the Store** or **Allow apps from anywhere.** ![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/windows/installing-apps-menu.jpg)

Admins can upload their own virtual backgrounds for all users on their account to use, or can assign certain virtual backgrounds for use by specific user groups. The admin can allow users to add their own virtual backgrounds or restrict them to just what admins have provided.


1. Enable the virtual background feature in [Account Settings](#h_484240a7-d72b-4dac-8ba6-ac8a4945325a) or [Group Settings](#h_01EJF5G48VYS966ZH34CZZQ1PW).
2. Click **Manage virtual background**.
3. Click **Choose Files** or drag and drop the images you want to upload.
4. Wait for the upload to finish before closing this window. A small banner will appear along the top of the page when the upload is successful.
After the new backgrounds are uploaded, users will need to sign-out of the client and then back in to retrieve the backgrounds from the web.

**Notes**:


* Users must be on version **5.1.1** or higher to utilize this feature.
* The default Zoom virtual backgrounds cannot be removed from the web portal.
* Video virtual backgrounds cannot be uploaded at this time.

subTitles: Enabling an auto-answer group in chat
For all members of a group
body:
1. Sign in to the Zoom web portal as an administrator with the privilege to edit user groups.
2. In the navigation panel, click **User Management**, then click [**Group Management**](https://zoom.us/account/group).
3. Click the name of the group, then click the **Settings** tab.
4. Navigate to the **Auto-answer group in chat** option in the **Meeting** tab and verify that the setting is enabled.
If the setting is disabled, click the toggle to enable it. If a verification dialog displays, choose **Turn On** to verify the change.
**![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/web/account-management/account-settings/enable-auto-answer-for-organization.png)Note**: If the option is grayed out,  it has been locked at the Account level, and needs to be changed at that level.
5. (Optional) If you want to make this setting mandatory for all users in this group, click the lock icon, and then click **Lock** to confirm the setting.

pageTitle: Sharing your screen, content, or second camera
body:
If you are using a dual monitor set-up, you can turn on the [dual monitors](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362583) feature to see the screen sharing on one monitor and participants on the second.

**Note**: On Mac OS 10.15 Catalina, you need to [allow Zoom access to screen recording](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360016688031) to share your screen. You can do this in your **System Preferences** > **Security & Privacy** > **Privacy** > **Screen Recording**. Check the option for **zoom.us**.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/misc/catalina-screen-recording.png)

pageTitle: Sharing and controlling access to a voicemail inbox
subTitles: Sharing an auto receptionist's voicemail inbox
body:
**Note**: Before sharing an auto receptionist's voicemail inbox, you should change the business or closed hours settings to route to the auto receptionist's voicemail. This allows callers to directly leave voicemails for the call queue.


1. Sign in to the Zoom web portal.
2. In the navigation menu, click **Phone System Management** then **[Auto Receptionists](https://zoom.us/pbx/page/telephone/auto-receptionists#/auto-receptionists)**.
3. Click an auto receptionist's name.
4. Make sure to route to the auto receptionist's voicemail.


	* If you do not have an IVR: In the **Business Hours** or **Closed Hours** sections, click **Edit** next to **Route to**. Select the following options:
	
	
		+ **Route to**: Select **Voicemail**
		+ **Voicemail Greeting**: Select a current greeting or click **Customize** to [record or upload a custom greeting](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360028514011).
		+ **Leave Voicemail to**: Select **Current Extension**.
	* If you have an IVR: In the **Business Hours** or **Closed Hours** sections, click **Edit** next to **Route to Interactive Voice Response (IVR)**. Make sure at least one of the IVR menu options is set to **Leave Voicemail to Current Extension**.
5. In the **Voicemail** section, click **Set** or **Add** to share the voicemail inbox with other phone users. Enter a name or extension to search through phone users, select a user, then click **Save**.
**Note**: Click the cross mark (**×**) to revoke access.


6. (Optional) In the **Forward to email** section, click **Set** or **Add** to send new voicemails to internal or external email address. Enter an email address, then click **Save**.
**Note**: This feature needs to be enabled in [policy settings](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360033511872). Click the cross mark (**×**) to revoke access.

subTitles: Requesting to be the account owner (Pro accounts only)
body:
Account admins on Pro accounts can request to be the account owner, which will email the account owner for approval. If the account owner does not accept or reject the request within 72 hours, the admin will automatically become the account owner. This does not apply to accounts which are eligible for a CSM, who will need to contact their CSM or account executive for assistance.


1. Sign in to the Zoom web portal.
2. In the navigation menu, click **Account Management** then [**Account Profile**](https://zoom.us/account).
3. Click **Request Account Ownership**.
4. You will see confirmation that you have requested account ownership.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/web/account-management/account-profile/confirm-request-account-ownership.png)

The account owner can approve or deny your request for 72 hours. If they do not respond to your request, you will automatically become the account owner after 72 hours. You will receive an email confirmation when the account owner responds to your request.

pageTitle: New Updates for Zoom Rooms Windows controller
body: * **Security update**Support enhanced encryption for the connection between Zoom Rooms and Zoom Rooms Controllers. Starting August 16, 2020, Zoom Rooms and Controllers will need to be running version 5.0.5 or higher to function.

subTitles: Are there any special exemptions applicable for government entities and charities under which VAT may not be charged?
body: No.  Government entities and charities are not eligible for special exemptions, unless they provide a valid Business Registration Number.

pageTitle: Setting up speed dial and busy lamp field (BLF)
body:
**Note**:


* Make sure you [set up BLF](#h_18361104-6869-4183-8b1f-7b10ecb51df9) and have a [desk phone that supports it](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360029698771).
* This section serves as a generic explanation of icons and lights for BLF. These icons and lights are defined by the desk phone manufacturer. Different models/manufacturers have different ways of showing status. Visit the manufacturer's support website to learn more about using BLF on your desk phone.

After setting up BLF, you will notice the following indicator lights for your BLF lines:

**Pattern and color****Description**

Solid green
Phone user is not on a call

Solid red
Phone user is on a call

subTitles: Percentage of good quality calls and average quality over time
body:
1. Sign in to the Zoom web portal.
2. In the navigation menu, click **Dashboard**.
3. Click the **[Zoom Phone](https://zoom.us/account/metrics/pbxqos/#/dashboard/overall)** tab.
4. To change the period, click the date range in the top-left corner and select the start and end dates.
5. You will see these sections

At the top of the **Overall** tab, you'll see the the overall call quality for Zoom Phone calls during the selected time period:

![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/web/zoom-voice/qos-dashboard/overall-tab-top.png)


* If you have [multiple sites](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360020809672), click the site drop-down menu to filter data by site.
* The pie chart on the left side shows the percentage of good (blue) versus bad (red) quality calls during the selected time period.
* The line graph shows the the change in percentage of good and bad quality calls each hour during the selected time period.
* The bar graph shows the number of good and bad quality calls each hour during the selected time period.

subTitles: Sending an animated GIF using GIPHY
body:
1. Sign in to the Zoom desktop client or mobile app.
2. Select a chat thread.
3. Click or tap the smiley face icon ![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/generic/chat/gif-icon.png) at the bottom right of the chat window.
4. Click or tap **GIF**.
5. Type a word to search. Up to 8 GIFs will display.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/generic/chat/search-for-gif.png)
6. Click on the GIF to send.
Once the GIF is sent there are several options you can use:


7. Collapse the GIF by clicking the arrow above the GIF. (Only available on the desktop client).
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/generic/chat/gif-collapse-icon.png)


8. Click or tap the ellipses icon (**...**) then **Add to Emojis** (desktop) or **Save as Emoji** (mobile) to add it to your favorite emojis.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/generic/chat/gif-options-menu.png)

Learn more about [managing chat messages](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115004789183).

1. Sign in to the Zoom web portal.
2. In the navigation menu, click **Advanced** then **[Security](https://zoom.us/account/setting/security)**.
You can configure the following settings:


3. **Basic Password Requirement**: These are the password requirements for a Zoom login password. These settings can not be changed and only affect Zoom specific passwords, all other authentication methods will still use their own password requirements.


4. **Enhanced Password Rules**: Allow you to force extra requirements for your users’ passwords including:


	* **Have a minimum password length**: The password length can be increased from a minimum of 8 characters, up to 14 characters.
	* **Have at least 1 special character (!, @, #...)**: Requires a special character in the password.
	* **Cannot contain consecutive characters (e.g. "11111", "12345", "abcde", or "qwert")**: The password cannot include consecutive numbers or letters, either alphabetically or on the keyboard.
	* **Use enhanced weak password detection**: Users will be notified if their password is weak.
5. **New users need to change their passwords upon first sign-in:** Users will be required to set their own password when they first sign in.


6. **Password expires automatically and needs to be changed after the specified number of days**: Allows you to set an expiration date on passwords, forcing users to create a new password when it expires. This can be set for 30, 60, 90, or 120 days.
7. **Users cannot reuse any password used in the previous number of times**: Forces users to not reuse an older password that has been used within the set number of passwords created previously. This number can range from 3-12  previous passwords created.
8. **Users can change their password a maximum number of times every 24 hours**: Locks how many times a user can change their password in a 24 hour period. It can be set from 3 to 8 times.

subTitles: Permanently deleting cloud recordings in the trash
Permanently deleting cloud recordings by meeting ID
body:
To view files in the trash, click **Trash** in the top-right area of the recording management page. Files in the trash don't count towards your cloud-recording storage limit and will be permanently deleted after 30 days. If you do not have the **Trash** option, there are currently no files in your trash.


1. Enter the meeting ID in the search box, then click **Search**.
2. Click **Delete** to the right of individual meeting. You can also use the check boxes to select several meetings, then click **Delete**.
 ![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/web/my-recordings/select-cloud-recordings-in-trash.png)

* **Zoom Rooms Management features**


	+ **Disable devices alerts from appearing on Zoom Rooms screens**You can specify that peripheral device alerts do not appear on Zoom Rooms screens. Configure this setting in the **Alert Settings** tab of the **Edit Room** page for the room.
	+ **Manage the Zoom Rooms Scheduling Display**Details about the iPad that runs the Zoom Rooms Scheduling Display are available in the **Devices** tab for the room. To access this tab, sign into your Zoom account and click Zoom Rooms, then click the room name. The **Devices** tab displays the version of the app and allows you to upgrade if a new version is available. It also displays the battery level and shows whether the iPad is online of offline.
* **User Feature**


	+ **Add a timestamp in cloud recordings**If you enable Cloud recording in the Recording section of the My Meeting Settings page, you can enable the Add a timestamp to the recording option to include a timestamp that shows the actual time that the meeting or webinar occurred.

**Resolved Issues**


* Minor bug fixes

May 26, 2017


* Minor enhancements
* Bug fixes

May 19, 2017

**Changes to existing features**


* **Increased meeting capacity**The maximum number of participants has been increased, at no additional cost, from 50 to 100. This change in capacity applies to the following:


* Meetings using a Basic, Pro, or Business license (including Active Host and Education)


* Webinar panelists
* Meetings scheduled by or instantly started in Zoom Rooms
* The large meeting plan for 100 participants will no longer be available

**New and enhanced features**


* **Admin Features**


* **Additional currency for purchasing Zoom licenses**In addition to the US Dollar, Zoom supports the ability to use the Australian Dollar, the Euro, and the British Pound when purchasing licenses. For new licenses, Zoom attempts to automatically select the default currency based on your location, but you can manually change this value in the Currency section of the Zoom Payment page. After your first purchase using a particular currency, all future transactions are processed with that currency.


* **Calendar of public meetings and webinars**If your account uses a vanity URL, you can request to enable an option that makes public meetings and webinars available on a public calendar for up to 12 months.
* **Configurable DSCP marking values**If you enable the **DSCP marking** option on the Administrator Settings page, you can change them from the default values. This allows a network administrator to determine the priority for Zoom audio and video on their network.
* **Reporting information for attention indicator**The Meeting Report and Webinar Report include an Attentiveness column, showing the percentage of time that the attendee (on a supported version of the client) had the Zoom window in focus. The Webinar Report also includes the Average Attentiveness for all attendees. See [Meeting Reporting](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/216378603-Meeting-Reporting) and [Webinar Reporting](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201393719-Webinar-Reporting) for details.
* **Personal Meeting ID password enhancement**To prevent the unauthorized use of a Personal Meeting ID, you can specify the option **Require a password for Personal Meetings if attendees can join before host** for members of your account.
* **Simplified landing page**If your account uses a vanity URL, you can switch your Zoom landing page to a simplified version. Switching to the new layout provides easier access to edit the html used for customization. You can switch to the simplified landing page when you navigate to the [Landing](https://zoom.us/account/branding/landing) tab of the Branding page.


* **User Features**


	+ Panelists and attendees can join webinars using the web client.
	+ The web client includes enhancements to meeting controls for meeting attendees.
	+ Support for waiting room for meetings.
* **Cloud recording playback usability enhancements
The host has greater control when using the playback feature on the My Recordings page. The playback video uses a larger portion of the screen, with the controls for Download and Share accessible while the video is in playback mode. In addition, the Set Playback Range control is integrated next to playback time.**


* **Webinar registration page customization
Your webinar registration page can include a customized color scheme, as well as descriptions and profile pictures for up to three speakers in your webinar. Configure these customizations on the Branding tab of the My Webinars > Manage Webinars page when you schedule a webinar**
* **Automatic webinar recording
If the Automatic Recording option is enabled on the Account Settings page and the My Meeting Settings page, you can configure a webinar to record automatically at the time you schedule it.**
* **Webinar tracking pixel**The landing page for webinar registration and the registration confirmation page can each be configured with a tracking pixel. This pixel for the landing page can provide information regarding registrants who arrived at the page. The pixel for the registration confirmation page can help track registrations. Configure the values for these pixels in the **Approval** section of the **My Webinars > Manage Webinars** page when you schedule a webinar that requires registration.
* **Resend emails to webinar alternative hosts**A **Resend** button for sending email to alternative hosts displays on the same page as the **Resend** button for Panelists.
* **Web client in-meeting features for webinars and meetings**
* **Accessibility enhancements**Multiple accessibility enhancements have been incorporated across the Zoom website, including improved support for the WAI-ARIA 1.1 and WCAG 2.0 accessibility standards.

Zoom Room Device Profiles, allows you to create and save profiles to a room, with specific device settings and screen layouts. These profiles can then be applied from the web interface, or from within the settings of the controller. They can also be changed on the fly while in a meeting as well.

subTitles: How do I enter my ABN?
body:
If you are registered for GST, to enter your ABN, please follow these steps:


1. Sign in to the Zoom Portal
2. Under **Account Management**, click [**Billing**](https://zoom.us/billing).
3. Click the **Billing Information**.
4. Under **Billing Contact**, choose to enter the ABN number (which appears after the **Sold To Contact Address** field)
5. Enter your ABN and save.

body:

4. Click **Edit** on the right side.
 ![](https://s3.amazonaws.com/zoom-support-cdn/images/en-us/web/room-management/zoom-rooms/edit-room-3.png)

6. Edit the code.![](https://s3.amazonaws.com/zoom-support-cdn/images/en-us/web/room-management/zoom-rooms/room-passcode.png)
7. Click **Save Changes**.

subTitles: Moving users, common area phones, auto receptionists, and call queues to another site
body:
After creating [phone users](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360021058071), [common area phones](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360028516231), [auto receptionists](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360021121312), or [call queues](/hc/en-us/articles/360021524831), you can move them to another site in your account.


1. Sign in to the Zoom web portal.
2. Click **Phone System Management** and navigate to one of these pages:


	* **Users & Rooms**([**Users**](https://zoom.us/pbx/page/telephone/phoneUsers#/users), [**Zoom Rooms**](https://zoom.us/pbx/page/telephone/phoneUsers#/users/zoom-rooms), or [**Common Area Phone**](https://zoom.us/pbx/page/telephone/phoneUsers#/users/common-area-phone) tab)
	* **[Auto Receptionists](https://zoom.us/pbx/page/telephone/auto-receptionists#/auto-receptionists)**
	* **[Call Queues](https://zoom.us/pbx/page/telephone/groups#/groups)**
3. Click the checkbox to select what you want to move, then click **Move Site** at the top of the table.


4. Select the target site and click **Confirm**.

pageTitle: Selecting data center regions for hosted meetings and webinars
body:
To select data center regions for all users in the account:


1. Sign in to the Zoom web portal as an admin with the privilege to edit account settings.
2. In the navigation panel, click **Account Management** then [**Account Settings**](https://zoom.us/account/setting).
3. Under **In Meeting (Advanced)**, verify that **Select data center regions for meetings/webinars hosted by your account** is enabled.
4. If the setting is disabled, click the toggle to enable it. If a verification dialog displays, click **Turn On** to verify the change.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/web/account-management/account-settings/select-data-center-regions.png)
5. Check the regions that you would like your in-meeting and in-webinar data in transit to route through.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/web/account-management/account-settings/sample-data-center-regions.png)
6. (Optional) If you want to make this setting mandatory for all users in your account, click the lock icon, and then click **Lock** to confirm the setting.

* **Call queue continues routing calls to users after sign-out**Resolved issue with users leaving call queue and still receiving calls active in the queue.
* **Minor bug fixes**

August 4, 2020 version **5.2.0 (42619.0804)**Download Type: Manual

pageTitle: How Do I Update A Scheduled Meeting?
body:
If you have scheduled a meeting via the Zoom scheduler, a **Meeting ID** is generated.  When you invite via your your calendar, the join instructions are automatically pasted to the calendar invitation.

**Note**: Any edits to a meeting that is currently in progress will not take effect. The meeting must be ended and restarted for the changes to take effect.

About Meeting ID:


* You can start your meeting at any time after you scheduled it.
* Non-recurring meeting ID will expire **30 days** after the meeting is scheduled or started. You can also re-start the same meeting ID within the 30 days.
* Recurring meeting ID will expire **365 days** after the meeting is started on the first occurrence. You can re-use the meeting ID for future occurrences.

Reschedule a meeting:


* If you need to re-schedule a meeting, simply update your schedule on your calendar.
* It is not necessary to update the meeting on the Zoom scheduler

Adding or deleting invitation attendees:


* If you need to add or delete attendees, you can do so from your calendar (To: or Add Guests on calendars)
* There is no need to update the meeting on the Zoom scheduler

Edit your scheduled meeting on the Zoom Scheduler:


* Click on My Meetings, Upcoming, Edit (the scheduled meeting)
* You can use it to update the scheduled time, however this is not necessary

![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/generic/meetings/upcoming-meeting-options.png)

Editing Pre-populated calendar/invite invitation:

You can edit or add to the pre-populated invitation text that is in your calendar invite to match your needs

![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/generic/meetings/schedule-a-meeting-window.png)

pageTitle: Preventing OnZoom event disruptions as a Host
subTitles: Deleting messages sent in chat during an event
body:
You can delete messages and files sent by users in the in-meeting chat window. After deleting a user's message, you will have the option to report that specific user to the Zoom Trust and Safety team to evaluate any misuse of the platform and block the user if necessary.

To delete a message from the in-meeting chat box during an event:


1. In the event controls bar, click on the **![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/generic/in-meeting/chat-icon.png) Chat** icon to open the in-meeting chat window.
2. Hover your mouse over the chat message you want to delete.
3. Click on the **...** icon.
4. Click on **Delete**.

subTitles: Часто задаваемые вопросы — НДС в России
body:
Информация ниже действительна только в том случае, если услуги приобретаются непосредственно у компании Zoom. Если вы приобрели услуги у партнера по продажам компании Zoom на территории России, обратитесь к этому партнеру для получения дополнительной информации об НДС.

НДС — это налог на добавленную стоимость. НДС обычно применяется к реализации товаров и/или услуг. Он применяется к большинству товаров и услуг, приобретаемых и реализуемых для потребления на территории Российской Федерации. Это **потребительский налог**, так как в итоге он ложится на конечного потребителя.

pageTitle: Getting started with hosting OnZoom events
body:
Only an Admin or Owner of a Zoom account, or a Zoom user with approval of their account’s Owner or Admin, can be a [Host](https://support.zoom.us/hc/articles/360051886772).

To become an OnZoom Host:


1. Go to [OnZoom](https://onzoom.com).
2. In the top-right corner of the page, click **Become a Host**.
3. Read the disclaimer to understand if you are the owner of your Zoom account or if you are a member of an existing Zoom account.
4. Click the **Sign In** button.
5. Sign in using the Zoom account that you want to host OnZoom events with.
6. Answer the questions in the application process.

The application form will be reviewed by the OnZoom team—at Zoom's sole discretion—after it has been submitted. When the review process is complete, you will receive an email notifying you either that:


* You are invited to attend an OnZoom training session, or
* Zoom is not able to approve your Host application at this time, and that you will be added to a waitlist for future re-evaluation

If you are invited to attend an OnZoom training session, you will be required to attend the entire training session before your application is approved and access to your Host account is granted.

1. Sign in to the Zoom web portal.
2. In the navigation menu, click **Phone System Management** then **[Call Queues](https://zoom.us/pbx/page/telephone/groups#/groups)**.
3. Click **Add**.
4. Enter the following information:


	* **Site** (only visible if you have [multiple sites](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360020809672-Managing-Multiple-Sites)): Select a site for the new call queue.
	* **Name**: Enter a display name.
	* **Description (Optional)**: Enter a description to help identify the call queue.
	* **Extension Number**: Enter an extension for callers to reach the call queue. You can assign direct phone numbers to the call queue after creating it.
	* **Member(s)**: Click **Add**. Select the phone users you want to be included in the call queue, then click **OK**. You can add [phone users](/hc/en-us/articles/360021058071) or [common area phones](/hc/en-us/articles/360028516231#h_0f0e832d-3100-4d44-b5fd-664cde31e610) to call queues.
	* **Copy from an existing Call Queue**: Copy business/closed hours, greeting prompt, and routing rules from an existing call queue.
5. Click **Save**. The web portal will redirect you back to the **[Call Queue](https://zoom.us/pbx/page/telephone/groups#/groups)** page.


6. Click the name of the call queue to change it settings. See the [next section](#h_203f829b-4f16-42e7-9a94-dfdf20b67033) for more information.

pageTitle: Restricting logins for the Zoom Client
subTitles: Restricting logins to specific email domains
body:
To configure the Windows Zoom client to only allow joining meetings for certain accounts, the following parameter would need to be added to the install command line: *ZConfig=" login\_domain=domain"*. In the command, the domain will be the email domain for students and faculty.

msiexec /package ZoomInstaller.msi /norestart /lex msi.log ZConfig= "login\_domain=domain"

Example:

If your organization's account ID number is "school.com", then the install command and ZConfig parameter would be:

msiexec /package ZoomInstaller.msi /norestart /lex msi.log ZConfig= "login\_domain=school.com"

예. Zoom은 한국에 간이 사업자등록번호를 가지고 있습니다. 간이 사업자로 등록된 Zoom은 국내 사업장이 없는 국외 사업체이므로 전자적으로 제공되는 서비스를 사업자가 아닌 국내 개인 고객(B2C)에게 공급하는 경우 VAT를 징수하여 납부해야 합니다.

사업자등록번호(ID)를 어떻게 입력해야 하나요?

다음 단계에 따라 한국 사업자등록번호를 입력하면 됩니다.


1. Zoom Portal에 로그인합니다.
2. 계정관리 메뉴에서 청구 페이지를 선택합니다.
3. 청구 연락처에서 사업자등록번호 편집(청구 연락처 주소 필드 다음에 있음)을 선택합니다.
4. 한국 사업자등록번호를 입력한 후 저장합니다.

pageTitle: Setting up H.323/SIP rooms with calendar resources
body:
Once the Service account has been authorized, Calendar service settings can be managed including the default API connector for calendar traffic routing, the way SIP and 3rd party joining information is parsed. To manage these settings:


1. In the navigation panel, click **Room Management**, then click [**Cisco/Polycom Rooms**](https://go.zoom.us/interop#/interop/rooms).
2. Click the [**Calendar Integration**](https://go.zoom.us/interop#/calendar/accounts) tab.![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/h.323-sip/room-management/zurm-calendar-integration-tab.png)
3. Click **Edit** next to the Calendar service.![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/h.323-sip/room-management/edit-calendar-service.png)
4. The following settings are available:


	* **API Connector**- Allows an organization to set the API Connector utilized for calendar traffic. Enter the **Connector ID** of the desired API Connector.
	* **Domain Match-**If enabled, the room will only show join information for meetings, who's host has the same domain as the domain for the resource calendar.
	* **Parse Sip Urls-** If enabled Zoom will try to parse SIP joining information in the calendar invitation, for one-touch joining.
	* **Parse Webex Meetings-**If enabled Zoom will try to parse Webex joining information in the calendar invitation for one-touch joining.
	* **Parse Bluejeans Meetings-**If enabled Zoom will try to parse Bluejeans joining information in the calendar invitation for one-touch joining.
	* **Parse Skype for Business-** If enabled Zoom will try to parse Skype for Business joining information in the calendar invitation for one-touch joining.
	* **Meeting Password-**If enabled, Zoom will automatically enter the password in the dial-string, when joining a Zoom meeting, for one-touch joining.
	* **Hide Topic-** If enabled, the Meeting title/topic will be hidden. If disabled, the settings set within the Calendar resource itself will be used.
	* **Hide Agenda-**If enabled, the Meeting invite body will be hidden. If disabled, the settings set within the Calendar resource itself will be used.
	* **Default Topic-** Allows an organization to set what is shown for the Meeting topic (invite subject), if the subject is hidden and the meeting is not a SIP, H.323, or 3rd party meeting.
	* **Default Topic (Zoom)**- Allows an organization to set what is shown for the Meeting topic (invite subject), if the subject is hidden and the meeting is a Zoom meeting.

pageTitle: Granting OnZoom access by account Admin
subTitles: Granting group-level OnZoom permission to an existing group
body:
If you are the admin of a Zoom account and want to grant OnZoom permission to an existing group of users, you can grant access to specific groups.

To grant specific Zoom group permission to attend and/or create OnZoom events:


1. Sign in to the Zoom web portal.
2. Click **User Management**, then click **Groups**.
3. To the right of the group you want to grant OnZoom permission to, click on the **Edit** button.
4. Enter the required information under the Profile tab.
5. Click on the **Meeting** tab.
6. (Optional) Navigate to **Register and attend OnZoom events** and click on the toggle to remove the account-level's permission to register for and attend OnZoom events.
7. (Optional) Check **Create and list OnZoom events** to give the specific user permission to create and list OnZoom events to the public marketplace.
8. Enter the required information in the remaining tabs.

pageTitle: Creating an interactive voice response (IVR) system
body:
When creating or editing an IVR system, you can set or customize these routing options:


* **Leave Voicemail to**: Route the caller to the voicemail belonging to one of these extensions.


	+ **Current extension** (associated auto receptionist's voicemail)
	+ [**User**](/hc/en-us/articles/360021058071)
	+ [**Auto Receptionist**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360021121312)
	+ [Call Queue](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360021524831)
	+ **[Shared Line Group](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360038850792)**
* **Voicemail Greeting**: Select a greeting from the drop-down menu or click **Audio Library** to [select, record, or upload custom audio](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360028212652).
**Note**:


	+ If routing to another extension's voicemail, the voicemail greeting you set will override the greeting set for that extension.
	+ If you're routing to a phone user's voicemail, select **Follow User Voicemail Greeting** in the drop-down menu to use the phone user's greeting instead of selecting a replacement.
* **Forward to**: Route the caller to one of these extensions.


	+ [**User**](/hc/en-us/articles/360021058071)
	+ [**Zoom Room**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360025153711)
	+ [**Common Area Phone**](/hc/en-us/articles/360028516231)
	+ [**Auto Receptionist**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360021121312)
	+ [**Call Queue**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360021524831)
	+ [**Shared Line Group**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360038850792)
	+ **Phone Number** (external phone number)
	**Note**:
	
	
		- To enable this option, you must have a [direct number](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360020808292) assigned to the associated auto receptionist.
		- Calls routed to an external phone number will be billed at the plan rate.
		- Make sure to select the correct country/region in the drop-down menu so you can add the external phone number. Some countries share the same country code, but appear has separate entries in the drop-down menu.
* **Dial by name**: Route to the [dial-by-name directory](/hc/en-us/articles/360044452031).

You can reply to a message to keep all related replies in the same thread; this allows users to easily identify replies.


1. Sign in to the Zoom desktop client.
2. In the **Chat** tab, select a chat thread.
3. Hover over the message you want to reply to.
4. Click the chat bubble icon.
5. Enter your reply, then press **Enter**.

**Note**: Replies can contain text, [screenshots](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/202920879), [files](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/202920879), [code snippets](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360000489103), emoticons, or [animated GIFs](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115004802246).
Your reply will display under the parent message. All future replies will be displayed under the parent message.

![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/generic/chat/chat-thread-with-replies-and-reactions.png)
