pageTitle: Windows 7 Media Player cannot play recording
body:
The maximum supported resolution for Windows Media Player 7 is 1920 × 1080 pixels due to limitations with the software and DXVA decoding. [Read more information from Microsoft](http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/windows/desktop/dd797815(v=vs.85).aspx).

The recorded Zoom video of a shared screen cannot be played with WMP on Windows 7 if the resolution of the shared screen is higher than 1920x1080.
The recording resolution is based on the largest shared screen in the meeting or webinar, so even if video and screens were shared at lower resolutions, Windows Media Player may not be able to play the recording.
Please try another media player such as [VLC](http://www.videolan.org/vlc/index.html) or [Quicktime](http://www.apple.com/quicktime/download/).

pageTitle: Using Crestron Mercury as a Zoom Rooms Controller
body: The Crestron Mercury is a device for the conference room that, when attached to a Zoom Room, can operate as a combination of a speakerphone and a controller. subTitles: Are there any VAT obligations for me as a customer?
body: No, but if you are a Mexican business, you are entitled to get a tax invoice from Zoom, which may be used to claim the VAT as input tax credit in accordance with the tax regime applicable to you. As such, you should provide your RFC (“Registro Federal de Contribuyentes”) to Zoom so that it can include your RFC on any invoices it issues to you.

The [vanity URL](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/215062646) used to log in using SSO.

Example: Enter "success" to set the SSO URL as https://success.zoom.us

ForceLoginWithSSO
Boolean
(true or false)
 false
Specify if SSO is the default login method. If set to true, users can still switch to other login methods. This item will not apply if DisableLoginWithSSO is set to true.

GoogleLoginRenameDisabled
Boolean
(true or false)
false
Prevent users from renaming before joining a meeting if signed in via Google

SSOLoginRenameDisabled
Boolean
(true or false)
false
Prevent users from renaming before joining a meeting if signed in via SSO

SetAccountIDsRestrictedToJoin
String
(empty)
Set account IDs* that client is restricted to join a meeting hosted by specific Account ID numbers

***Note**: Please have an account admin or owner [contact Support](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/requests/new) to acquire your account ID.

See below for a sample configuration that disables Google login:

{
 "DisableGoogleLogin": {
 "Value": true
 }
}

pageTitle: New updates for Cloud Room Connector (CRC)
body:
* **AES-256-CBC device encryption (SIP) support**Adds AES-256-CBC for SIP devices connecting to Conference Room Connector.
* **Ability to view Live Transcripts**Adds support for viewing live transcripts of participant audio feeds, while in-meeting.
* **View connected data center within the Meeting menu**Displays the data center the device is connected, at the top of the in-meeting controls menu.
* **Updated 1-Person Meeting Screen**Updated the screen with additional information when the CRC device is the only participant in a meeting.

pageTitle: Managing user groups and changing group-level settings
body:
* **Prevent hosts from accessing their cloud recordings**: Do not allow hosts to view their [cloud recordings](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203741855) for meetings. Only admins with recording management privilege can access their cloud recordings.
* **Cloud recording downloads**: Allow anyone with a link to the cloud recording can download the recording.

**Note**: You can also [pre-assign participants to breakout rooms](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360032752671) when you schedule the meeting instead of managing them during the meeting.


1. Start an instant or scheduled meeting.
2. Click **Breakout Rooms**.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/generic/in-meeting/breakout-rooms-icon.png)
3. Select the number of rooms you would like to create, and how you would like to assign your participants to those rooms:


	* **Automatically**: Let Zoom split your participants up evenly into each of the rooms.
	* **Manually**: Choose which participants you would like in each room.
	* **Let participants choose room**: [Participants can select and enter rooms](/hc/en-us/articles/115005769646) on their own.
4. Click **Create Breakout Rooms**.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/generic/create-breakout-rooms.png)


5. Your rooms will be created, but will not start automatically. You can manage the rooms prior to starting them by following the instructions below.

subTitles: Prepare the Polycom system for provisioning
body: For best results it is recommended to clear any previous configuration prior to enabling on the Zoom platform by performing a factory restore. Note that if a Polycom system is later removed from the Zoom platform some settings may remain in place even after the device no longer retrieves its provisioning profile from Zoom, in this case it is recommended to also perform a factory restore the Polycom system after removing it from the Zoom platform.

subTitles: Viewing a call queue's voicemail inbox
body:
**Note**: To allow callers to leave messages in the call queue's voicemail, change the **Overflow** setting to route to the current extension's voicemail inbox.


1. Sign in to the Zoom web portal.
2. In the navigation menu, click **Phone System Management** then **[Call Queues](https://zoom.us/pbx/page/telephone/groups#/groups)**.
3. Click the call queue name.
4. Click the **Voicemail** tab.
5. You can identify voicemail messages using the following:


	* If the number has a [caller ID name](/hc/en-us/articles/360031768431) or belongs to your organization, you'll see a name above the number.
	* Voicemail entries marked by a blue dot haven't been played yet.
6. Use the search options at the top to search for a specific contact or phone number, or click the drop-down menu at the top to filter by read or unread messages.


7. Click the following options to view and manage voicemails:


	* **Play icon**![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/web/my-zoom-voice/play-icon.png): Play the voicemail message and display a transcript of the voicemail message if Zoom Phone was able to transcribe it.
	* **Download**: Save the voicemail message (MP3 file).
	* **Delete**: Delete the selected voicemail message. To delete several entries at once, click the checkbox beside the status column and click **Delete** at the top of the table.

pageTitle: New updates for Zoom Rooms for macOS
body:
* Minor bug fixes
* Security enhancements

September 27, 2020 version **5.2.0 (2940.0927)**

Multimedia Router (MMRs) each supports up to 200 concurrent participants. Depending on the scope of their system, they will want to calculate the MMRs and Meeting Connector Controllers that are needed. For example: If you need to support up to 1,000 meeting participants at any given time, you would need to deploy at least 5 MMRs (A Meeting Connector VM plus 4 additional MMR VMs). This setup would support up to 1,000 concurrent meeting participants.

For more information on the Meeting Connector concepts, including the networking schema for the on-premise service, please see [Meeting Connector Core Concepts](/hc/en-us/articles/201363113).

For instructions on deploying Meeting Connectors, please see: [Getting Started with the Meeting Connector](/hc/en-us/articles/201363093).

pageTitle: Sharing slides as a Virtual Background
body:
If you want to stop imposing your video on top of the slides and have it sent as a separate video feed:


1. Click, the **...**in the presentation menu.![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/generic/in-meeting/video-options-menu-vb.png)
2. Click **Split Video from Slides**.![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/generic/in-meeting/split-video-vb.png)
3. Your participants will now view your slides as a normal screen share and your video feed will be sent as a separate feed. You can still navigate slides in the meeting controls.![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/generic/in-meeting/split-presentation-vb.png)
4. To re-impose your video on the slides, click **Merge Video and Slides**.![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/generic/in-meeting/merge-video-slides.png)
**Source**: Displays the camera being used in the Zoom Room. Tap another source to change the camera.

*

+ **Minor enhancements**

Meeting and webinar hosts can control whether participants can chat with everyone, with panelists and the host (for webinars), or with the host only.


1. Start a meeting or webinar as host.
2. Click **Chat** in the Meeting Controls.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/generic/in-meeting/chat-icon.png)
3. At the bottom of the in-meeting Zoom Group Chat window, click **More**, and then choose an option for **Allow attendees to chat with**.


	* For meetings, the host can allow attendees to chat with everyone or with the host only.
	![Screen_Shot_2020-07-24_at_10.57.39_AM.png](https://support.zoom.us/hc/article_attachments/360062931651/Screen_Shot_2020-07-24_at_10.57.39_AM.png)
	* For webinars, the host can allow attendees to chat with no one, with all panelists (including host), or with all panelists and attendees.
	![Screen_Shot_2020-07-24_at_11.10.59_AM.png](https://support.zoom.us/hc/article_attachments/360062753232/Screen_Shot_2020-07-24_at_11.10.59_AM.png)

subTitles: Assigning a provision template during provisioning
body:
1. Follow the steps to [add a desk phone](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360021119092#h_5ca07504-68a8-4c3d-ad0e-c1d3594436da).
**Note**: Make sure you specified a [desk phone that supports provision templates](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360029698771). You can't select a provision template if the desk phone doesn't support it.
2. In the **Provision Template (Optional)** drop-down-menu, select the template to assign, then click **Save**.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/web/zoom-voice/phones-and-devices/add-desk-phone-pop-up-select-provision-template.png)The template will be applied to the desk phone during the [provisioning process](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360033223411).

**Note**:


* Starting September 27, Zoom will require that all meetings have a passcode or a Waiting Room enabled for accounts with a single licensed user, Pro accounts with 2 or more licenses, and Business accounts with 10-100 licenses. Meeting passwords (passcodes) are already [enforced for all free accounts](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360042647952).
* For Zoom for Government accounts with fewer than 100 licenses, Passcodes or Waiting Rooms will be required on October 18, 2020. For more information, contact your Customer Success Manager or [Zoom support](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/requests/new).
* Starting December 20, 2020, Zoom will require that all meetings for certain accounts are secured with one of these options: passcode, **Waiting Room**, or **Only authenticated users can join meetings**. Refer to [meeting settings](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360034675592) for more information.

* Minor bug fixes

April 8, 2020 version **4.6.10 (20012.0407)**

Zoom recordings use the following file formats:


* **MP4**: Audio/Video file that is named **zoom\_0.mp4** by default. Each subsequent recording is in sequential order: zoom\_0, zoom\_1, zoom\_2, etc.
* **M4A**: Audio-only file that is named **audio\_only.m4a** by default. Each subsequent recording is in sequential order: audio\_only\_0,audio\_only\_1, etc.
* **M3U:** Playlist file to play all individual MP4 files (Windows only). Named **playback.m3u** by default.
* **TXT:** Text file that is named **chat.txt** by default. This file contains the [in-meeting chat](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203650445-In-Meeting-Chat) messages. A chat file saved locally will include chat messages sent to everyone and any chat messages sent to/from the participant who saves the chat.

**Note:** Screen sharing recording uses about 20MB of storage per hour while video recording uses about 200MB of storage an hour. This is an approximation, since the resolution and types of video or screen sharing content could change the amount of storage used.

subTitles: Enabling Code Snippet for Your Account
body:
1. Sign in to the Zoom web portal.
2. Click **Account Management** > [**IM Management**](https://zoom.us/account/imgroup).
3. Click the **IM Settings** tab.
4. Toggle **Code Snippet** to on (blue).
 ![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/web/account-management/im-management/enable-code-snippet-toggle.gif)It will now be enabled for your account.

**Unable to log in using Google Chrome or Firefox**

If you are unable to log in using Chrome or Firefox, and are seeing an 'Audit Failure' event with "Status: 0xc000035b" in the Event Viewer on the ADFS server, you will need to turn off Extended Protection. Chrome and Firefox do not support the Extended Protection of ADFS (IE does).


1. Launch IIS Manager
2. In the left panel, navigate to Sites > Default Web Site > ADFS > LS
3. Double-click Authentication icon
4. Right-click Windows Authentication
5. Select Advanced Settings
6. Turn OFF Extended Protection

1. Sign in to the Zoom web portal.
2. In the navigation menu, click **Phone System Management** then **[Auto Receptionists](https://zoom.us/pbx/page/telephone/auto-receptionists#/auto-receptionists)**.
3. Click **Add**.
4. Enter the following information:


	* **Site** (only visible if you have [multiple sites](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360020809672-Managing-Multiple-Sites)): Select a site for the new auto receptionist.
	* **Name**: Enter a name to help identify the auto receptionist.
5. Click **Save**.


6. Change the [auto receptionist settings](#h_1d5ffc56-6ba3-4ce5-9d86-4a1a1ee743f3) as needed.

pageTitle: Archiving chat messages using cloud storage
body:
When [IM groups](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203749815) is enabled on your Zoom account, chat messages are automatically archived and stored on Zoom’s cloud leveraged AWS DynamoDB. Archived messages are stored up to 10 years.

**Note**: If a user switched from a free account to a paid account, account owners and admins can only access chat history from the time that the user became a paid account.

This article covers:


* [Enabling group messaging archiving](#h_4ec47930-f741-4e32-b484-a20f8ac79333)
* [Downloading archived messages](#h_d89b12d3-f0a3-4e1f-9d74-810b9c3a981e)

The user given scheduling privilege will need to logout of the Zoom client and login again for the scheduling privilege option to appear.


1. Sign in to the Zoom Desktop Client.
2. Click on the **Schedule** icon.
![](https://zoom-support-cdn.s3.amazonaws.com/images/en-us/desktop/linux/home/schedule-button.png)This will open the scheduler window.
3. Find the **Schedule for** section, found below the **Topic** section, and choose the user you want to **Schedule For** from the dropdown menu.
4. Click **Schedule**to finish, and open up the calendar you have selected.

subTitles: Inviting Panelists and Alternative Hosts to spectator events
body:
You can invite up to 100 [Panelists](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360049497492#h_01ESSE6SK8K5BAMV11CQF61MGW) or [Alternative Hosts](https://support.zoom.us/hc/articles/360049497492#h_01EQBRXH8QA8HK4FMG020288XE) when you create a spectator event or after you have already published a spectator event.

Please note that Panelists will receive a direct email invitation that is separate from the Attendees of the event.

pageTitle: Personal meeting ID (PMI) and personal link
body:
As the account owner or admin, you can disable Personal Meeting ID for your account or for a group on your account. Disabling the feature defaults this setting to off for your users, but they can re-enable it in their user settings. If you want to disable Personal Meeting ID entirely, follow the steps below to disable the setting and then complete the optional step to lock the setting.

Once Personal Meeting ID is disabled and locked, users will need to edit any previously scheduled meetings with PMI to update the meeting ID. After editing the meeting ID, they will need to resend the invitation to the meeting invitees.

To disable the setting Enable Personal Meeting ID for all users in the account:


1. Sign in to the Zoom web portal as an admin with the privilege to edit account settings.
2. In the navigation panel, click **Account Management** then [**Account Settings**](https://zoom.us/account/setting).
3. Under **Schedule Meeting**, click the toggle to disable the setting **Enable Personal Meeting ID**.
 ![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/web/account-management/account-settings/disable-enable-personal-meeting-id.png)
4. (Optional) If you want to disable this setting for all users in your account, click the lock icon, and then click **Lock** to confirm the setting.

pageTitle: Changing the video layout (Active Speaker View and Gallery View)
body:
There are 3 video layouts when no one in the meeting is screen sharing: Active Speaker View, Gallery View, and floating thumbnail window. When someone is screen sharing, you can use [Side-by-side Mode](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115004802843) or view the screen share with Active Speaker View. Any of these layouts can be used in full screen or windowed mode, with the exception of the floating thumbnail view.

You can also [pin](/hc/en-us/articles/201362743) or [spotlight](/hc/en-us/articles/201362653) up to 9 participants' videos.

This article covers:


* [Active Speaker View](#h_b80d529d-edd7-4486-8c21-bec9c9d55395)
* [Gallery View](#h_ac952845-ed43-4884-8263-4356f98e26f3)
* [Full screen](#h_e64dbc14-fdcf-492b-8c65-6e918a7d8952)
* [Customizing the video order](#h_01EJ7EVXH61CK63G23CJFBQY3C)
* [Floating thumbnail window](#h_29171b3b-71eb-4b42-8bc4-30bf2f778d95)
* [Layout when screen sharing](#h_e38e1056-0b7c-4678-a9ba-a1468b5f54a9)
* [Hide non-video participants](#h_7fbf4fed-9ea2-44ed-83d4-11f1b7b689cd)
* [Switching between Gallery View and Active Speaker View](#h_01EF2V8EACKNQ0R96A2WJMPSC2)

subTitles: Enable MAPI for calendar integration from account settings
body:
1. As an admin or owner, sign in to the [Zoom web portal](https://zoom.us/profile).
2. n the navigation panel, click **Account Management** then **[Account Settings](https://zoom.us/account/setting)**.
3. In the **Meeting** tab, scroll down to the **Calendar and Contacts** section.
4. Enable **Calendar and contacts integration**.
5. Select **Exchange**.
6. Enable **Use MAPI to integrate with Zoom desktop client (for Windows only)**.![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/web/account-management/account-settings/mapi-account-authenication.png)
7. Click **Save**.
8. (Optional) Click the lock ![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/web/generic/lock-unlocked-icon.png) icon to force users on the account to only use MAPI for calendar integration.
**Note**: If this setting is locked, this will automatically be configured for all users on the account, and only Windows users will be able to use calendar integration. If this setting is left unlocked, macOS users will be able to use O365 or Google authentication for calendar integration.

pageTitle: Setting up Zoom Rooms for Touch with Dual Monitors
body:
**Overview**

Zoom Rooms for Touch works with a dual monitor setup that has one touchscreen monitor and one regular monitor. The touchscreen monitor displays Zoom Room controls (e.g. in-meeting controls, whiteboard annotation controls) while the regular monitor is used for displaying participants' video.

This article covers:


* [Setting up Zoom Rooms for Touch with Dual Monitors](#setting-up)
* [Changing the Monitor Used as a Touchscreen](#changing-monitor-touchscreen)

**Note**: If the secondary monitor is a non-touch based display, screen shares will always show on the touch-based display, to utilize the full annotation/whiteboard features.

**Prerequisites**


* Windows PC with dual monitors (one must be a [touch screen monitor](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/204003179)).


	+ Zoom Rooms for Conference Room for PC - **January 2019 Release** or later
* Chrome OS device with dual monitors


	+ Zoom Rooms for Chrome OS - **April 2019 Release** or later
	+ Recommended devices:
	
	
		- HP Chromebox G2 i7-8650U,
		- Acer Chromebox CXI3 i7-8550U
		- CTL Chromebox CBX1-7 i7-8550U
	+ Minimum supported devices:
	
	
		- Acer Chromebox CXI3 i5-8250U
		- HP Chromebox G2 i5-7300U

**Setting up Zoom Rooms for Touch with Dual Monitors**


1. Sign in to Zoom Rooms for Conference Room.
Zoom Rooms will display the following message on both monitors.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/zoom-rooms/zoom-rooms-for-touch/use-this-as-touch-screen.png)**Note**: If you don't see this message, Zoom Rooms is not detecting a touchscreen monitor. Make sure your touchscreen monitor has the correct drivers installed. Also check if it needs a secondary connection to your PC. Most touchscreen monitors require a USB connection in addition to a video connection (e.g. HDMI, VGA, etc.)
2. On the touchscreen monitor, tap **Use This as The Touch Screen Display**.
The touchscreen monitor will display the homepage controls, while the regular monitor will display the Zoom Room background image.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/zoom-rooms/zoom-rooms-for-touch/dual-monitors-homepage-controls.png)While in a meeting, the touchscreen monitor displays the [whiteboard](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115004797286) and [in-meeting controls](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115004773303), while the regular monitor displays participant's video.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/zoom-rooms/zoom-rooms-for-touch/dual-monitors-in-meeting-controls.png)
3. To change what displays on each monitor, you can [customize the display settings in the Zoom web portal](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/209181346).

**Changing the Monitor Used as a Touchscreen**

Follow these steps if Zoom Rooms incorrectly identifies the touchscreen monitor and you need to change it.


1. Sign in to Zoom Rooms for Conference Room.
2. Click **Settings** in the bottom-right corner of the meeting controls screen.
3. Click **Displays** and enter the room's passcode if prompted.
Zoom Rooms will display the following message on both monitors.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/zoom-rooms/zoom-rooms-for-touch/use-this-as-touch-screen.png)
4. On the touchscreen monitor, tap **Use This as The Touch Screen Display**.

* **Change to default behavior of desktop notifications for upcoming meetings**New users will have this setting enabled by default, reminding them of upcoming meetings through a desktop notification. Existing users will not be affected, keeping this setting as it currently is on their profile. This can be enabled through the Settings page in the Zoom web portal, or in the desktop client’s general settings.

pageTitle: Recommended settings for Home Office Zoom Rooms
subTitles: Home Office Zoom Rooms in a business environment
body:
Locate the newly created Zoom Room on the **Room Management** page and click **Edit**. Make the following recommended changes for a Home Office Zoom Room. If a setting is not listed below, then keep the default.


* **Rooms Profile tab**


	+ **Rooms Profile - Basic**
	+ Avatar: Add a user profile picture if you have one.
	+ Room name: Default to user name and add “Room”.
	+ Calendar: See calendar setup above.
	+ Room Passcode: Create something unique for the user (for example, the last 4 digits of his phone number).
	+ Hide Room in Contacts: Set to **On**.
	+ **Rooms Profile - Setup**
	+ Room Personal Link: Set this string to something all lowercase that’s easy to remember (for example, johnsmithpzr).
	+ Host Key: Create something that is unique to the user.
	+ Default Call in Country/Region: Set this to the country where user’s device will be located.
	+ **Rooms Profile - Room Location**
	+ Edit the location here if you need to make changes.
	+ **Rooms Profile - Phone Integration**
	+ For Zoom Phone: Click **Phone System Management** then click **Users and Rooms**. Next click the **Zoom Rooms** tab, then click **Add**. Choose the site. Choose the Home Office zoom room name you created.
	+ **Rooms Profile - Devices**Keep the defaults.

*

+ **Rooms Profile - Control System API**Keep the defaults.
*

+ **Rooms Profile - Device Management**Keep the defaults.

* **Meeting tab**


	+ **Meeting - Zoom Rooms**
	+ Display Meetings on TV: This may be considered personal data. Ask the home user to where he intends to put the device. If it is a high-traffic area (where people passing by might be able to see the schedule) then consider turning this setting **Off**. Alternatively, the Zoom Room admin can set **Transform all meetings to private** to **On** (see below).
	+ Automatically accept incoming call and far end camera control: Set this to **Off** for personal locations.
	+ Lock speaker volume control on controller: **Off**
	+ Automatic direct sharing using ultrasonic proximity signal: The recommended setting is **Off** if you will be placing the device in an area frequented by young children or dogs who may be sensitive to an ultrasonic signal
	+ Automatic start scheduled meetings: **Off**
	+ Automatic stop scheduled meetings: **Off**
	+ Audio Device Daily Auto Testing: **Off**
	+ Encrypt direct share content: **On**
	+ Show call history in Zoom Rooms: **On**
	+ Show contact list on controller: **On**
	+ Count the number of attendees in a Zoom Room: The recommended setting is **Off** if your device is in a location where family members or other individuals might be visible in the background.
	+ **Meeting - Schedule Meeting**
	+ Use RMI when starting an instant meeting: **Off**
	+ Require a password when scheduling new meetings: **On**
	+ Require a password for instant meetings: **On**
	+ Require a password for Room Meeting ID (Applicable for Zoom Rooms only): **On**
	+ Generate a unique password for the user. Write down the password that generated so it can be given to the home user.
	+ **Meeting - In Meeting (Basic)**
	+ Enable chat notifications on TV: **On**
	+ Group HD Video: Verify that the user’s at-home network can support the [system requirements for HD video](/hc/en-us/articles/207347086).
	+ Annotation: **On**
	+ **Meeting - In Meeting (Advanced)**
	+ Breakout Rooms: **Off**
	+ Far end camera control: **Off**
	+ Waiting Room: **On**
	+ **Meeting - Recording**Keep the defaults.

*

+ **Meeting - Security**Keep the defaults.

+ **Meeting - 3rd Party Audio Conferencing**Keep the defaults.

* **Display tab**

Keep the defaults.


* **Alert tab**


	+ Generally speaking, in a home environment there is a greater chance of devices going on and off, or bandwidth issues occurring. There several alerts that could become a nuisance for home users if these are common issues.
* **Digital Signage tab**


	+ It is recommend that the defaults be kept.
* **Schedule Display tab**


	+ It is recommend that all these settings be turned off for home users. See below if the Home Office Zoom Room is setup in a business environment.

It is recommend that these be configured as you would a common area Zoom Room so users can determine whether the room is busy or not.


* **Schedule Display tab**


	+ Instant Room Reservation: **Off**
	+ All to reserve other rooms: **Off**
	+ Background Image: Use an image of the person that the Home Office Zoom Room belongs to. If that is not available, choose **Set to the same image as Zoom Room background**.
	+ LED Enclosure Integration: Set to the company default.

pageTitle: New Updates for Zoom Rooms for Chrome OS
body:
* Minor Bug Fixes

August 11, 2019 Version **3.6.7 (3696.0809)**

**New and Enhanced Features**


* **Prompt to Unmute When Spotlighted**When a user is spotlighted, they will get prompted to ask if they want to unmute.
* **Display an On-Display Notification When the Room is Muted or Unmuted**

**Resolved Issues**


* Minor Bug Fixes

August 5, 2019 Version **3.6.7 (3676.0805)**

**Resolved Issues**


* Minor Bug Fixes

July 17, 2019 Version **3.6.7 (3675.0710)**

**New and Enhanced Features**


* **In Meeting Features**


	+ **Setting to Display Top Banner In Meeting**Zoom Room admins can now choose to display a banner at the top of their Zoom Room display. This banner includes the room name, time, and sharing key.
	+ **Show Room Status**The Zoom Room’s presence will now show as “In a Calendar Event” when the room’s calendar is booked and the room is not in a call and “In a Zoom Meeting” when the calendar is booked and the room is in a call.
	+ **Support for Whiteboard on Chromebase**
* **Management Features**


	+ **Check-in to a Zoom Room**The check-in feature helps maximize your room utilization. When this option is turned on, users must start the scheduled Zoom meeting or check-in to keep a room reservation. If user does not check-in within a configurable number of minutes after the scheduled start time, the room is released from the scheduled meeting and available for other users to use. Zoom Rooms activity such as starting a scheduled meeting, starting an instant meeting, making a phone call, and starting a screen share count as checking-in and do not require checking in separately. This feature can be configured on the Zoom web portal. [Learn more about the check-in feature.](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360001147163-Check-In-with-Zoom-Rooms)

**Resolved Issues**


* Minor Bug Fixes

June 17, 2019 Version **3.6.6 (3365.0617)**

**Resolved Issues**


* Minor Bug Fixes

June 10, 2019 Version **3.6.6 (3363.0605)**

**Resolved Issues**


* Minor Bug Fixes

April 28, 2019 Version **3.6.6 (3360.0425)**

**New and Enhanced Features**


* **In Meeting Features**


	+ **Consent to Being Recorded Confirmation** Once enabled through meeting settings, meeting participants will be notified that their meeting is being recorded and will have the option to consent to being recorded or leave the meeting. The recording consent information will be included in the Active Host report.

**Resolved Issues**


* Minor Bug Fixes

April 14, 2019 Version **3.6.5 (3342.0410)**

**New and Enhanced Features**


* **Support for Dual Screens**You can now use two displays with your Chrome Zoom Room. We recommend the following devices: HP Chromebox G2 i7-8650U, Acer Chromebox CXI3 i7-8550U, and CTL Chromebox CBX1-7 i7-8550U. The minimum supported devices are Acer Chromebox CXI3 i5-8250U and HP Chromebox G2 i5-7300U.
* **Share a Mobile Device** You can now share a mobile device in your Zoom Room by clicking on Share Screen in the Zoom mobile app.
* **Office 365 Calendar Integration** The Office 365 Calendar Integration allows members of your organization to schedule meetings in the Zoom Room. Scheduled meetings are displayed on the room screen and the Zoom Room controller and can be started with one click. [Learn more.](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203847179-Setting-Up-Zoom-Rooms-with-Office-365)
* **Toggle Between Content and Video Thumbnails** When viewing a content share with the video view in speaker mode, you can now toggle between which is maximized and which is viewed as a thumbnail.

**Resolved Issues**


* Minor Bug Fixes

March 15, 2019 Version 3.3.1662.0322

**Resolved Issues**


* Minor Bug Fixes

February 13, 2019 Version **3.6.2999.0212**

**Resolved Issues**


* Minor Bug Fixes

January 27, 2019 Version **3.6.2995.0127**

**New and Enhanced Features**


* **In Meeting Features**


	+ **Toggle Between Hiding and Showing Local Video** Participants in a Zoom Room can now choose to hide or show their local video from the Zoom Room Controller, on the Participants List.
	+ **Toggle Between Hiding and Showing Non-Video Participants**Participants in a Zoom Room can now choose to show or hide non-video participants during a meeting.
	+ **Support for Waiting Room** Zoom Rooms can now use waiting rooms at a host or participant. As the host, the Zoom Room can see who joins and admit them to the meeting.
	+ **Identify External Participants**The host can now view which meeting participants are part of a different account from the Zoom Rooms Controller.
* **Management Features**


	+ **Show a Black Screen outside of Operation Time** Zoom Room displays will now go black outside of the operation times, unless CEC is being utilized.

**Resolved Issues**

* **Display content on Zoom Rooms screens**


	+ Use the screens in your Zoom Rooms to display static or dynamic content when the rooms are not being used for meetings. This is configured on the Zoom Rooms page of the Zoom web portal.
* **Pin Video
Pin a specific video the Zoom Room display so that the local display will not switch to other participants in Active Speaker mode.**


* **Make a Phone Call when using the Room in Touch mode**

subTitles: Enabling Virtual Background during a meeting
body:
If you have already have Virtual Background enabled in the web portal, you can turn it on during a meeting.


1. In a Zoom meeting, click the upward arrow (**^**) next to **Start/Stop Video**.
2. Click **Choose Virtual Background...**. **![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/generic/enable-virtual-background-in-meeting.png)**.
3. If prompted, click **Download** to download the package for virtual background without a green screen.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/generic/settings/download-smart-virtual-background.png)

pageTitle: Getting Started on Windows and Mac
body:
Select the **Chat** tab to view private conversations with your contacts or group conversations ([channels](/hc/en-us/articles/200912909)).

![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/generic/chat/chat-tab.png)

You can access these features in the left-side panel:

![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/generic/chat/left-side-panel.png)


* **Jump to** search box: Search for a contact or channel.
* **Starred Messages**: View messages you have [starred](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115004789183-Starring-Editing-and-Deleting-Chat-Messages).
* Click your name to use your [personal chat space](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360021806951-Using-your-Personal-Chat-Space).
* Add icon ![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/generic/chat/add-icon.png) (next to **Recent**): Start a new chat with one of your contacts, [create a channel](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/200912909-Getting-Started-With-Channels-Group-Messaging-) for group chats, or [join an existing channel](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/200912909-Getting-Started-With-Channels-Group-Messaging-).
* Under **Recent**, click a contact to view chat history and continue to chat with them. Contacts have a [status icon](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360032554051) before their name.
 ![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/generic/chat/left-side-panel-contact-name.png)
* Under **Recent**, click a [channel](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/200912909-Getting-Started-With-Channels-Group-Messaging-) (indicated by the group icon before the name) to view the channel's chat history and send messages to channel members.
 ![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/generic/chat/left-side-panel-channel-name.png)

After selecting a contact or channel in the left-side panel, you can use these features in the chat window:
 ![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/generic/chat/chat-history-and-compose-chat.png)


* Star icon ![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/generic/chat/star-icon.png): Add the contact or channel to your [starred list](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115004055706-Managing-Contacts), giving you quick access to those contacts or channels.
* Video icon ![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/generic/chat/video-icon.png): Start a meeting with the contact. If a channel is selected, this will start a meeting with all members of the channel.
* New window icon ![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/generic/chat/new-window-icon.png) (hover your pointer over the contact or channel name to display this icon) : Opens the selected chat in a new window.
* Info icon ![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/generic/chat/info-icon.png): View additional options for the contact or channel. Also gives you quick access to files, images, and [starred messages](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115004789183-Starring-Editing-and-Deleting-Chat-Messages) in the selected chat.
* Message box: Compose and send messages to your contact or channel. You can also send [screenshots](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/202920879-Capture-Screen-Send-Picture-File-Transfer), [files](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/202920879-Capture-Screen-Send-Picture-File-Transfer), [code snippets](/hc/en-us/articles/360000489103), and [animated GIFs](/hc/en-us/articles/115004802246).

pageTitle: New updates for Zoom Rooms for macOS
body: * **Passcode and/or Waiting Room requirement**Zoom will now require that all meetings have a Passcode or a Waiting Room enabled for accounts with a single licensed user, Pro accounts with 2 or more licenses, and Business accounts with 10-100 licenses. For Zoom Rooms specifically, this requirement will impact users who reserve rooms on scheduling displays.  [Learn More](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360045009111).

Attendees can be prompted to provide their consent to be recorded in a meeting or a webinar. If the recording disclaimer is enabled, attendees will receive a notification when a recording starts or if they join a session that is already being recorded. The attendee can either consent to stay in the session or leave.

After the session a report listing the attendees who provided consent can be generated.

This article covers:


* [Enabling the recording disclaimer](#h_83ad102b-1cd5-44b8-b082-4208c49cbbb9)
* [Providing consent as an attendee](#h_0dd2a6aa-c2d2-45c3-be1e-216edb9a25b1)

![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/zoom-rooms/zoom-for-home/zoom-for-home-add-room.png)

A user who registers for the webinar before it starts will receive a link to join the webinar at the scheduled time. Users who register while the webinar is in progress will receive a link to join the webinar in progress. Users who register after the scheduled date and time will have the option to view the recording.

![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/web/my-webinars/registering-on-demand-webinar.png)

**Notes**:


* If you also enabled the setting to [close registration after the event date,](/hc/en-us/articles/202835649) people can use the original registration link to register for the on-demand recording.
* The registration list for for the on-demand webinar recording is separate from the [attendees of the live webinar](#h_0f8896b4-8faf-4aad-af69-feb43b250bc1). If you want to access registrants for the on-demand webinar recording, select your webinar in the [**Recordings**](https://zoom.us/recording) page and click **View Registrants**.
* If you want to share a direct link to your on-demand webinar, select your webinar in the [**Recordings**](https://zoom.us/recording) page and click **Copy Shareable Link**.

VAT is the abbreviation of Value Added Tax.  VAT is in general due when goods and/or services are sold.  It applies to most goods and services that are bought and sold for use or consumption in Mexico.  It is a **consumption tax** because it is ultimately borne by the final consumer.

subTitles: How does Zoom determine which customers Chilean VAT applies to?
body:
Chilean VAT law provides certain rules for the identification of the place where the services are consumed or used by individuals and business customers.

The place of consumption or “use” is deemed to be Chile if at least one of the below criteria is met:


* The IP address of the device used for facilitating the services is registered in Chile.
* The credit/ debit card, bank account or other payment method used for payment of the services is issued or registered in Chile.
* The address provided by the customer for invoicing or issuance of the payment receipt is in Chile; or
* The SIM card of the mobile phone used to receive the service has Chile as its country code.

As such, if any of the conditions are met, you have not provided your Tax ID number and have not Checked the Box in your Zoom account to state that you carry out activities in Chile that are subject to VAT, Chilean VAT will be charged on the supplies Zoom makes to you.

1. Start an instant meeting or scheduled meeting.
2. Tap **Start Recording** on your Zoom Room Controller.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/zoom-rooms/controller/meeting-controls-start-recording-button.png)
3. For **instant meetings**, enter the email address where the cloud recording link should be sent to.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/zoom-rooms/controller/email-address-for-recording-notification.PNG)


4. If this is a **scheduled meeting**, the cloud recording link will be sent to the email of the host that scheduled the meeting.


5. To stop the recording, press **Stop Recording** or select **Leave** and choose **End meeting for all**.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/zoom-rooms/controller/meeting-controls-stop-recording-button.png)

If you are experiencing any issue(s) with latency, frozen screen, poor quality audio, or meeting getting disconnected while using a home or non-enterprise WiFi connection, try the following:


* Watch a [video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UygPcBCFRrA) about WiFi connectivity
* Check your Internet bandwidth using an online speed test, such as [nperf](http://www.nperf.com/en/), [Speedtest](http://www.speedtest.net), or [Comparitech](http://compari.tech/speed)
* Try to connect directly via Wired (if your internet router has wired ports)
* Try bringing your computer or mobile device closer to the WiFi router or access point  in your home or office
* Upgrade your WiFI router firmware. Check your WiFi router vendor support site for firmware upgrade availability.
* Use a WiFi extender such as [Amped Wireless](http://www.ampedwireless.com/family/repeaters.html) or [Linksys](http://homestore.cisco.com/en-us/adapters/linksys-RE1000-range-extender-bridge_stcVVproductId136607179VVviewprod.htm) to increase the distance and strength of your WiFi signal
* Use a higher powered/long-range WiFi such as Amped Wireless [router](http://www.ampedwireless.com/family/routers.html) or [adapter](http://www.ampedwireless.com/family/adapters.html) to increase the WiFi signal on your PC or Mac
* [Home] Use a [DOCSIS 3.0](http://mydeviceinfo.comcast.net/) cable modem (if you have cable modem) to improve internet performance

If you are on corporate WiFi, try the following:


* Switch to a Wired connection
* Switch to a different WiFi hostpot if possible
* Check your Internet bandwidth using an online speed test, such as [nperf](http://www.nperf.com/en/), [Speedtest](http://www.speedtest.net), or [Comparitech](http://compari.tech/speed)
* Contact your corporate IT department to check your WiFi hotspot
* Turn off group HD in your [Account Management](/hc/en-us/articles/201363253-Account-Management) if your WiFI bandwidth is insufficient
* Turn off your corporate VPN if it's not required for the meeting

You can also [join a test meeting](/hc/en-us/articles/115002262083).

**Overview**

The Oracle Eloqua integration allows you to register contacts for a Zoom Webinar as part of your campaigns. It also lets you make decisions based on attendance or registration without needing to manually bring your Zoom data into Eloqua.

**Note**: The Zoom Feeder will only provide all contacts up to the time at which the Marketing user has activated the campaign. Any subsequent registrations will not be a part of the Eloqua Campaign as the integration only imports once into Eloqua at the time of the campaign’s activation. This will be addressed in a future update.

**Prerequisites**


* Must purchase a Video Webinar plan of 100, 500, 1000, 3000, 5000 or 10000 participants
* Host user type must be Licensed and be assigned the Webinar add-on

**Instructions**The following [document](https://support.zoom.us/hc/article_attachments/211569206/ZoomEloquaIntegration.pdf) goes over how to set up Oracle Eloqua with Zoom.

pageTitle: Raising your hand in a webinar
body:
If you [join the webinar by phone](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362663), dial ***9** to raise your hand.

**Note**: You can't use a phone to lower your hand.
