Rather than utilizing existing gathering spaces, utilize a smaller high quality production environment, placing the technology between you and your audiences. Distance learning, all hands meetings, interactive broadcasts & board meetings are just some of the use cases where a production studio for a high end Zoom Rooms experience will be beneficial.

1. Sign in to the Zoom web portal.
2. In the navigation panel, click [**Settings**](https://zoom.us/profile/setting).
3. Navigate to the **Recording**tab and verify that the **Cloud Recording** setting is enabled.
**Notes:**


	* If the setting is disabled, click the Status toggle to enable it. If a verification dialog displays, choose **Turn On** to verify the change.
	* If the option is grayed out, it has been locked and must be changed at either the group or account level. Contact your Zoom administrator for assistance.

pageTitle: Getting Started with  Zoom on Echo Show
body: * In some cases, Echo Show is not able to parse the meeting passcode and the user will need to manually enter the passcode on the Echo Show.

pageTitle: Reporting a participant for inappropriate behavior
body:
1. Tap **Participants** in the Meeting Controls.
2. Tap **Report**.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/mobile/ios/ipad/participants.png)
3. Tap the name of the participant you would like to report, then tap **Next**.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/mobile/ios/ipad/report-participant.png)
4. Tap the reason why you are reporting this participant.
5. Tap the text box and provide a brief description of what happened.
6. (Optional) Tap **Attach a Photo** to include a screenshot or photo of the incident.
7. Tap **Send**.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/mobile/ios/ipad/report-details.png)

Please go to the Mac OS Spotlight Search, type Console, then find User Diagnostic Reports. Get the latest zoom.us report and attach to the ticket

![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/mac/crash-log.png)

* **Minor bug fixes**

**October 26, 2020 version 5.4.53268.1025
Download type: Manual**

pageTitle: Using annotation tools on a shared screen or whiteboard
body:
The annotation tools available are dependent on whether you are on an iPad or iPhone.

**iPad**

![](https://zoom-support-cdn.s3.amazonaws.com/images/en-us/mobile/ios/ipad/annotation-controls.png)

**iPhone**

![](https://zoom-support-cdn.s3.amazonaws.com/images/en-us/mobile/ios/annotation-controls.png)


* Pencil icon: Show or hide annotation tools.
* **Spotlight**: Display a red dot on the shared screen at all times. Use this point out parts of the screen to other participants.
* **Pen**: Draw with a pen.
* **Highlighter**: Tap and drag to highlight parts of the screen.
* **Line** (iPad only): Tap and drag to draw a line.
* **Arrow** (iPad only): Tap and drag to draw an arrow.
* **Rectangle** (iPad only): Tap and drag to draw a rectangle.
* **Oval** (iPad only): Tap and drag to draw an oval.
* **Text** (iPad only): Type text on the shared screen.
* **Color**: Change the color and line width of your annotations.
* **Eraser**: Tap on your annotations to remove them.
* **Undo** (iPad only): Remove your last changes.
* **Redo** (iPad only): Add the annotations you previously removed.
* **Clear**: Clear your own annotations.

Tap the pencil icon to hide annotation tools, then tap **More** in the screen share controls for these annotation settings:

![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/mobile/generic/in-meeting/screen-share-more-options.png)


* **Allow/Disable participants annotation:** Allow or prevent the participants from annotating on your shared screen.
* **Show/Hide Names of Annotators**: Show or hide the participants' name when they are annotating on a screen share. If set to show, the participant's name will briefly display beside their annotation.
 ![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/generic/in-meeting/annotator-name.png)

pageTitle: Configure Auto Login for Zoom Rooms
body:
* Zoom Room license
* Admin privileges for Mac or Windows

pageTitle: Setting up a Zoom Rooms for Touch companion whiteboard
body:
After setting up a Zoom Rooms display, you can add a companion whiteboard:


1. Sign in to Zoom Rooms for Touch on the companion whiteboard device.
2. Select the Zoom Room you want to add the companion whiteboard to, then click **Next**.
 **Note**: Make sure to select a room that has a Zoom Rooms display set up.
3. Tap **Companion Whiteboard**.![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/zoom-rooms/zoom-rooms-for-touch/set-up-companion-whiteboard.png) Zoom Rooms will connect the device to the selected room and display the whiteboard. When the companion whiteboard isn't active, it will display the following screensaver.
 ![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/zoom-rooms/zoom-rooms-for-touch/companion-whiteboard-screensaver.png)

The Zoom Rooms app can use a second tablet as a simple and convenient room management tool to view upcoming meetings and schedule new meetings. Run the Zoom Rooms Controller in Scheduling Display mode and position the tablet outside of a Conference Room to display room availability and allow a room to be be reserved. The Scheduling Display will show all upcoming meetings for that day. You can also allow reserve the room and cancel their reservation.

Unlimited scheduling display rooms are included in the purchase of one or more Zoom Rooms licenses.

Scheduling displays can utilize the same calendar integrations as regular Zoom Rooms: Google Calendar, Office 365, or Microsoft Exchange. They can also use check in to manage room utilization and release a room from the calendar if no one starts or checks in to the room. [Learn more about check in.](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360001147163-Check-In-with-Zoom-Rooms)

[Learn more about recommended hardware and mounting options for Scheduling Display rooms.](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360000536906-Scheduling-Display)

This article covers:


* [Configure Zoom Rooms Scheduling Display](#h_aa872460-493a-42aa-a076-df4f0174fb57)
* [Switch between Scheduling Display mode and Room Controller mode](#h_39373e25-e125-4411-b30b-692da3163bb4)
* [Schedule a Meeting from the Zoom Rooms Scheduling Display](#h_9a60e979-0ab8-4825-8946-be30e873ac29)
* [Remove a meeting from the Scheduling Display](#remove)
* [Add a Scheduling Display Only Room](#h_af965153-55a4-453a-99ac-6e85a00dcf82)
* [Customizing the Scheduling Display from the Web Portal](#h_fecbe920-cbe6-4092-a2c0-4895d756e3bc)


	+ [Scheduling Display Device and App Info](#h_8c03e992-80e0-456a-a632-7fbd97adabc0)
	+ [Instant Room Reservation](#h_f238d011-188e-4a5e-9399-3c38ed7f3b08)
	+ [Background Image](#h_28ff1173-12fc-426c-8ff1-09f96b175bfe)
	+ [LED Enclosure Integration](#h_3755ad76-6b9e-4e27-b73d-fec97f3c73eb)

pageTitle: Managing conference rooms added to Zoom Phone
body:
* Pro, Business, or Education account
* Account owner or admin permissions
* Zoom Phone license

Before you use shared line groups, consider these limitations:


* A shared line group can contain up to 10 members.
* A shared line group can have 0–10 phone numbers. All members can use these number to make or receive calls.
* By default, a shared line group can handle up to 4 calls at the same time.
* If routing to voicemail, you can only route to the shared line group's voicemail inbox. You can't route to a voicemail inbox that belongs to another extension.
* A shared line group will ring all members simultaneously for incoming calls.

pageTitle: Firefox opening multiple tabs when joining a meeting
body:
**About**

When trying to join a Zoom meeting, Mozilla Firefox will begin to repeatedly open tabs.

**Troubleshooting**


1. Open Firefox "Options Menu"
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/integration/firefox/infinite-tabs.png)
2. Go to applications and ensure zoommtg is either set to "Always Ask" or "Use Zoom Meetings". If you do not see "Use Zoom Meetings", please download the latest version [here](https://zoom.us/support/download).
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/integration/firefox/change-zoom-action.png)

If you are still experiencing issues, please [submit a request](/hc/en-us/requests/new).

subTitles: Broadcasting a message to all breakout rooms
body:
The host can broadcast a message to all breakout rooms to share information with all participants.


1. Click **B****reakout Rooms** in the meeting controls.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/generic/in-meeting/breakout-rooms-icon.png)
2. Click **Broadcast a message to all**, enter your message and click **Broadcast**.
3. The message will now appear for all participants in breakout rooms.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/generic/breakout-room-boardcast-message-example.png)

If you tap **Ask for Help**, it will notify the meeting host that you need assistance and they will be asked to join your breakout room.


1. Tap **Ask for Help**.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/mobile/ios/ask-for-help-button.PNG)
2. Confirm that you would like assistance by tapping **Invite Host**.
[![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/mobile/ios/invite-host-to-breakout-room.PNG)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/article_attachments/115018148766/IMG_4982.PNG)

pageTitle: New Updates for Zoom Rooms Android Controller
body:
* Minor bug fixes

December 15, 2019 Version **4.6.0 (40654.1216)**

**Changes to Existing Features**


* **Multi-share Audio Enhancement**When multi-sharing is enabled, everyone in the meeting can share their audio through multi-share simultaneously. Users can choose to mute/unmute any incoming audio channel(s).

**New and Enhanced Features**


* **In-meeting features**


	+ **Multiple Controllers and Scheduling Displays in a Single Zoom Room**Admins can assign up to 10 devices as controllers and scheduling displays for one Zoom Room. These devices can be used simultaneously.
	+ **Support for Korean Language**
	+ **Zoom Rooms for Touch Companion Whiteboard**Admins can deploy an additional Zoom Room for Touch device to an existing Zoom Room. The additional device can be used as a whiteboard or for screensharing.
	+ **Virtual Background with Green Screen**Admins can upload virtual backgrounds to the Zoom web portal. These backgrounds can then be selected by users from zoom room controllers.
	+ **Additional Controller Options**Users can restart, shut down, or sign out of a Zoom Room from the controller. Some options are only available for specific types of zoom room setups.
	+ **Local View for Screen Sharing**Zoom room setups with three screens can have one screen designated for local view. The screen designated for local view will only display shared content to the attendees physically present in the room.
	+ **Transfer Zoom Phone Call**Users can transfer active Zoom Phone calls from a Zoom Room to another user.
	+ **Zoom Phone 3-way Calling**Users can have multiple active calls simultaneously in a Zoom Room, and merge the calls when desired.
	+ **Convert Zoom Phone Call to Zoom Meeting**Users can convert a Zoom Phone call in a Zoom Room to a Zoom meeting.
	+ **Upcoming Meeting Alert Enhancement**Admins can disable on screen alerts for upcoming meetings that display on the Zoom Room computer. Alerts are still displayed during active meetings and on Zoom Room controllers.
	+ **One Click to Join Google Hangouts Meeting**Users can join the audio of a Google Hangouts meeting with one click from the Zoom Room controller.
	+ **Advanced Noise Suppression**Users can choose moderate or aggressive noise suppression on their Zoom Room controllers to eliminate background noise. This feature can also be disabled.
	+ **Intent API support for LED enclosure integration**Admins can now utilize the Intent API for devices with LED enclosures, to indicate the current room status with different LED colors.
	+ **End-of-meeting experience feedback survey**Admins can choose to display the end-meeting-feedback survey on Android and Polycom Trio Zoom Room controllers.
	+ **Enhanced user interface when leaving or ending a meeting**
	+ **Ultrasonic direct share for Yealink CP960**Rooms with Yealink CP960 can now use direct share to share content to their room screens or into a Zoom meeting. The Yealink CP960 must be hardware version 73.1.0.74.1.0.1 or higher.
	+ **Split screen layout and weather display for Digital Signage**Admins can choose templates that will display multiple types of content on a digital signage screen.
* **Management features**


	+ **Default Camera Preset**Users can setup a default camera position for a Zoom Room. This camera position will be active when a meeting starts.
* **Peripheral device support**


	+ **Room Controls**Projectors, motorized screens, lighting and other third party IP-capable equipment that can be controlled via UDP/TCP can be integrated and controlled from the Zoom Room Controller interface. Click [here](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360033716572-Room-Controls) to learn more.
	+ **Support for Poly TC8 and Neat Pad**

**Resolved Issues**


* Minor Bug Fixes

September 30, 2019 Version **4.5.2 (40541.0929)**

**Resolved Issues**


* Minor Bug Fixes

September 8, 2019 Version **4.5.0 (40516.0903)**

**Changes to Existing Features**


* **Automatic Meeting Password Entry during Meeting Join**Zoom Rooms will now automatically detect the meeting password in a calendar invite and enter it when joining.

**New and Enhanced Features**


* **In Meeting Features**


* **One Click to Join Third Party Meetings**With one click, Zoom Rooms can now join BlueJeans meetings with an H.323/SIP address.


* **View In-Meeting Public Chat**Zoom Rooms can now view in-meeting public chat messages. A notification will be displayed on the Zoom Rooms screen and user has the option to view the chat messages on the Zoom Rooms controller and Zoom Rooms display.
* **Option to turn on Audio Log**Users can now start collecting logs when experiencing audio issues. This will allow Zoom support to help troubleshoot audio issues.
* **Unmute confirmation in Zoom Rooms**When the meeting host unmutes a Zoom Room, the room will receive a notification, requesting user to confirm if they want to unmute or stay muted.
* **Presenting IM Status When Screensharing**When a user is sharing their screen, the room’s IM Status will say “Presenting” and incoming notifications will not be displayed.
* **Prompt to Unmute When Spotlighted**When a user is spotlighted, they will get prompted to ask if they want to unmute.


* **Scheduling Display Features**


* **Reserve Other Rooms and View Floor Map**Users can now reserve other rooms from the Scheduling Display. If this feature is enabled, admins can also upload a map of their floor plan to help users find an available room nearby. [Contact Zoom Support to have this feature enabled.](/hc/en-us/requests/new)


* **Management Features**


	+ **Device Profiles**Admins can create device profiles for different types of meetings. Device profiles can be configured to have specific display settings, cameras, speakers, microphones, and screen layouts. Once created, room profiles can be selected for use via the Zoom Room controller. This feature requires a Mac computer and an iOS or Android controller.
	+ **Assign the Same Activation Code**Admins can now assign the same activation code to a Zoom Room to login to the room with the activation code multiple times or push the code through a device management service.
	+ **Change Password on Windows IoT Devices**Admins can now change the Windows login password on Windows IoT devices using the Zoom Rooms Controller or Zoom Rooms for Touch.
	+ **Hardware Volume Synchronization**If a user changes the volume on a device, the volume change will now be synced to the Zoom Room computer and controller.
	+ **64-bit Support**

**Resolved Issues**


* Minor Bug Fixes

June 24, 2019 Version **4.4.1 (40447.0621)**

**Changes to Existing Features**


* **Make Outbound H.323/SIP Calls without CRC Licenses**Zoom Rooms can now call out to one H.323 or SIP address without a CRC license. CRC licenses will still need to be available on the meeting host’s account for H.323 or SIP devices to call in to a Zoom meeting.

**New and Enhanced Features**


* **In Meeting Features**


	+ **Support for Additional Call In/Call Out Countries**The following additional Call-in/Call-out countries are now supported: American Samoa, Barbados, Dominica, Guam, Northern Mariana Islands, Saint Lucia, Saint Vincent and the Grenadines, Sint Maarten, and the U.S. Virgin Islands.
* **Peripheral Device support**


	+ **Support for Crestron TSS as a Zoom Rooms Controller**
	+ **Support the ability to end a Zoom meeting via the Crestron TSW panels programming**A Crestron control system program will have the ability to end a Zoom meeting/presentation via the TSW panels.  Programmers may choose to exercise the function as part of an overall system or touch panel shutdown flow.

**Resolved Issues**


* Minor Bug Fixes

May 19, 2019 Version **4.4.0 (40432.0517)**

**New and Enhanced Features**


* **Scheduling Display Standalone mode**You can configure a Scheduling Display for a conference room that does not include any additional Zoom Rooms components. Choose Scheduling Display Only when you add a Zoom Room on the Zoom web portal.
* **In Meeting Features**


	+ **Consent to Being Recorded Confirmation**Once enabled through meeting settings, meeting participants will be notified that their meeting is being recorded and will have the option to consent to being recorded or leave the meeting. The recording consent information will be included in the Active Host report.
	+ **One Click to Join Third Party Meetings**With one click, Zoom Rooms can now join Microsoft Teams and Skype for Business meetings with an H.323/SIP address. This feature requires a Cloud Room Connector license and the service configured on the third-party meeting service (Polycom RealConnect or Pexip). Polycom RealConnect and Pexip are the gateway/third-party interop services currently supported.
	+ **Option for “Attendees cannot unmute” on Zoom Rooms Controller**When this feature is enabled, attendees cannot unmute themselves. You can find this feature by clicking “More…” in Manage Participants
	+ **Support for Additional Call In/Call Out Countries**The following additional Call-in/Call-out countries are now supported: Antigua and Barbuda, Anguilla, Angola, Bangladesh, Botswana, British Virgin Islands, Grenada, Saint Kitts and Nevis, Morocco, Monaco, Montserrat, Mauritius, Nepal, Rwanda, and Turks and Caicos Islands.
	+ **Accessibility Enhancements**
* **Management Features**


	+ **Rename Cameras on the Zoom Rooms Controller**You can now rename cameras on the Zoom Rooms Controller. This setting is especially helpful when there are multiple cameras in the room.
* **General Features**


	+ **Deactivated Contacts will no longer show on Contact List**
* **Peripheral Device Support**


	+ **Access Trio Settings with Zoom Rooms app**Trio devices will now have display a menu item to access the Trio settings within the Zoom Rooms app.
	+ **CEC Control Support for Trio Zoom Room Controller**
	+ **Enhanced Settings Interface on Trio Devices**

**Resolved Issues**


* Minor Bug Fixes

January 31, 2019 Version **4.3.6 (40253.0127)**

**New and Enhanced Features**


* **Zoom Phone**Zoom Phone is a cloud phone system available as an add-on to Zoom’s platform. Support for inbound and outbound calling through the public switched telephone network (PSTN) and seamlessly integrated telephony features enable customers to replace their existing PBX solution and consolidate all of their business communication and collaboration requirements into their favorite video platform.
* **In Meeting Features**


	+ **Meeting and Call History**Participants can now view meeting and call history from their Zoom Room Controller. The history includes joined meetings and phone numbers. Account owners and admins can enable this feature from the Zoom web portal.
	+ **Support for the Raise Hand Feature**
	+ **Toggle Between Hiding and Showing Local Video**Participants in a Zoom Room can now choose to hide or show their local video from the Zoom Room Controller, on the Participants List.
	+ **Toggle Between Hiding and Showing Non-Video Participants**Participants in a Zoom Room can now choose to show or hide non-video participants during a meeting.
	+ **Support for Waiting Room**Zoom Rooms can now use waiting rooms at a host or participant. As the host, the Zoom Room can see who joins and admit them to the meeting.
	+ **Additional Participant Controls**Zoom Rooms can now assign co-host and a participant to closed caption.
	+ **Identify External Participants**The host can now view which meeting participants are part of a different account from the Zoom Rooms Controller.
	+ **Additional Status Options**The Zoom Room’s presence will now show as “In a Calendar Event” when the room’s calendar is booked and the room is not in a call and “In a Zoom Meeting” when the calendar is booked and the room is in a call.
	+ **Enhanced H.323/SIP Dialing**
	
	
		- **Keypad for DTMF Entry**Users who dial out to an H.323 device will now have a keypad available for the duration of the call to enter DTMF tones for the H.323 device.
		- **H.323/SIP Dial Out from the Meet Now Tab**On the Meet Now tab, users can click the Invite Room System tab to call out to an H.323/SIP room system.
		- **One Click to Join Third Party Meetings**With one click, Zoom Rooms can now join WebEx and GoToMeeting meetings with an H.323/SIP address. This feature requires a Cloud Room Connector license and the service configured on the third-party meeting service (Webex CMR or GTM InRoomLink). Please contact [Zoom Support](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/requests/new) to have this feature enabled.
	+ **Show the Meeting Password**If a meeting requires a password, the Zoom Room Controller will now show the password when viewing the meeting information during the meeting.
	
	
	+ **Management Features**
	
	
		- **Enhanced Support for Device Management**
		
		
			* **Automatic Sign-In**Automatic sign-in allows the Zoom Rooms app to automatically sign in to Zoom, without requiring an administrator to enter their credentials. This feature requires devices to be enrolled in a Mobile Device Management program.
		- **Customize HDMI Label**Account owners and admins can now add a customized HDMI sharing label on the web, which will display on the Zoom Room controller.
		
		
		- **Ability to Hide the Contact List**Admins can now choose to hide the Zoom Rooms contact list from all or select rooms. The setting “Show contact list on controller” is automatically enabled and can be disabled at an account, location, floor, or room level in the Zoom web portal.
		- **Option to Restrict Instant Room Reservations on a Scheduling Display**Account owners and admins can now restrict the option to instantly reserve Zoom Rooms from the iPad Scheduling Display.
	+ **Peripheral Device support**
	
	
		- **Option to turn on/off Intelligent Zoom for Panacast Cameras by default**
		- **Support for Crestron LED Enclosure**

**Resolved Issues**


* Minor Bug Fixes

November 25, 2018 Version **4.3.5(34912.1122)**

**Resolved Issues**


* **Minor Bug Fixes**

November 4, 2018 Version **4.3.4(34479.1105)**

**New and Enhanced Features**


* **Support for Scheduling Display in Portrait Mode**

**Resolved Issues**


* **Minor Bug Fixes**

September 24, 2018 Version **4.3.33237.0925**

**New and Enhanced Features**


* **In Meeting Features**


	+ **Multiple Content Sharing within a Zoom Room**Multiple screens can now be shared and viewed in a Zoom Room simultaneously. This needs to be enabled by an account owner or admin.
	+ **Dial Personal Link from a Zoom Room**The Zoom Room controller now supports entering a personal link, in place of a meeting ID, to join a personal meeting room.
	+ **Microphone Testing**On the Zoom Rooms Controller, users can start a microphone test. They will speak and wait for the playback to check if there are any issues with the audio.
	+ **Additional control of PTZ functionality for some camera models**
* **Management Features**


	+ **Zoom Rooms Scheduling Display**A new mode in the Zoom Rooms app configures your tablet as a simple and convenient tool that displays and schedules meetings. Run the app in Scheduling Display mode and position the tablet directly outside of the Zoom Room to display room availability and allow a room to be be reserved.
	
	
		- **Display Zoom Rooms availability from outside of the room**Position a tablet on the wall outside of a Zoom Room. The top portion of the tablet displays information about upcoming meetings scheduled for the room, while the bottom portion prominently shows whether the room is currently occupied or available.
		- **Instantly schedule meetings for Zoom Rooms**Use the Reserve button on the Scheduling Display to schedule your own meeting during a time period when the Zoom Room is free. Both the Scheduling Display and the Zoom Room calendar instantly show the new meeting, preventing others from double-booking the room.

**Resolved issues**


* Minor bug fixes

August 26, 2018 Zoom Rooms for Android Controller Version **4.3.30614.0822**

**Resolved issues**


* **Minor bug fixes**

July 1, 2018 Zoom Rooms for Android Controller Version **4.3.27613.0629**

**New and Enhanced Features**


* **Zoom Rooms In-meeting features**


	+ **One click to join a meeting hosted on a Third-Party Meeting Service**Users can schedule a Zoom Room with Skype for Business, WebEx or GoToMeeting and the Zoom Room will show a button to join the audio conference with one click. This may be useful for companies migrating to Zoom from other video conferencing solutions or who work with vendors and customers who use 3rd party meeting services. This feature requires callout and must be enabled by Zoom support.
	+ **On-Premise Cloud Recording Email Collection**If enabled, Zoom Rooms in an On-Premise configuration will prompt users to enter their email address when starting a recording.
	+ **Warning Messages for Performance or Network Issues**
	+ **Improvements to the in-meeting H.323/SIP call-out list**
* **Zoom Rooms Management features**


	+ **Check-in to a Zoom Room**The check-in feature helps maximize your room utilization. When this option is turned on, users must start the scheduled Zoom meeting or check-in to keep a room reservation. If user does not check-in within a configurable number of minutes after the scheduled start time, the room is released from the scheduled meeting and available for other users to use. Zoom Rooms activity such as starting a scheduled meeting, starting an instant meeting, making a phone call, and starting a screen share count as checking-in and do not require checking in separately. This feature can be configured on the Zoom web portal.
	+ **Improved Zoom Room Alerts**
	+ **Improved Certificate Handling**
* **Peripheral Device Support**


	+ **Polycom Trio Support**Polycom Trio can function as the controller and audio device in a Zoom Room. This requires the latest Polycom Trio firmware which can be downloaded from Polycom.
	+ **Exchange and O365 integration with Alexa**For Zoom Rooms with the Exchange or O365 calendar integration, you can now use Alexa.
	+ **Camera preset support for Marshall CV610-U2 camera**
	+ **Support for Behringer UMC1820 & UMC404HD**
	+ **Support for camera presets on Logitech Meetup and Logitech Rally camera**

**Resolved Issues**


* Optimized performance of HDMI capture devices
* Minor Bug Fixes

April 27, 2018: Zoom Rooms for Android Controller version **1.1.23870.0425**

**Resolved Issues**


* Minor bug fixes.

March 18, 2018: Zoom Rooms for Android Controller version **1.0.22557.0316**

**New and enhanced features**

**General Features**


* **Direct Share with Proximity Detection**Start a Screen Share from the Zoom Desktop Client using [Proximity Sharing](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/214629303). Currently supported with the Samsung Galaxy Tab A 8" and 10.1".

**In-meeting Features**


* Switch between shared content and speaker mode
In Zoom Rooms with a single screen, you can switch between shared content and the video of the active speaker. Tap Advanced (beneath the Change View button) to access this setting in the Advanced Settings dialog.
* Camera sharing in Zoom Rooms
If you have multiple cameras connected to your Zoom Rooms, you can display the video from one camera while sharing content from a different camera. During a meeting, tap the Share Content or Camera button, then choose a camera. This allows two video streams at once from your Zoom Room.
* Panacast camera preset support
You can use the camera preset values for Panacast cameras.

**Management Features**


* **Simplified Zoom Rooms setup**After you install the Zoom Rooms software on a Mac or Windows computer, the screen displays a pairing code that you can enter into a Zoom Room controller to automatically connect it to the Zoom Room. In addition, each time you add a room, an activation code is generated, and you can generate an activation code for an existing room on the [Zoom Rooms](https://zoom.us/location) page of the web portal. Enter this activation code on the Zoom Room controller to register the device without the need to sign in with administrator credentials. The activation code is shown on the web portal in the Location Directory.
* **Automatic audio echo test**Proactively tests your Zoom Rooms audio devices for echo daily.

**Resolved Issues**


* Additional minor bug fixes.

December 5, 2017 **1.0.16326.1205**

**New and enhanced features**


* **Mute on entry**Participants can be muted when they join the meeting.
* **Multiple MXL USB microphone support**When multiple MXL microphones are available in a Zoom Room, they are merged into a single entity and managed together. The room automatically detects which microphone needs to be active at a particular time. Using multiple microphones is particularly useful in large rooms where a single microphone might not detect the sounds from all parts of the room.
* **Control participant video**The **Manage Participants** menu includes the options **Ask to Start Video** and **Stop Video**.
* **Closed caption support**If enabled on the Zoom web portal, meetings in rooms that use an Android controller can display closed captions.
* **Power On/Off CEC TVs in Zoom Rooms**In Zoom Rooms that have CEC-supported TVs, you can power the TVs on or off using the Android controller.
* **Reduce excessive sound reverberation**In highly reverberant rooms, you can reduce the echo in the room for remote participants by enabling the **Reduce excessive sound reverberation** setting.
* **Simplified Microphone settings**A single **Software Audio Processing** setting replaces the settings for Software Echo Cancellation and Automatically Adjust Mic Level. Each microphone volume is automatically saved if it has been changed from default.
* **Start or switch to Zoom Rooms from another app**You can use the zoomrooms:// schema from another Android app to launch or switch to the Zoom Rooms controller.
* **Control PanaCast Intelligent Zoom**If you have the Intelligent Zoom feature enabled for a PanaCast camera, the Camera settings in the controller includes an option for Intelligent Zoom. If you enable this option, the camera zooms in and out to include all of the people in the room.
* **Switch to a specific active camera**If more than two cameras are available in the Zoom Room, you can dynamically choose which camera is active by choosing the camera from a list. Tap **Switch Camera** to display the list of available cameras and then tap the one you want to use.
* **Camera presets**The **Camera Control** option includes three buttons that can be used to return a camera to a specific preset position. This is available on supported models of Logitech and AVer cameras.

**Resolved issues**


* Minor bug fixes

September 13, 2017 **1.0.47705.0913**

**Resolved Issues**


* Minor bug fixes

September 11, 2017 **1.0.47361.0908**

**New and enhanced****Features**


* **Remotely control participant cameras
You can use the controller to remotely control a meeting participant’s camera or the camera in another Zoom Room or in a 323/SIP based Room System. Tap the Manage Participants icon, then tap the participant or room name and choose Request Camera Control. After the room or participant accepts the request, the camera controls for the other camera display on the controller.**
* **Pin a participant’s video
You can choose a participant whose video always displays during the meeting. Tap the Manage Participants icon and then tap the name of the participant and choose the Pin Video option from the menu.**
* **Control floating video location in a meeting
The Speaker view includes the Advanced option, where you can specify the corner of the screen in which the video thumbnail displays.**
* **Choose a Thumbnail, Gallery, or Speaker video layout
The Thumbnail layout combines the speaker view with a scaled down gallery view. In this layout, a single row of thumbnails containing the most recent speakers displays below a large view of the currently active speaker. Tap the Change View icon on the controller to switch among the layout choices.**
* **Hide host and meeting ID from private meetings
If this feature is enabled, private meetings do not show the host name or meeting ID on the controller or the Zoom Room screen. Individuals can join a private meeting from a Zoom Room by clicking the Start button, even though they cannot see the host or meeting ID.**

**Resolved Issues**


* Minor bug fixes

**July 24, 2017:**Zoom Rooms Android Controller App: **Version 1.0.40109.0721**

**New and enhanced****Features**


* **Incoming calls supported through SIP PBX**You can now choose to add SIP Phone Integration for a Zoom Room that uses the Android controller. See [Zoom Rooms PBX Support](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/215537603-Zoom-Rooms-PBX-Support)for details.
* **Lock speaker volume control**The Android controller locks the volume of the speaker if you enable the **Lock speaker volume control on controller** setting for the room.
* **Audio tones when entering a phone number outside of a meeting**When you are not in a meetings, and enter a phone number on the Android controller, you can hear a tone for each digit.
* **Support for arranging displays when a Zoom Room has 2 or 3 screens**If your Zoom Rooms has 2 or 3 screens, the Android controller arranges the displays according to the Display Settings that you specified on the web.
* **Country code for PSTN call-out**If your account supports telephone call-out, the country code will now be populated with the default call in country from the Zoom Rooms settings.
* **Remote management of the Zoom Room from the Zoom cloud**The Zoom Rooms controller pulls new settings from the Zoom cloud every 15 minutes.
* **Users can provide feedback after a meeting**The Android controller can now display the end-of-meeting experience feedback survey, if this option is enabled on the web.
* **Improved network handling and notifications**


* **Support for Android tablets with a 7-inch display**



**Resolved Issues**


* Minor bug fixes

**April 19, 2017:**Zoom Rooms Android Controller App: **Version 1.0.30136.0419**


* **Improved Google login**Google has enhanced the login process, and in the latest version of Zoom Rooms, logging in through Google takes advantage of these enhancements.
**Important:** If you log in using Google, you must upgrade the Zoom Rooms software before April 20.
* Minor bug fixes

January 16, 2017: Zoom Rooms Android Controller Version: **1.0.21459.0116**

**New and enhanced** **Features**


* **Zoom Rooms Controller features**


* **Android device support**You can now use an Android tablet (version 4 or later) as the Zoom Room Controller.

1. On your phone, press the **Home** button ![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/cloud-phone/polycom/home-button.png) then select **Settings**.
 ![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/cloud-phone/polycom/vvx-500-series/settings-button.png)
2. Navigate to **Status** > **Network**.
 ![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/cloud-phone/polycom/vvx-500-series/status-option.png)![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/cloud-phone/polycom/vvx-500-series/network-option.png)

5. Enter **https://** followed by the phone's IP address.
 **Note**: If your browser displays a security warning, click the option to continue.
6. Log in to the web interface as an **Admin**.
 **Note**: The default admin password is **456**. If you do not know your username or password, contact the vendor of the phone. If you [set the admin password globally](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360021119092#h_e735bb3d-adae-4d9d-aee8-af98436eca82), you can [view the password in the Zoom web portal](https://zoom.us/pbx/page/telephone/settings#/settings/general).

**Changes to Existing Features**


* **Zoom Cloud Interaction Enhancements**To better leverage communication between on-premise servers and the Zoom cloud, the controller has been re-deployed and upgraded for better functionality. To take advantage of this new upgraded controller, we recommend users re-deploy their on-premise virtual machines.
* **Meeting Encryption supported**The Meeting Connector now supports encryption for all its communication methods
* **Auto-set ZC and MMR Address**The Zone Controller and Multimedia Router address will be directly pulled from the configured eth0 and eth0:0 IP addresses configured on the VM.

**Resolved Issues**

September 27th, 2019 Version  **4.5.201900.0926**

**Change to Existing Features**


* **Upgraded Virtual Machine Based Operating System**The Meeting Connector now runs on CentOS 7.6. Since the virtual machine operating system has been updated, we recommend redeploying the virtual machine with the latest image.
* **Encryption Support Enabled**With Cloud Meetings now requiring encryption, the meeting connector will now have encryption auto-enabled as well. Due to that change, two different IP addresses are required for the MMR and ZC to utilize SSL over port 443.

**New and Enhanced Features**


* **Updated Web Console for MC Management**The Meeting Connector web console has been updated for improved usability. Admins can now add users to manage MC processes and start or stop processes from the web console.
* **Certificate Management**Meeting Connector now allows the certificate for the virtual machine to be changed through the web console.

When VPN services are used, to optimize the traffic flow Zoom recommends enabling Split Tunneling with the following:


* Allow UDP 8801-8810
* Allow TCP 443
* Destination to Zoom specific [IP ranges](https://assets.zoom.us/docs/ipranges/ZoomMeetings.txt) and/or *.zoom.us.

Doing so will allow your users to access corporate data/assets more efficiently while having quality Zoom meetings that don’t impact your corporate internet, VPN and other data center infrastructure.

* **In-meeting features**


	+ **Virtual background support on DTEN ME devices - Appliances**
	+ **Video preview - Appliances**Personal Zoom Room users can enable this setting to display a video preview before they join a Zoom meeting.
	+ **View in-meeting chat on Zoom Rooms Touch devices** - **Appliances**
	+ **Join Breakout Rooms - Android ZRC**Users can use the Zoom Rooms Controller to join a breakout room as a participant. This feature only works with non-touch Zoom Rooms.
* **Management features**


	+ **Deployment code support - Appliances**Administrators can configure a deployment code for leased Hardware as a Service (HaaS) devices. This code is displayed on the account settings page of the Zoom web portal and can be used to login to multiple HaaS devices. The code itself is not required to login, but it can be used to expedite the setup process.
	+ **Italian language support - Appliances**

pageTitle: Changing settings in the desktop client or mobile app
body:
To access settings, click the **Settings** (gear) icon.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/mobile/generic/settings-button.png)This will open the **Settings** menu.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/mobile/ios/settings-menu.png)Name and Email Address

Click on your name and email address to edit some basic profile settings or sign out from the Zoom app.


* **Profile Photo**: Use your phone's camera to take a new profile photo, or upload a photo from your phone.
* **Account**: Email address associated with logged-in account.
* **Display Name**: Change the default name you join meetings with
* **Personal Note**: Enter a [personal note](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115002571866-Personal-Note-for-Your-Chat-Profile) that's displayed to other users.
* **Update Password**: Update the password for your login
* **Department**
* **Job Title**
* **Location**
* **Personal Meeting ID (PMI)**: Change your [personal meeting ID](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362843-What-is-Personal-Meeting-ID-PMI-and-Personal-Link-) (requires the user have a paid license).
* **Personal Link Name**: Set or change your [personal link name](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362843-What-is-Personal-Meeting-ID-PMI-and-Personal-Link-) (requires being part of a Business or Education account and having a paid license).
* **Default Call-In Country**:Set the default country for the dial-in phone numbers in your meeting invitations.
* **User Type**: Shows if the current user is Basic, Licensed, or On-Prem
* **Sign Out**


* **Auto-Connect to Audio**: Automatically connect to the audio using the internet when joining a meeting


* **Always Mute My Microphone**: Always mute my microphone when joining a meeting. You can unmute if the host allows.
* **Always Turn Off My Video**: Always turn off my video when joining a meeting. You will be able to start your video after joining the meeting.
* **Always Show Video Preview**: Always show video preview dialog when joining a video meeting.
* **Mirror My Video**: Horizontally flip your video. This option is useful if your camera flips your video by default.
* **Auto-Copy Invite Link**
* **Show Non-Video Participants**: Show participants' avatar if they don't have video enabled. Thumbnails for non-video participants display their name.
* **Show Name When Participants Join**
* **Always Show Meeting Controls**
* [**Synced Calendars**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115005506303-Synced-Calendars): Check calendars for Zoom meetings and add them to your upcoming meetings in the Zoom app.
* **Meeting Reminder**: Display a reminder for upcoming meetings.
* **Closed Captioning**: Display closed captions when available.
* **Use Original Sound**: Adds an in-meeting button to enable [original sound](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115003279466).
* **Show My [Connected Time](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115002542683-Show-My-Connected-Time-in-a-Meeting)**: Display the total time you have been in the current meeting.
* **Touch Up Appearance**: Apply a softening effect to skin to minimize the visibility of imperfections. [Learn more](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115002595343-Touch-Up-My-Appearance).
* **Keep Virtual Background For**: If you are using a virtual background, select to use it for the current meeting only or for all meetings.
* **Aspect Ratio**: Select an aspect ratio when viewing participants' video. This setting doesn't affect your own video.


	+ **Scale to fit**: Participants' video will be scaled to fit your phone's screen, causing video to be cropped.
	+ **Original ratio**: Participants' video will be shown in their original aspect ratio. In other words, the aspect ratio of their video will be the same as what's displayed in the desktop client.
* **Reaction Skin Tone**: Select the default skin tone when using chat emoticons and [meeting reactions](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360038311212).

pageTitle: Changing settings in the desktop client or mobile app
body:
* **Auto-Connect to Audio**: Automatically connect to the audio using the chosen options available
* **Always Mute My Microphone**: Always mute my microphone when joining a meeting.
* **Always Turn Off My Video**: Always turn off my video when joining a meeting. You will be able to start your video after joining the meeting.
* **Mirror My Video**: Horizontally flip your video. This option is useful if your camera flips your video by default.
* **Always Show Video Preview**: Always show video preview dialog when joining a video meeting.
* **Show Non-Video Participants**: Show participants' avatar if they don't have video enabled. Thumbnails for non-video participants display their name.
* **Show Name When Participants Join**
* **Auto-Copy Invite Link**
* **Closed Captioning**: Zoom will display closed captions when available.
* **Use Original Sound**: Adds an in-meeting button to enable [original sound](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115003279466).
* **Show My [Connected Time](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115002542683-Show-My-Connected-Time-in-a-Meeting)**: Display the total time you have been in the current meeting.
* **Safe Driving Mode**: Allows you to swipe right while in a meeting to enter safe driving mode. You will need to tap to speak and your video will be off.
* **Aspect Ratio**: Select an aspect ratio when viewing participants' video. This setting doesn't affect your own video.


	+ **Scale to fit**: Participants' video will be scaled to fit your phone's screen, causing video to be cropped.
	+ **Original ratio**: Participants' video will be shown in their original aspect ratio. In other words, the aspect ratio of their video will be the same as what's displayed in the desktop client.
* **Reaction Skin Tone**: Select the default skin tone when using chat emoticons and [meeting reactions](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360038311212).

* Fixed a bug that didn’t allow an admin’s password to be updated using the Update Password API.
* Fixed a bug that didn’t allow a user whose name was entered in Kanji characters to be registered if the length of the name field was more than 5 characters.
* Minor bug fixes

pageTitle: Setting up a Poly OBi series analog telephone adapter (ATA) to support fax
body:
The following fax machine settings are recommended. These settings vary depending on the fax machine vendor and model. Please refer to your fax machine vendor documentation for more details on these settings.


1. Set to use a lower fax transmission speed or Baud rate (lowest speed/rate is 9600bps)
2. Disable the Error Correction Mode (ECM)
3. Disable the Compression mode .
4. Set the Receive/Transmit Buffer to low.

* **Disable the setting Only authenticated users can join meetings from Web client by default**The setting **Only authenticated users can join meetings from Web client** will now be turned off by default. This change applies to all accounts and can be re-enabled at the account, group, or user level.
* **Minimum password length of 6 characters for meeting and shared recording passwords**The minimum password length for both meeting and shared recording passwords will now be 6 characters.
* **Removing same domain matching for all customers**All customers that share the same domain but belong in different accounts will no longer be able to communicate with each other unless previously added as external contacts. To continue communicating, they can add them as external contacts or link their accounts together into one organization.

pageTitle: Testing computer or device audio for Zoom Phone
subTitles: Desktop client, mobile app, or desk phone
body:
To test your speakers and mic, you can record audio and play it back.


1. If you're using the Zoom desktop client or mobile app, sign in to Zoom, then click or tap **Phone**.
2. Dial and call ***8378**.
3. Speak into your mic. Zoom Phone will automatically play back the audio.
If you don't hear audio being played back, there could be issues with your connection, audio device, or desk phone.

pageTitle: Sending a file in a meeting
subTitles: Limiting the file types that can be shared
body:
For security purposes, the file types/file extensions that can be shared via file transfer can be limited at the account level, by the account owner or an admin on the account.


1. Sign into the Zoom web portal as an administrator with the privilege to edit account settings.
2. In the navigation menu, click **Account Management** then **[IM Management](https://zoom.us/account/imgroup)**
3. Click the [**IM Settings**](https://zoom.us/account/im/setting) tab.
4. Navigate to the **File Transfer**option
5. Enable **Only allow specified file types**.![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/web/account-management/im-management/enabled-specified-file-type.png)
6. Enter the allowed file types/extensions, with a comma to separate each extension. ![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/web/account-management/im-management/file-transfer-specified-types.png)
7. Click **Save**.

The Zoom Microsoft Outlook plugin is designed to make scheduling a meeting in Microsoft Outlook quick and convenient. The plugin allows you to schedule and start instant Zoom meetings, as well as make existing meeting events Zoom meetings. The Outlook Plugin can also sync free/busy times to the Zoom Client based on your Outlook Calendar events (PC only, requires version 3.5 or higher - [download the latest version](https://zoom.us/download)).

**Note**: Due to new security protocol, the Outlook plugin is only supported on macOS 10.14.1 and above. If you are running an older version, we recommend updating macOS, using the [Office 365 add-In (web and desktop)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115005223126-Office-365-Outlook-Web-Add-In), or disabling System Integrity Protection (SIP) on the operating system.

This article covers:


* [Downloading the plugin](#h_7f0bb9b4-4cfd-4f31-b2c3-0a1da9e0e829)
* [Scheduling a meeting](#h_f5ec29e2-9a26-4724-84de-f0d05ff461d4)
* [Scheduling a personal audio conference (PAC)](#h_471cf51b-46a4-4ae1-b350-8d2f7ac56877)
* [Making an existing event a Zoom meeting](#h_fd598921-9df2-47ec-8580-fe0d19e47b74)
* [Missing plugin icon](#h_0c07b58b-4578-4078-b21d-28370c691209)
* [Scheduling meetings for others](#h_a554585d-01d5-4d75-81e5-0558f1ddde92)

subTitles: H.323 endpoint access to Zoom Cloud Room Connector

body:
Zoom tarafından (elektronik iletişim hizmetleri şeklinde) sağlanan video konferans hizmetleri ve telekomünikasyon, Türkiye’de Elektronik Ortamda Sağlanan Hizmetlere (ESH) ilişkin kuralların kapsamına girmektedir.

Türkiye’de son müşterilere sağlanan ESH’ler (alıcının KDV kaydı bulunmadığından “B2C” ürün ve hizmetler olarak bilinir) Türkiye Cumhuriyeti KDV’sine tabidir.

Zoom, kurumsal müşterilere sağlanan (genellikle B2B ürün ve hizmetler olarak adlandırılan) ESH için Türkiye’deki müşterilere KDV yansıtmaz. Bunun yerine, B2B EHS ürün ve hizmetleri için ödenecek KDV, ürün veya hizmetin alıcısı (ör. Zoom’dan ürün veya hizmet alan Türk işletme) tarafından karşı ödeme mekanizmasıyla muhasebe edilmelidir.

**New and Enhanced Features**


* **Admin Features**


	+ **Disable Email Notifications for Extension Numbers**Account owners and admins can disable email notifications sent to phone users when assigning extension numbers. This includes the welcome email that is sent when admins assign a Zoom Phone license to a user.
	+ **Convert User Desk Phones to Common Area Phones**Account owners and admins can convert unassigned, provisioned desk phones to a common area phones without having to re-provision.
	+ **SAML Mapping for Extensions, Calling Plans, and Direct Phone Numbers**Account owners and admins with SSO configured can assign extensions, calling plans, and direct phone numbers using SAML mapping. Users must have a calling plan before they are assigned a direct phone number.
	+ **Display Routing Information for Accounts with Bring Your Own Carrier (BYOC)**If BYOC is enabled, account owners and admins can see the carriers that outbound calls are routed through.
	+ **Change the Outbound Caller ID Number for Zoom Rooms**Account owners and admins can change the outbound caller ID number for Zoom Rooms with a Zoom Phone license.
	+ **Default SIP Zone**The default SIP zone is selected based on the emergency address of the account or site.
	+ **Call Log Enhancements**Call log entries for auto receptionists, call queues, and transferred calls are clearly labelled for easier identification.
	+ **Add Common Area Phones to Call Queues and Auto Receptionists**Account owners and admins can add provisioned common area phones to be members of call queues and auto receptionists.
* **User Features**


	+ **See User Status**Users can see if their Zoom Phone account is active or inactive. If their account has been deactivated, they will not be able to make or receive calls.

**Resolved Issues**


* Minor Bug Fixes

* **Allow updating of contact email address**OnZoom Hosts can now update their contact email address from the default email address list in their Host profile.
* **Anonymous users can now share event profiles and host profiles**Sharing of Host profiles and Event profiles can now be done without being logged into OnZoom.
* **Hosts can reject refunds from the OnZoom web portal**Hosts can now reject refund requests directly from the OnZoom Web portal when an attendee requests a refund.
* **Hosts can reject refunds from within their PayPal business account**Hosts can now reject refunds directly from within their PayPal Business account when an attendee requests a refund.

subTitles: Часто задаваемые вопросы — НДС в России
body: Услуги видеоконференций и телекоммуникации (в виде электронных услуг связи), поставляемые компанией Zoom, попадают в сферу нормативных актов о предоставлении электронных услуг (ЭУ) на территории Российской Федерации. Таким образом, компания Zoom обязана взимать НДС в России со всех поставок, совершенных в адрес клиентов на территории Российской Федерации.

**Upcoming Release**

Details about upcoming releases will be posted as they become available.

**Current Release**

December 15, 2019

New and Enhanced Features


* Additional Toll and Toll-free Dial-in Numbers
Dial-in numbers are being added for the following countries: Australia, Austria, Belgium, Denmark, France, Germany, Ireland, Italy, New Zealand, Portugal, Spain, Sweden, United Kingdom.

**Previous Releases**

**Note**: The information in the past release notes may have been superseded by subsequent release notes. Please review all current release notes carefully.

May 19, 2019

**Changes to Existing Features**


* **Arabic Language Support**Telephone users dialing into Zoom Meetings from the following countries will now be greeted with prompts in Arabic: Algeria, Bahrain, Egypt, Kuwait, Morocco, Oman, Qatar, Saudi Arabia, Tunisia, and United Arab Emirates. They can switch to English when prompted. [Learn more.](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360019765151-Language-Support-for-Telephone)

**New and Enhanced Features**


* **Additional Toll-free Numbers**Toll-free numbers are now available for Estonia, Mauritius, and Nepal.
* **Additional Call-out Coverage**Call-out coverage has been added for the following countries: Guatemala, Macedonia, Mauritius, Morocco, Nepal, and Uruguay.

April 12, 2019

**New and Enhanced Features**


* **Additional Premium Toll Numbers**Premium toll dial-in numbers are now available for Angola and Morocco.
* **Additional Toll-free Numbers**Toll-free numbers are now available for Anguilla, Antigua & Barbuda, Botswana, British Virgin Islands, Cayman Island, Costa Rica, Georgia, Grenada, Indonesia, Kazakhstan, Montserrat, Morocco, Saint Kitts, Sri Lanka, Tanzania, Trinidad & Tobago, Turks & Caicos, Uganda, Vietnam.
* **Additional Call-out Coverage**Call-out coverage has been added for the following countries: Algeria, Angola, Bangladesh, Botswana, Bosnia & Herzegovina, Cambodia, El Salvador, Fiji, Ghana, Honduras, Iceland, Jordan, Kuwait, Pakistan, Rwanda, Sri Lanka, and Uzbekistan.

December 16, 2018

**Changes to Existing Features**


* **Support for Additional Languages**International callers will now hear the Welcome prompt in the language of the dial-in country and have the option to switch to English. The supported languages are American English, Brazilian Portuguese, British English, Canadian French, Chinese (simplified and traditional), French, German, Japanese, Russian, and Spanish (Castilian and Latin American). [Learn which language each dial-in number supports.](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360019765151)

November 26, 2018

**Changes to Existing Features**


* **Updated Welcome Prompts for American English, German, and French**

September 1, 2018 - September 9, 2018

**Resolved Issues**


* Corrected audio prompt when only one participant is in the meeting
* Minor bug fixes

July 8, 2018

**New and Enhanced Features**


* **Start and Control Meetings by Telephone**Users can now start a Zoom meeting when joining by phone by entering their host key. For full host controls when joining by phone, Join Before Host must be disabled. If Join Before Host is enabled for the meeting, users will not be prompted for the host key and will have limited meeting controls.
* **Call Me Experience Improvements** Pressing 1 to join the meeting will no longer be required in most cases when using the call me feature.

**Resolved Issues**


* Minor bug fixes

subTitles: To share your feedback with Zoom
body:
1. Log in to the Zoom client.
2. Click you profile picture, then click **Settings**.
 ![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/generic/home/settings-button-under-profile-pic.png)
3. Click the **Feedback** tab.
 ![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/generic/settings/feedback-tab.png)
4. Enter your Feedback.
5. Click **Send Feedback**.

If you do not have [End of Meeting Feedback Survey](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115005855266-End-of-Meeting-Feedback) enabled, you will also have the option to check a box to submit feedback at the end of your meetings.
 ![endmeeting-windows.gif](https://support.zoom.us/hc/article_attachments/115018150146/endmeeting-windows.gif)

pageTitle: New Updates for Zoom Scheduler for Chrome
body:
* Deleting an event that includes a Zoom meeting on the Google calendar now deletes the meeting from Zoom.
* The “Join Zoom Meeting” button is included on the event preview pop-up.

The Audio Watermark, or Audio Signature, feature embeds a user's personal information into the audio as an inaudible watermark if they record during a meeting. If the audio file is shared without permission, Zoom can help identify which participant recorded the meeting.

**Note**: The file shared with Zoom for identification must have audio of at least 2 minutes in length.

pageTitle: Quick start guide for Polycom VVX series phones
body:
**Note**:


* Make sure you have a [desk phone that supports the company directory feature](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360029698771).
* You can also access the company directory when [making a call](#h_afd9452d-1b80-44a4-86d8-537c6ddb5f1a).
* If you can't access the company directory, manually reboot your phone or ask your admin to [re-sync your phone](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360021119092#h_e5d9f0c5-45ca-42c3-8fca-f2ade393e823).


* On the phone's home screen, press **Directory**.


* Navigate to **Corporate Directory**.
* Enter a name or extension number, then press **Submit** to search your company's directory of Zoom Phone users.
**Note**: Search results may take a few seconds to appear.
* Select a phone user then press **Dial** to call them.

subTitles: Are there any VAT obligations for me as a customer?
body: No.  The customer in principle has no VAT obligations.  If you are a registered for VAT in Switzerland and you want to claim an input tax credit for the VAT paid to Zoom, as a minimum, you should ensure to keep a copy of Zoom’s invoice for your records.

pageTitle: Managing conference rooms added to Zoom Phone
subTitles: Assigning a calling package and direct phone number to a Zoom Rooms
body:
Follow these steps to assign a calling package for outbound calls from the Zoom Room or Cisco/Polycom Room you added to Zoom Phone. You can also assign a direct phone number during this process (optional).


1. Sign in to the Zoom web portal.
2. In the navigation menu, click **Phone System Management** then **[Users & Rooms](https://zoom.us/pbx/page/telephone/phoneUsers#/users)**.
3. Click the **[Zoom Rooms](https://zoom.us/pbx/page/telephone/phoneUsers#/zoom-rooms)** tab.
4. Find the room you added a Zoom Phone license to.
5. Click **Assign Calling Plan** in the last column.
6. Select a calling package and click **Confirm and Assign Numbers**.
7. If you want to assign a [direct phone number](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360020808292) to the room, select a phone number and click **Confirm**. Otherwise, click **Skip**.
You can now make and receive calls in the room. For Zoom Rooms, You can also invite participants by phone and call other Zoom Rooms in the same account. Learn more about [using phone features in Zoom Rooms](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/205369035).

subTitles: Viewing call quality data for a specific extension
Call quality by device, codec, ISP and network
body:
To view call quality data for specific phone user:


1. Sign in to the Zoom web portal.
2. Navigate to the **Dashboard** and click the **[Zoom Phone](https://zoom.us/account/metrics/pbxqos/#/dashboard/overall)** tab.
3. Click the **[Extensions](https://zoom.us/account/metrics/pbxqos/#/dashboard/extensions)** tab.
4. Select an extension type.
5. Enter a the phone user's name, extension, or email in the text box then click their name to display data.
6. To change the period, click the date range below the user's name and select the start and end dates.

**![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/web/zoom-voice/qos-dashboard/overall-tab-call-quality-categories.png)**


* The multi-layer pie charts that show call quality grouped into categories (device, voice codec, ISP, and network).
* The inner layer breaks down of each category into sub-categories. The outer layer shows the percentage of good (blue) and bad (red) quality calls for each sub-category.
* Hover over the pie charts for more details on each segment.

After enabling breakout rooms, you can do the following:


* [Participant in breakout rooms](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115005769646) (participants)
* [Manage breakout rooms](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/206476313) (host)
* [Pre-assign participants to breakout rooms](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360032752671) (host)

pageTitle: Quick start guide for Polycom VVX series phones
body:
**Note**:


* If you dial a number without the area code, Zoom Phone will use the default area code set in your [Zoom Phone settings](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360021325712).
* While in a call, your in-call status will be synced with the Zoom desktop client and mobile app. Your Zoom contacts will be able to see that you're in a call.
* If calling an [international number](https://zoom.us/billing/pbx/rates), make sure that Zoom Phone supports outbound dialing to that number.
* To make your desk phone automatically call a number after dialing, your Zoom Phone admin needs to set up a digit map / dial plan using a [provision template](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360035817952).
* Change your [line key settings](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360036860751) to set your default outbound caller ID for desk phones and customize the appearance of line keys.

To make an outbound call using the handset:


1. Pick up the phone's headset.
2. (Optional) If you have multiple lines, select a line for the call:


	* **VVX series with physical line keys**: Press a line key.
	* **VVX series with a touch screen**: Tap the drop-down menu at the top of the screen then select a line key.
3. Dial a number using the phone's physical or on-screen dial pad.


4. Place the call:


	* **VVX series with physical line keys**: Press **Send**.
	* **VVX series with a touch screen**: Tap the phone icon ![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/misc/icons/phone.png) on the touch screen.

To make a call using the speakerphone:


1. Press the speakerphone button ![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/misc/icons/speaker.png) (usually located to the right of the physical dial pad).
2. (Optional) If you have multiple lines, select a line for the call:


	* **VVX series with physical line keys**: Press a line key.
	* **VVX series with a touch screen**: Tap the drop-down menu at the top of the screen then select a line key.
3. Dial a number using the physical or on-screen dial pad.


4. Place the call:


	* **VVX series with physical line keys**: Press **Send**.
	* **VVX series with a touch screen**: Tap the phone icon ![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/misc/icons/phone.png) on the touch screen.

pageTitle: New Updates for Zoom Rooms Android Controller
body:
**Note**: The information in the past release notes may have been superseded by subsequent release notes. Please review all current release notes carefully.

November 15, 2020 version **5.3.0 (214)**


* **Passcode and/or Waiting Room requirement**Zoom will now require that all meetings have a Passcode or a Waiting Room enabled for accounts with a single licensed user, Pro accounts with 2 or more licenses, and Business accounts with 10-100 licenses. For Zoom Rooms specifically, this requirement will impact users who reserve rooms on scheduling displays.  [Learn More](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360045009111).

If you purchased your subscription online, you can change from an annual to a monthly subscription.


1. Sign in to the Zoom web portal.
2. In the navigation panel, click **Account Management**, then **[Billing](https://zoom.us/billing)**.
3. Click **Edit Plan** to the right of the subscription you wish to change.
4. Click the Monthly option.
5. Click **Save & Continue**.
6. Review the changes. If correct, click **Save & Continue**.
7. Click **Place Order** to complete your purchase.

Once confirmed, a prorated credit for the remainder of your annual subscription will be produced and applied to your new monthly payment and your future invoices. If you would like to inquire about a refund, [contact Billing](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/requests/new).

When you purchase an audio conferencing plan, you initially choose the countries that are available for [audio conferencing](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362833-What-is-Premium-Audio-). If you want to add or remove countries after your initial purchase, you can do so using the Zoom web portal.

pageTitle: Using Q&A as the webinar host
body: Q&A that has been upvoted will automatically be sorted by number of upvotes. You can upvote a question by tapping the thumbs up.

pageTitle: Joining multiple meetings simultaneously on desktop
body:
The feature to join multiple meetings simultaneously from the Zoom desktop client allows participants to participate in or monitor multiple meetings at the same time. This is ideal for support staff who may need to monitor multiple meetings at the same time.

Once the setting is enabled, you can join multiple meetings by clicking on the join URL or navigating to <https://zoom.us/join> and entering the meeting ID. The Join button in the Zoom client will only work for the first meeting that you join.

**Note**: This feature doesn't allow you to host multiple [concurrent meetings](/hc/en-us/articles/206122046) at the same time.

This article covers:


* [Enable Join different meetings simultaneously on desktop](#h_d31dc7f4-a887-48fb-b5df-7cc40bf7154e)


	+ [For your account](#h_d9b8127c-b65d-4ee9-a09a-5e561b1b39a3)
	+ [For a group](#h_e129e584-0147-46f5-9bac-4cc10969dd54)
	+ [For your own meetings](#h_4d97f18a-60a8-4d94-821c-312864efc595)
* [Joining Multiple Meetings Simultaneously](#h_d7fcbe6e-9c90-4453-9b52-3ff3fff0ae3e)

If you have Zoom Phone activated on your account, you can transfer an ongoing phone call. There are three call transfer methods: warm transfer, blind transfer, and transfer to voicemail.

**Note**:


* When transferring a call, the [caller ID displayed to the party receiving the transfer](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360031768431#h_822857b6-eeb3-4bfd-aca4-0c5ee8f028ef) depends on whether they're an internal or external number.
* If your admin enabled automatic recording, or you start a [call recording](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360036228011), the recording will end when you select a transfer option. This applies when transferring to external or internal contacts. If you select **Warm Transfer**, you can start the recording again to record the portion before you complete the transfer.

This article covers:


* [Transfer methods](#h_d20c292a-d28e-4ca3-930a-12e528cb4805)

body:

* Change the recording location in your Zoom client and make sure it is a valid path string/folder.

pageTitle: New Updates for Zoom Connector for Cisco/Polycom
body:
* Minor bug fixes

April 21, 2020 Version **4.1.69**

If you enabled **Personal Locations** with nomadic emergency services, the Zoom desktop client will [prompt phone users when they're in an undefined location](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360052931771) and notify you that they're using a default address. They can add a new location while correcting or verifying the address. The client will automatically save the IP address or wireless access point identifiers for the location. When the phone user places an emergency call from a defined location, the associated emergency address will be sent to emergency responders.

Follow these steps to view personal emergency addresses:


1. Sign in to the Zoom web portal.
2. In the navigation menu, click **Phone System Management** then **Company Info**.
3. Click [**Account Settings**](https://zoom.us/pbx/page/telephone/settings#/settings/general).
4. Scroll down to the **Emergency Address & Location** section.
5. Under **Locations**, click **Manage**.
6. Follow one of these options depending on if you have [multiple sites](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360020809672):


	* If you don't have multiple sites: Select the one site you see in the left-side panel.
	* If you have multiple sites: Select a site in the left-side panel to import locations to.
7. Click **Personal Locations** in the left-side panel.


8. Select a phone user.

subTitles: Using 1080p with SIP/H.323 with dialing strings
body:
If the H.323/SIP device is not provisioned via the Zoom API Connector, to join a meeting using 1080p, 309 will need to be added to the dial string. Examples of the dialing strings can be found below:

*Meetings without a password:*

[IP Address]##[Meeting ID]##309
Example: 192.168.1.25##123456789##309

*Meetings with a password:*

[IP Address]##[Meeting ID]#[Password]#309
Example: 192.168.1.25##123456789#12345#309

**Room Type**: DIY
**Room Size**: 7-13 people

**Note**: This setup may require professional assistance.

For a USB conference room that sits 7-13 people, we recommend 2 TV displays, a single HD PTZ camera and three MXL AC-360-Z table-top microphones with a sound-bar that all connects to the Zoom Rooms PC , Mac or Chromebox. The majority of equipment is wall mounted behind the displays allowing for easy access and installation.

An Neat Pad at the table is used as a room controller along with another optional Neat Pad at the door as the room [scheduling display](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360000536906-Scheduling-Display).  An additional touch display with Windows 10 PC running Zoom Rooms for Touch can be paired with the room with Whiteboard companion mode.  [Hardware Guide](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360039986932-Companion-Whiteboard) / [Setup Guide](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360038401111-Setting-up-a-Zoom-Rooms-for-Touch-companion-whiteboard)

pageTitle: Setting up registration for a meeting
body:
After you schedule the meeting, click the **Branding** tab to customize branding options for your registration page:


* **Banner**: Click **Upload** to add an image that appears at the top of your registration page.
* **Logo**: Click **Upload** to add an image that appears to the right of meeting topic on your registration page. The logo also appears in the email invitation.
* (Optional) Click **Add Description** to add alt text to the image. The description isn't visually displayed on the screen but helps people with visual impairments to access and understand the image.

* **New default screen sharing settings for accounts with single Pro licenses**Accounts with single Pro licenses will now have the screen sharing setting **Who can share?** defaulted to Host Only. The meeting host will be able to change this setting in their meeting settings or during the meeting in progress, from the Security icon.
* **Language Interpretation flag icon will be replaced by language abbreviation**The icon next to the interpreted language will now list the language abbreviation, instead of a flag.
* **Require consent if the host mutes and then unmutes a participant**If the host mutes and then unmutes a participant individually, the participant will now receive a prompt, asking them to consent to be unmuted.
* **Remove Unmute All option**The option to unmute all participants at once has been removed since participants now always have to consent when the host unmutes them. By default, participants can unmute themselves. The host can now enable or disable the setting to allow participants to unmute themselves from the Security icon, which can also be found in the Participants panel.

* Numbers starting with 855 and 877 are reachable from all 50 U.S. states and Canada
* Fee-based toll numbers can only be dialed into within their own country

* **In-meeting features**


	+ **Security features**- Windows, macOS, Appliances, iOS, Android
	 Meeting hosts can tap the security option while in a meeting to easily access the following features: lock meeting, enable waiting room, disable chat, disable participant renaming, disable screen sharing for others, remove participant, report a participant.
	+ **Report a participant**- Windows, macOS, Appliances, iOS, Android
	Meeting hosts can tap the security option while in a meeting to report a participant to Zoom trust and safety for inappropriate behavior.
	+ **Host selection when leaving a meeting**- Windows, macOS, Appliances, iOS, Android
	 The host will be prompted to assign a new host before leaving the meeting
	+ **Waiting room**- Windows, macOS, Appliances, iOS, Android
	Hosts in direct share meetings or phone calls will be able to allow or prevent participants from joining their meetings when waiting room is enabled.
	+ **Meeting information**- Windows, macOS, Appliances, iOS, Android
	Users can view the numeric password which is used for phone and H323/SIP call-in participants. The numeric password is displayed with the phone dial in number on the meeting information screen.
	+ **Starting a test meeting while not signed in**- Windows, macOS, Appliances, iOS, AndroidUsers must accept Zoom’s Terms of Service and Privacy Policy via pop-up message before starting a test meeting in a Zoom Room that is not signed in.
* **Management features**


	+ **Recording consent customization**- Windows, macOS, Appliances, iOS, Android
	**Admins can customize the message that appears asking participants for their consent to be recorded.**
	+ **Logs**- Windows, macOS, Appliances, iOS
	Admin users can enable a web setting that allows Zoom support to submit logs to Zoom on behalf of the admin, or have the logs automatically uploaded in the event of a crash.
	+ **Audio Logs**- Windows, Appliances, iOS
	Audio Logs can now be enabled/disabled on the controller under the about page in settings.
	+ **Room meeting ID**- Windows, Appliances, iOS
	Web admins can disable the Room Meeting ID. The Room Meeting ID will not be displayed on Zoom Rooms Controller when disabled.
* **Scheduling display features**


	+ **Scheduling a password protected meeting**- Windows, macOS, Appliances, iOS, Android
	Users can choose to schedule a password protected meeting and customize the meeting password from a scheduling display. If passwords are required for scheduled meetings, a password will be generated automatically and cannot be disabled from the scheduling display.

pageTitle: Joining a Zoom Room Meeting Using an iOS Device
body:
**Overview**

You can use the Zoom iOS app to join a scheduled meeting from a nearby Zoom Room. Your personal account and Zoom Room must be on the same Zoom account.

**Prerequisites**


* Zoom Rooms for Conference Room for PC - **January 2019 Release** or later
* Zoom Rooms for Conference Room for Mac - **January 2019 Release** or later
* Zoom Rooms for Conference Room for Chrome - **January 2019 Release** or later
* Zoom Rooms Controller for iOS - **January 2019 Release** or later
* Zoom Rooms Controller for Android - **January 2019 Release** or later
* Zoom Rooms Controller for Windows - **January 2019 Release** or later
* iOS device

**Instructions**


1. Sign in to Zoom client on desktop or mobile and [schedule a meeting](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362413-How-Do-I-Schedule-Meetings-).
2. Open the Zoom mobile app on iOS.
3. Tap **Settings**.
 ![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/mobile/generic/settings/settings-button.png)
4. Tap **Meeting** and enable **Ultrasonic Proximity Detection**.
 ![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/mobile/ios/ultrasonic-proximity-detection.png)
5. When you are close to an available Zoom Room, a notification will appear showing the room name.
 ![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/mobile/ios/close-zoom-room-notification.png)
6. Tap **Join** beside your meeting topic.
7. Tap **Join from Room** to join the meeting from the nearby Zoom Room.
 ![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/mobile/ios/join-close-zoom-room.png)

pageTitle: Using the audio library to change custom and default audio
body:
Follow these steps to record custom audio directly in the Zoom web portal. You must have a functioning microphone to record.

**Note**: Recording custom audio is not supported on IE.


1. Click **Add Audio**.
2. Click the **Record by Computer** tab.
**Note**: Allow Zoom to use your microphone if prompted by your browser.
3. Follow the on-screen instructions to test and adjust your microphone volume, then click **Next**.
4. Click **Record** to start recording audio.
5. Click the red stop button to stop recording.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/generic-images/common-buttons-and-icons/filled/recording-icon.png)
6. Click one of these options (optional):


	* Play icon: Play the audio you recorded.
	![](https://assets.zoom.us/generic-images/common-buttons-and-icons/filled/play-button.png)
	* **Rerecord**: Rerecord if you are not happy with the result.
	* **Download**: Download the recorded audio as a WAV file.
7. Click **Add** to add the recording to your audio library.


8. Click **Use the Audio**.

pageTitle: Where can I find the meeting invitation text?
body:
You can find the invitation for a scheduled in the Zoom desktop client, Zoom mobile app, or on the web. You can copy the invitation and send it out to your attendees. You can share it anywhere that text can be pasted, but the most common methods to share the full invitation are via email or by adding it to a calendar invitation.

To see all options on how to invite attendees, see [How Do I Invite Others to Join a Meeting?](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362183-How-Do-I-Invite-Others-To-Join-a-Meeting-)
