subTitles: Enabling a Dedicated Dial-In Number for a User
body:
1. As the Owner or an Admin, sign in to the [Zoom Web Portal](https://zoom.us/signin).
2. Click **User Management** > [**Users**](https://zoom.us/account/user).
3. Click **Edit** to the right of the user you want to assign the number to.
4. On the next screen, enable **Dedicated Dial-In Number**.![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/web/personal-audio-conference/enabled-ddi.png)
5. Click **Save**.

To enable for a group of users:


1. Sign in to the Zoom web portal as an admin with the privilege to edit groups.
2. In the navigation panel, click **User Management** then **Group Management**.
3. Click the applicable group name from the list, then click the **Meetings** tab.
4. Under **In Meeting (Advanced)**, verify that **Show a custom disclaimer when starting or joining a meeting** is enabled.
5. If the setting is disabled, click the toggle to enable it. If a verification dialog displays, click **Turn On** to verify the change.
**Note**: If the option is grayed out, it has been locked at the account level and needs to be changed at that level.
6. (Optional) If you want to make this setting mandatory for all users in the group, click the lock icon, and then click **Lock** to confirm the setting.

subTitles: Enabling Cloud Recording for a Specific Zoom Room
body:
To enable the Cloud Recording feature for a Zoom Room:


1. Sign in to the Zoom web portal.
2. Click **Room Management** > [**Zoom Rooms**](https://zoom.us/location).
3. Click on the room name.
4. Click **Edit** to view the room settings.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/web/room-management/zoom-rooms/edit-room-2.png)
5. Click the **Meeting Settings** tab and click **Show More Settings**.
**![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/web/room-management/zoom-rooms/edit-room-show-more-settings.png)**
6. Navigate to the **Cloud Recording**option and verify that the setting is enabled.
If the setting is disabled, click the toggle to enable it. If a verification dialog displays, choose **Turn On** to verify the change.
**![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/web/room-management/zoom-rooms/cloud-recording-room-setting.png)Note**: If the option is grayed out, it has been locked at a higher level in the hierarchy, and you will need to contact your Zoom administrator.

pageTitle: Follow presenter's pointer during screen sharing
body: When a presenter is sharing a screen that is at a higher resolution than yours, you can automatically follow the presenter’s pointer on your desktop client. This is particularly useful when only a portion of the shared screen is visible to you, helping you to stay focused on the important part of the shared screen.

1. After creating the breakout rooms, click ![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/linux/gear-icon.png) to view additional breakout rooms options.
2. Check any options that you would like to use for your breakout rooms.


	* **Allow participants to choose room**: [Participants can select and enter rooms](/hc/en-us/articles/115005769646) on their own once rooms are launched.
	* **Allow participants to return to the main session at any time**: If this option is checked, the participants can move back to the main session from their meeting controls. If this is disabled, they need to wait for the host/co-host to end the breakout rooms.
	* **Automatically move all assigned participants into breakout rooms**:Checking this option will move all participants into the breakout rooms automatically. If this option is unchecked, the participants will need to click **Join** to be added to the breakout room.
	* **Auto close breakout rooms after () minutes**:If this option is checked, the breakout rooms will automatically end after the configured time.
	
	
		+ **Notify me when the time is up**: If this option is checked, the host and co-hosts will be notified when the breakout room time is up.
	* **Set Countdown timer**: If this option is checked, the participants will be given a countdown of how much time they have left before being returned to the main room.
3. Follow the steps below to assign participants to rooms or click **Open All Rooms** to start the breakout rooms.

pageTitle: Syncing OnZoom events to your calendar
body:
Once the confirmation page appears after you complete the checkout process:


1. Register for a [free](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360049753551#h_01EMF6JF7JTM4XSGSSGK5Q9E34) or [paid](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360049753551#h_01EMF6JN2K6718NS7NDA9QRSR0) OnZoom event.

**Note**: If you aren't already signed-in to your calendar's account, you will be prompted to do so. If you are prompted to give Zoom permission to sync with your calendar's account, click **Allow**.

You must obtain phone numbers before assigning them to users.


1. Sign in to the Zoom web portal.
2. In the navigation menu, click **Phone System Management** then **[Phone Numbers](https://zoom.us/pbx/page/telephone/phoneNumbers#/zoom-telephony-phone-numbers)**.
3. Click **Add**.
4. Enter the required information:


	* **Target Site** (only visible if you have [multiple sites](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360020809672)): Select the site you want to obtain phone numbers for.
	* **Emergency Addresses** (only visible if you don't have [multiple sites](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360020809672-Managing-Multiple-Sites)): Select an [emergency address](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360021062871-Setting-an-Emergency-Address) to apply to the phone numbers, or click **Add** to add a new address. The emergency address associated with the site will be applied to the phone numbers.
	* **Country/Region**: Select the country or region to search for available phone numbers.
	* Select the type of phone number you want to obtain: **Toll** or **Toll-free**.
	**Note**: You need the toll-free license to obtain toll-free numbers.
	* Select **Reserved Numbers Only** if you've ported reserved numbers and only want to search your [reserved numbers](#h_01ETV6F6R6REJ03D9213CK9SX6).
	* **State/Province/Territory**: Select the state, province, or territory from the drop-down menu to view associated area codes.
	* **Area Code - City**: Enter an area code or city to search area codes or cities in the selected state/province/territory. Alternatively, select an area code or city using the drop-down menu.
5. (Optional) Click **Advanced** to use the following advanced search features:


	* Check **Sequential** to sort available numbers sequentially.
	* Use the text box beside the area code to search available numbers by prefix. The prefix contains numbers after the area code. You can also enter letters to search for a vanity phone number that spells out a brand, word, or phrase. For example, if you search for the letters **YKI**, it will search for numbers with the prefix **954**.
6. Click **Search Numbers**.
**Note**: If there are no numbers available for the area, click **Create Ticket** to [submit a request to obtain numbers](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360034342152). You can also request a [vanity toll-free number](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360036075732).


7. Select the phone numbers you want to obtain, or click the **Select All** check box to select all phone numbers in the search results.
8. Click **Confirm**.

pageTitle: Resetting to Factory Default and Upgrading Firmware on a Polycom Phone
body:
Follow this article to reset your Polycom phone and install custom firmware.

Note: See the [Quick Start Guide for Provisioning Desk Phones](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360033223411) for an overview of the provisioning process.

This article covers:


1. [Accessing the Phone's Web Interface](#h_4b1c4cbb-ad32-43c5-849b-2e00bca57efe)
2. [Resetting to Factory Default Using the Web Interface (Recommended)](#h_f7db0463-1420-4d02-9cfc-1fb1f82970a4)
3. [Resetting to Factory Default Using the Phone's Interface (Optional)](#h_59281192-2888-4c6a-a0e4-af41bfd9bd89)
4. [Upgrading the Firmware Using the Phone's Web Interface](#h_724c4672-c564-453a-8423-3e0f17e0cbfe)

pageTitle: Using MDM to configure Zoom on iOS
body:
1. Sign in to the [Microsoft 365 Device Management](http://devicemanagement.microsoft.com) dashboard.
2. In the left-side navigation menu, click **Client** **apps** then **App** **configuration** **policies**.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/integration/intune/client-apps-app-configuration-policies.png)
3. Click **Add** and enter the following information:


	* **Name**: Enter a display name for the configuration.
	* **Description**: Enter a description to help identify the configuration.
	* **Device** **enrollment** **type**: Select **Managed** **devices**.
	* **Platform**: Select **iOS**.
	* **Associated** **app**: Select **ZOOM** **Cloud** **Meetings** **AppStore**.
4. Click **Configuration settings**.


5. In the **Configuration settings format** drop-down menu, select **Enter XML Data**.
6. Use the text box to set the [configuration options](#configuration-options).
7. Click **OK**.

pageTitle: Allowing removed participants or panelists to rejoin
subTitles: Allowing removed meeting participants or webinar panelists to rejoin
body:
**Note**: This setting doesn't apply to webinar attendees. You can allow removed webinar attendees to rejoin by accessing the webinar in the web portal.

If you are the account admin, you can allow rejoining for all members of your organization:


1. Sign in to the Zoom web portal as an administrator with the privilege to edit account settings.
2. In the navigation menu, click **Account Management** then [**Account Settings**](https://zoom.us/account/setting).
3. Click the **Meeting** tab.
4. Under **In-Meeting (Basic)**, verify that **Allow removed participants to rejoin** is enabled.
5. (Optional) If you want to make this setting mandatory for all users in your account, click the lock icon, and then click **Lock**to confirm the setting.

Follow these steps to view call history and save call recordings.


1. Sign in to the Zoom client.
2. Click the **Phone** tab.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/generic-images/common-buttons-and-icons/outline/answer-phone-button.png)
3. Click the **History** tab.
The most recent call history will display at the top.
**Note**: Learn more about [identifying call history entries](#h_01ETX9J0NFTE9DFT7SC772CSC7).
4. Click the drop-down menu below the tabs to filter call history entries by missed or recorded calls.
5. Hover over a call history entry for these options:
**Note**: If the caller hid their caller ID, you can only delete the entry.


	* Click the phone icon to call the selected number.
	![](https://assets.zoom.us/generic-images/common-buttons-and-icons/filled/answer-phone-button.png)
	* If the call was recorded, click the play icon to play the associated recording.
	![](https://assets.zoom.us/generic-images/common-buttons-and-icons/filled/play-button.png)
	* Click the ellipses for these options:
	
	
		+ **Copy Number**: Copy the associated phone number to your system's clipboard.
		+ **Create Google Contact** / **Create Outlook Contact** (only visible if you enabled [contacts integration](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360000488243)): Create a new Google or Outlook contact using the call history entry. The new contact will appear in the **Contacts** tab. Access the contact in Google or Outlook if you need to further edit contact details.
		+ **Add to Google Contact** / **Add to Outlook Contact** (only visible if you enabled [contacts integration](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360000488243)): Add the associated phone number to an existing synced contact. Access the contact in Google or Outlook if you need to further edit contact details.
		+ **View Profile** (only visible if the number belongs to your internal or [synced](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360000488243) contacts): View details of the associated caller.
		+ **Block Caller**: Add the phone number to your [blocked list](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360021325712-Configuring-Settings).
		+ **Download** (only visible if the call was recorded): Save the recording as an MP3 file.
		+ **Clear**: Delete the selected call history entry. If there's a call recording, it will be deleted as well.
		+ **Clear All Call History**: Delete all call history entries. All call recordings will also be deleted.
		+ **Duration**: Displays the duration of the call in minutes and seconds (mm:ss).

**Note:** The Kaltura integration is now available in the [Zoom Marketplace](https://marketplace.zoom.us/apps/VqdWYBqSRg-G6y4GTVMnCQ). If setting up a new integration, use the Marketplace app.

**Overview**

Kaltura integration with Zoom allows you to automatically upload your Zoom cloud recordings to Kaltura after your meeting ends.

This article covers:


* [Configuring the Kaltura and Zoom integration](#configuration)
* [Configuring User IDs for individual users](#userIDs)
* [Viewing Recordings in Kaltura](#viewing)

**Prerequisites**


* A Paid Zoom Account
* Kaltura Account with Admin privileges
* Cloud Recording enabled

**Instructions**

**Configuring the Kaltura and Zoom integration**


1. Login to the [**Integration**](https://zoom.us/account/integration) page.
2. Click **Configure** next to **Kaltura**.
 [![kaltura-configure.gif](https://support.zoom.us/hc/article_attachments/115017150626/kaltura-configure.gif)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/article_attachments/115017150626/kaltura-configure.gif)
3. Configure the Integration:


	* **User Name**: This can be found in Kaltura, under **Settings** (gear icon) and **My User Settings**.
	* **User ID**: This can be found in Kaltura, under **Settings** and **My User Settings**.
	 [![kaltura-userID.png](https://support.zoom.us/hc/article_attachments/360012715011/kaltura-userID.png)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/article_attachments/360012715011/kaltura-userID.png)
	* **Partner ID**: This can be found in Kaltura, under **Settings** and **Integration Settings**.
	* **Administrator Secret**: This can be found in Kaltura, under **Settings** and **Integration Settings**.
	 [![kaltura-integrationsettings.png](https://support.zoom.us/hc/article_attachments/360012715031/kaltura-integrationsettings.png)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/article_attachments/360012715031/kaltura-integrationsettings.png)
	* **Enable upload recording**: Check this to enable the Kaltura integration. If this is not checked, the integration will not function. This can be unchecked to temporarily disable the integration.
	* **Allow users to edit Kaltura User ID in their Profile page**: This will allow users to set their own Kaltura User ID on their Profile page, which will associate their Zoom recordings with their user in Kaltura.
	* **Stop Email Notification**: Check this to disable Zoom notifications that the cloud recording is available.
	* **Category by Zoom Recording**: Check this to automatically add a "Zoom Recordings" category in Kaltura and have all Zoom recordings automatically added there.
	 [![kaltura-zoomsettings.png](https://support.zoom.us/hc/article_attachments/360012713712/kaltura-zoomsettings.png)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/article_attachments/360012713712/kaltura-zoomsettings.png)
4. Click **Save Changes**.



**Configuring User IDs for individual users**

You can add Kaltura User IDs for individuals in Zoom, so that the recordings are associated with the correct user in Kaltura. If user IDs are not added in Zoom, all recordings will be associated with the administrator's Kaltura account.

The user ID can be configured by the individual user on their [profile page](https://zoom.us/profile), by the account owner or admin by accessing the user's profile page through [User Management](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201363183-User-Management), or through the [Update a User REST API](https://zoom.github.io/api/#update-a-user) call.
 [![kaltura-zoomprofilepage.png](https://support.zoom.us/hc/article_attachments/360012715151/kaltura-zoomprofilepage.png)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/article_attachments/360012715151/kaltura-zoomprofilepage.png)

**Viewing Recordings in Kaltura**


1. To view the status of a recording, select **Content**> **Bulk Upload Log**. This shows you who uploaded, when it was uploaded, and the status of the upload. Please note the progress depends on the size of the recording
 [![](/hc/en-gb/article_attachments/202776403/4_UploadedFiles.png)](/hc/en-gb/article_attachments/202776403/4_UploadedFiles.png)
2. To view Zoom Recordings in Kaltura, select **Content**> **Entries** and select the check box **Zoom Recordings**.
 [![](/hc/en-gb/article_attachments/202621346/5_ViewRecordings.png)](/hc/en-gb/article_attachments/202621346/5_ViewRecordings.png)

* Blocked calls will not appear in the admin [call log](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360021114452) and associated phone user's [call history](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360021336671).
* Blocked callers will hear a generic message stating that the person they are trying to reach is not available.
* If a phone user calls a blocked outbound phone number, they will hear the same generic message stating that the person they are trying to reach is not available.
* You can [block numbers at the user level](#h_9c0eadd7-0b99-4151-aad0-a9983eeec88c). Each phone user can view or change these blocked numbers in their [phone settings](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360021325712).
* Phone users can only view (not change) the account-level blocked list.
* If you have [multiple sites](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360020809672), you can't apply block numbers for a specific site.
* You can [block all inbound calls that don't have a caller ID](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360025846692#h_edd4ddcc-9ccc-4109-b354-f5af6082e115).

*****For those that have configured Zoom Rooms prior to November 1, 2015, you can still apply your paid licenses to configure additional rooms.

If the meeting organizer enables the Non-verbal feedback and Meeting reactions features, meeting participants can place an icon in their video panel and beside their name in the participants panel to communicate with the host and other participants without disrupting the flow of the meeting. For example, selecting **Slower** places the slower icon in your video panel and beside your name to indicate you would like the host or presenter to go slower.

All participants can see the icons that everyone else has chosen. In addition, the host sees a summary of how many participants are displaying each icon, and has the option to remove all feedback.

By default, the meeting reactions have a yellow skin tone. On the Zoom desktop client for Windows and macOS, you can also set your skin tone.

Reactions and non-verbal feedback will disappear after 5 seconds. Raise hand must be manually lowered by the participant or host.

This article covers:


* [Enabling Nonverbal feedback](#h_6922651d-d279-44bd-b36a-cc2a30696c70)
* [Enabling Meeting reactions](#h_6922651d-d279-44bd-b36a-cc2a30696c70)
* [Providing and managing feedback](#h_50523139-7bac-403b-9c59-1755ada65ad9)

You can request remote control from the host or participant who is sharing their screen.


1. While viewing another participant's screen share, click the **View Options** dropdown menu located at the top of your in-meeting window.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/generic/request-remote-control-option.png)
2. Select **Request Remote Control**, then click **Request** to confirm.The host or participant will get a notification asking if they want to allow you to control their screen.
3. Click inside the screen share to start controlling the participant's screen.
4. To stop remote control, click the **View Options** dropdown and select **Give Up Remote Control.**![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/generic/give-up-remote-control-option.png)

pageTitle: Inviting others to join a meeting
body:
There are several ways to invite participants to a [scheduled](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362413) or instant meeting.

**Note**: You can also [invite by phone](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/200942859) (requires the [audio conferencing plan](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362833)) or [invite a room system](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/203736425) (requires [Cloud Room Connector](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201363273) add-on).

This article covers:


* [Inviting others during a meeting](#h_9f0ed29e-20cb-4448-846b-a79f7fc2c1eb)


	+ [Email](#h_6319b24d-16b1-42cc-841f-5cf1dbea3c3d)
	+ [Contacts](#h_7b6b76b5-7bbd-4728-81c9-24b954155ef8)
	+ [URL or invitation text](#h_f8278369-7883-4a51-bc4a-26ecaf088e9b)
* [Inviting others to a scheduled meeting](#h_a5000f39-cd06-4cc5-a94f-35339fdfdc89)


	+ [Desktop client](#h_5e758b0a-ddd9-43bf-b1f2-d1beac09db6c)
	+ [Web portal](#h_9e49ec72-27a4-4c83-9dce-5ee350209ae5)

There are multiple roles available for a meeting: host, co-host, alternative hosts, and participants. The role that you have in a meeting is designated by the host.


* **Host**: The user that scheduled the meeting. They have full permissions to manage the meeting. There can only be one host of a meeting.
* **[Co-hosts](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/206330935)**: Shares most of the controls that hosts have, allowing the co-host to manage the administrative side of the meeting, such as managing attendees. The host must [assign a co-host](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/206330935-Enabling-and-Adding-a-Co-Host) during the meeting. Co-hosts cannot start a meeting. If a host needs someone else to start the meeting, they can assign an [alternative host](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/208220166-Alternative-Host).
* **[Alternative hosts](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/208220166)**: Shares the same controls as co-hosts, but can also start the meeting. Hosts can assign alternative hosts when they schedule a meeting.

**Note**: If you need to schedule a meeting on behalf of another user, use [scheduling privilege](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362803).

This article covers:


* [Participating in the meeting](#h_c94b911b-d8d5-4a8d-9608-5d51d57eed8a)
* [Managing participants](#h_3a99d449-224a-492d-bc9e-207cbae9e366)
* [Recording](#h_92022db8-c66e-4a44-860a-4b94033bf4a8)
* [Live streaming](#h_1103ec0c-71a2-4720-9799-9aea611b4d4e)

pageTitle: Preventing OnZoom event disruptions as a Host
body:
The best way to prevent disruptions during your OnZoom event is to familiarize yourself with [OnZoom's security options](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360049497492#h_01EMJ9R8JA45EM6T8BW3THM16G) and to only enable the features necessary to conduct your event. Be sure to familiarize yourself with all of the security options. This will help to ensure all of your attendees will have a happy and safe experience.

This article covers:


* [Best practices](#h_01EQ98Y50Z6BD21C3FZRHE4RY4)


	+ [Before starting your event](#h_01EQ98XQM3EBWPKK0SNGTZEAH1)
	+ [During your event](#h_01EQ98XZVD62S2F9MFJPAVBB9T)

subTitles: Customizing business, closed, and holiday hours
body:
You can customize times that the call queue is available to route calls. You can also customize how inbound calls are routed during business, close, or holiday hours.


1. Sign in to the Zoom web portal.
2. In the navigation menu, click **Phone System Management** then **[Call Queues](https://zoom.us/pbx/page/telephone/groups#/groups)**.
3. Click the name of the call queue you want to edit.
4. Customize these settings:

Click **Edit** to change the times when the call queue will distribute calls. You can also set business hours to span past 11:30 PM. This could be used for call queue members that work night shifts. You can also set business hours in increments of 10 mins by manually entering a time; for example, **11:10 PM**.

You can customize how calls are routed during business hours:


* **Allow queue members to set their own Business Hours**:


	+ If checked, members' business hours will override the call queue's business hours. For example, if you set the call queue's business hours to all day Friday, and a member is off on Friday, the call queue will not route to that member.
	+ If unchecked, the call queue's business hours will override member's business hours. For example, if you set the call queue's business hours to all day Friday, and a member is off on Friday, the call queue will still route to that member.
* **Call Distribution**: Select a method to distribute calls during business hours.


	+ **Simultaneous**: Rings all available members at the same time.
	+ **Sequential**: Rings available members one at a time. After selecting this option, specify the ring duration for each member until the **Max Wait Time** setting below is reached. Click **Specify Sequence** to rearrange the order by clicking and dragging each row or clicking the arrow icons.
	![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/web/zoom-voice/call-queues/call-distribution-edit-sequence.png)
	+ **Rotating**: Rings available members in a regularly changing order so that calls are distributed evenly. You can specify the ring duration for each member until the **Max Wait Time** setting below is reached.
	+ **Skip offline members when ringing**: If the call distribution is **Sequential** or **Rotating**, select this option to skip offline members and immediately ring the next available member. If this option is disabled, the call queue will follow the ring duration even if a member is offline. Offline means the member is not signed in to the Zoom desktop client, mobile app, or provisioned desk phone.
* **Receive new calls even on a call**: Enable [call notifications](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360034938472) for call queue members even if they are in a call. The call notification will allow members to accept the inbound call, then end or hold the existing call. If this option is disabled, the call queue will skip members who are busy on a call.


* **Greeting Prompt**: Plays before routing the caller based on the call distribution method. Select a greeting prompt from the drop-down menu or click **Audio Library** to [select, record, or upload custom audio](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360028212652).  You can also select **Disable** to not play a greeting prompt.
* **Audio While Connecting**: Plays for the inbound caller waiting to be routed to an available member. Select audio from the drop-down menu or click **Audio Library** to [select, record, or upload custom audio](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360028212652). You can also select **Disable** to not play any audio.
* **Music on Hold**: Plays for the inbound caller when they're placed on hold by a call queue member. Select audio from the drop-down menu or click **Audio Library** to [select, record, or upload custom audio](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360028212652). You can also select **Disable** to not play any audio.
* **Max Wait Time**: Select the total maximum wait time allowed in the call queue, then click **Confirm**. When the maximum is exceeded, callers will be routed based on the **Overflow** option below.
**Note**: When changing this settings, keep in mind your call distribution method and ring duration time (if applicable).


	+ **Simultaneous**: Rings all available members for the specified max wait time.
	+ **Sequential**: Rings available members one at a time for the specified max wait time. Make sure the ring duration for each member is set at a lower value than the max wait time.
	+ **Rotating**: Rings available members in a regularly changing order for the max wait time. Make sure the ring duration for each member is set at a lower value than the max wait time.
* **Wrap-up Time**: Select the amount of time before another queue call is routed to a member after they finish a queue call. This can be useful if you require call queue members to take breaks in-between calls; for example, to allow time to enter notes for the call.


* **Max Call in Queue**: Click **Edit** to change the maximum number of calls allowed in the queue, then click **Confirm**. When the maximum is exceeded, callers will be routed based on the **Overflow** option below.
* **Overflow**: Click **Edit** to set where calls are routed when the **Max Wait Time** or **Max Call in Queue** is exceeded. By default, calls are routed the call queue's dedicated voicemail inbox.
**Route to** drop-down menu: Select a routing option, then use the text box to specify the route. You can route to any extension in the account:


	+ **Voicemail**
	
	
		- **Leave voicemail to**: Route the caller to the voicemail belonging to one of these extensions.
		
		
			* **Current extension** ([call queue's voicemail](#h_01e1f9ab-18dd-441b-a7d8-12b05288108a))
			* [**User**](/hc/en-us/articles/360021058071)
			* [**Auto Receptionist**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360021121312)
			* Call Queue
			* **[Shared Line Group](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360038850792)**
		- **Voicemail Greeting**: Click **Audio Library**to [select, record, or upload custom audio](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360028514011). The greeting plays before routing the call.
		**Note**:
		
		
		- If routing to another extension's voicemail, the voicemail greeting you set will override the greeting set for that extension.
		- If you're routing to a phone user's voicemail, select **Follow User Voicemail Greeting** in the drop-down menu to use the phone user's greeting instead of selecting a replacement.
	+ [**User**](/hc/en-us/articles/360021058071)
	
	
	+ [**Zoom Room**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360025153711)
	+ [**Common Area Phone**](/hc/en-us/articles/360028516231)
	+ [**Auto Receptionist**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360021121312)
	+ **Call Queue**
	+ [**Shared Line Group**](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360038850792)
	+ **Phone Number** (external phone number)
	**Note**:
	
	
		- To enable this option, you must have a [direct number](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360020808292) assigned to the call queue.
		- Calls routed to an external phone number will be billed at the plan rate.
		- Make sure to select the correct country/region in the drop-down menu so you can add the external phone number. Some countries share the same country code, but appear has separate entries in the drop-down menu.
	+ **Disconnect**

A VAT number is a unique 9-digit number (which starts with the prefix “CHE” and ends with a suffix MWST (German) or TVA (French) or IVA (Italian)) activated by the Swiss Tax Authorities that identifies a person/entity as registrant for VAT purposes in Switzerland.  Where you have provided your VAT number this will show on invoices issued to you by Zoom.

pageTitle: Setting Up Zoom Rooms on Dell Optiplex with Windows IoT
body:
**Overview**

Zoom Rooms is deployed on a preconfigured Dell Optiplex running [Windows 10 IoT](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/windowsforbusiness/windows-iot) Enterprise LTSB 2016 (1607) on selected Zoom Rooms Kits such as the [Zoom Room Huddle Kit on Amazon](https://www.amazon.com/Zoom-Huddle-Logitech-Optiplex-accessories/dp/B07DGJLY3H) (and more to come). Due to Windows IoT licensing, it cannot be manually installed on any PC at this time.

Zoom Rooms on Windows IoT is in a locked down mode with minimal services enabled, firewall and auto-login configured, and auto-boot to Zoom Rooms.

This article covers:


* [Instructions](#instructions)


	+ [Configuration at First Boot](#firstboot)
* [Administration](#administration)


	+ [To Access the Windows Desktop](#desktop)
	+ [Returning to Zoom Rooms](#returning)
	+ [Upgrading the Zoom Rooms Application](#upgrading)

**Prerequisites**


* Account Owner, Admin, or [Role](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115001078646-Role-Based-Access-Control) with edit access to Zoom Rooms
* Dell Optiplex running Windows IoT
* Additional [hardware](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115005840283-Suggested-Hardware-for-Zoom-Rooms):


* Zoom Rooms Controller


* Camera, microphone and speaker
* One or more displays

**Instructions**

**Configuration at First Boot**

The first time the Dell Optiplex with Windows IoT is powered on, it will complete an automatic Windows installation process. This will take 2-3 minutes. Wired Ethernet is required for first time setup.

The computer will reboot 2 times during the initial installation process. The screen may also go blank for approximately 20 seconds. If the screen goes black for longer than a minute, reboot the PC, it should continue the first time setup with no issues.

When the installation process is complete, the Zoom Rooms interface will display with the [pairing code](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360000162383-Add-Zoom-Room-on-Controller) for the Zoom Rooms controller.

**Administration**

**To access the Windows Desktop**


1. Press Ctrl + Alt + Delete.
2. Click on the ZoomAdmin account and enter the default password of: zoom123

Once into the Windows Desktop all windows administrative options are available. We recommend changing the password for the ZoomAdmin account.

**Note**: Do not exit Zoom via the Exit button. This will return a blank screen and the computer will need to be restarted. Starting with Zoom Rooms Version 4.1.5 (33237.0925) the Exit button will be replaced with Shutdown and Reboot buttons.

**Returning to Zoom Rooms**


1. To return back to Zoom Rooms from the Windows Desktop, restart the computer.
2. Windows may warn that another user is signed in. This is expected and you can continue the restart.

**Upgrading the Zoom Rooms application**

It is highly recommended to perform Zoom Rooms [upgrades and downgrades](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/204675449-Upgrade-or-Downgrade-Zoom-Rooms-Software) via the Zoom admin portal rather than downloading and installing on the PC.

**Note**: This option is only available on images and files.

Open the image or file using your system's image viewer or default application for the file type.

**Tip**: You can also click the image to open it directly in Zoom.

* **Enhancement to data center regions and allow/block countries settings**When customizing the data center regions or allowing/blocking users from specific countries/regions, the web portal will display a warning notification if there’s a conflict between the above two settings and the dial-in countries.

Go to the phone's home screen to see that the line is busy. This is usually indicated by a red icon. If your phone has physical line keys, the indicator light will turn solid red.

![](https://assets.zoom.us/generic-images/zoom-phone/poly/vvx450/busy-line-icon.png)

1. Hover over the code snippet in the chat window.
2. Click the **…**
3. Click **Copy**.
 ![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/mac/copy-code-snippet.gif) This will copy the code to your clipboard and you can paste it elsewhere.

If you do not see the Schedule a meeting icon in the menu ribbon, open your **Outlook options**.


1. Select **Disabled Items**.
2. Choose the **Zoom Outlook plug-in**
3. Select **Enable**.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/integration/office-365/outlook/windows/enable-plug-in.png)
4. Select the **Com Add-ins**
5. Check the **Zoom Outlook plugin** box.

pageTitle: Changing your meeting, recording, and telephone settings
body:
Your meeting settings allows you to enable or disable features for your meetings. These settings control the availability of many features, such as breakout rooms, recording, and chat. Settings are [tiered](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115005269866) and can be turned on/off or locked by your admin.

**Note**: This article is about settings at the user level. If you have account owner or admin privileges, you have access to user-level settings, in addition to settings at the [group](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/204519819-Group-Management-) and [account](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201363253-Account-Settings) level.

This article covers:


* [Accessing and editing meeting settings](#h_9d1d1c08-32ba-4bca-b3db-b4de68fc3c33)
* [Meeting tab](#h_01a29f16-a56a-42eb-9ab2-58c43f3d881a)
* [Recording tab](#h_6df7b580-4c30-422a-b91d-e8fe0dc48de7)
* [Telephone tab](#h_8d123815-9e5c-42e4-856d-e9e913abe48c)

You can edit or delete messages, files, or images that you have already sent. The search results that recipients see in the chat will reflect the content of your edited message. Although the recipient does not receive a notification, deleted chat content and files are no longer accessible within Zoom. All platforms support the typing indicator (you are notified when the other party is typing a message).

pageTitle: Inviting others to join a meeting
body:
1. Click the **Contacts** tab.
2. Select their name from the window, or search for a [contact](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/115004055706).
3. Click on the individual you would like to invite. You can select multiple contacts. Once you do this, their name(s) will be highlighted in blue and they will appear in the list at the top of the window.
4. Click **Invite** in the lower right corner.

* **Ctrl+Shift+C**: [Call highlighted phone number](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360027633731).
* **Ctrl+Shift+A**: Accept inbound call.
* **Ctrl+Shift+D**: Decline inbound call.
* **Ctrl+Shift+E**: End current call.
* **Ctrl+Shift+M**: Mute/unmute mic.
* **Ctrl+Shift+H**: Hold/unhold call.

pageTitle: Preventing OnZoom event disruptions as a Host
body:
Start your event 5-10 minutes before the scheduled time (before Attendees join) to check your event's security settings ([set when you created the event](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360049497492#h_01EMJ9R8JA45EM6T8BW3THM16G)), and to make sure the Attendees' settings are set how you want. You can change the settings at any time during the event, but it is best to confirm your settings before Attendees join.

OnZoom's default settings are set to the highest level of security to help prevent disruptions during your event.

Before the start of your event, be sure to:


* Disable **Attendees can send 1:1 chat messages**: If enabled, attendees will be able to send chat messages publicly and privately.
* Disable **Attendees can change screen names**: If enabled, attendees will be able to change their display name during your event.
* Disable **Attendees can share their screen**: If enabled, attendees will be able to share their screen during your event at their discretion.

**Note**: You can review these security options by reviewing the [event's security settings](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360049497492#h_01EMJ9R8JA45EM6T8BW3THM16G).

[Call delegation](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360032881731) ![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/misc/icons/lock.png)✔
✔

[Shared line groups](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360038850792) ![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/misc/icons/lock.png)✔
✔

[Click to dial](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360027633731)✔

**Note (A)**: You can use [call flip](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360034613311) on Linux if it's the originating device. In other words, you can transfer calls from the Linux desktop client, but you can't transfer calls to the Linux desktop client.

**Note (B)**: If your platform does not support enabling or disabling calls from shared line groups, you can [change this setting in the Zoom web portal](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360021325712).

**Note (C)**: If you are in a Zoom meeting using the mobile app, you will always get notifications for incoming Zoom Phone calls.

1. In the Azure portal, on the Zoom application page, click **Single sign-on.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/integration/sso/azure/single-sign-on.png)**
2. Under **Select a single sign-on method**, select **SAML**.![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/integration/sso/azure/single-sign-on-method-saml.png)
3. Click the edit icon for **Basic SAML Configuration**.![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/integration/sso/azure/edit-basic-saml-configuration-azure.png)
4. Fill out the following fields:


	* For **Identifier (Entity ID****)**, enter your vanity URL without https://.
	 Eg. yourvanityurl.zoom.us
	 ![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/integration/sso/azure/identifier.png)
	* For **Reply URL**, enter <https://yourvanityurl.zoom.us/saml/SSO> ![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/integration/sso/azure/reply-url.jpg)
	* For **Sign on URL**, enter **https://** followed by your Vanity URL.
	 Eg. <https://yourvanityurl.zoom.us>![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/integration/sso/azure/sign-on-url.png)
5. Click **Save**.


6. To view the claims being passed by Azure, click the pencil icon in the **User****Attributes** section.
7. Under **SAML Signing Certificate**, click **Download** next to **Certificate (Base 64)** and save it to your computer.
 [![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/integration/sso/azure/download-saml-signing-certificate.png)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/article_attachments/115018228306/e6b1cc1b-97b3-44c8-89fd-7d183f58ffea__1_.png)**Note**: Check that the certificate's status is active. If it is listed as **inactive**, click the Edit button, and click **Make certificate active**.
 ![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/integration/sso/azure/active-certificate-azure.png)
8. Click **Save** at the top.
 ![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/integration/sso/azure/save-certificate.png)
9. Scroll to **Set up Zoom** **Note**: You can also click **View step-by-step instructions**, to access the quick reference guide, and download your **Azure AD Signing Certificate** if you did not in step 7.
10. Open a new browser tab/window and login to the Zoom web portal.
11. Navigate to the **[Single Sign-On](https://zoom.us/account/sso)** page.
12. Copy the **Azure AD Single Sign-On Service URL**from Azure and paste it into the **Sign-in page URL** field in Zoom.
13. Open the certificate you downloaded in Step 5 in a text editor. Copy the portion between ---**--BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----** and **-----END CERTIFICATE-----**and paste it into the **Identity provider certificate** field in Zoom.
14. For **Service Provider (SP) Entity ID**, select the version of your vanity URL without https, eg. yourvanityurl.zoom.us
15. Copy the **Azure Azure AD Identifier** from Azureand paste it into the **Issuer (IDP Entity ID)** field in Zoom.
16. In Azure, click on **All Services** on the left.
17. Search for and click **App registrations**.![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/integration/sso/azure/app-registrations.png)
18. Click **Endpoints.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/integration/sso/azure/app-registrations-endpoint.png)**
19. Copy the **SAML-P Sign-out Endpoint** and paste it into **Sign-out page URL** in Zoom.
20. In Zoom, for Binding, select **HTTP-Post**.
21. Click **Save Changes**.

pageTitle: Exporting Logs and Configuration Files for Yealink Phones
body:
Providing the support team with logs and/or configuration files can help them troubleshoot issues you may be having. You can download these files from the web interface and then send them to support for further analysis.

This article covers:


1. [Obtaining the Phone's IP Address](#h_4b1c4cbb-ad32-43c5-849b-2e00bca57efe)


	* [T4 series without touchscreen](#h_5553d7f4-f726-44b8-bd05-2306dd6c0ea4)
	* [T4 series with a touchscreen](#h_69bb3ef7-b04d-4645-a0ff-d4c3c3688863)
	* [T5 series with a touchscreen](#h_25952032-1b2d-43be-842e-962dcc0ce625)
2. [Accessing the Phone's Web Interface](#h_4b1c4cbb-ad32-43c5-849b-2e00bca57efe)


3. [Exporting Logs and Configuration Files Using the Phone's Web Interface](#h_b77c59de-4402-41de-b42d-7a7f58bd7184)

**Note**: Use [Zoom Phone role management](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360042099012) to allow a phone user to access or manage a site's settings. You can also change [policy settings](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360033511872) to control certain features.


1. Sign in to the Zoom web portal.
2. In the navigation menu, click **Phone System Management** then **[Call Queues](https://zoom.us/pbx/page/telephone/groups#/groups)**.
3. Click the name of the call queue you want to edit.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/web/zoom-voice/call-queues/name-list.png)You can change the following settings in the **Profile** tab:


4. Display name and description: Click **Edit** beside the call queue's name to change the display name and description.


5. **Site** (only visible If you have [multiple sites](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360020809672-Managing-Multiple-Sites)): Displays which site the call queue belongs to. Select another site using the drop-down menu to move the call queue to another site.
6. **Extension Number**: Click **Edit** to change the extension for callers to reach the call queue.
7. Number(s): Click Add to assign a [direct phone number](/hc/en-us/articles/360020808292) to the call queue.
8. **Members(s):** Click **View or Edit** to see current members of the call queue or add members. You can add [phone users](/hc/en-us/articles/360021058071) or [common area phones](/hc/en-us/articles/360028516231#h_0f0e832d-3100-4d44-b5fd-664cde31e610) to call queues. Each call queue has a maximum of 50 members. You can [overflow](#overflow) to another call queue if you require routing to more than 50 phone users.
9. **Time Zone**: Click **Edit** to change the time zone used for the **Business Hours** option below.
10. **Audio Prompt Language**: Select the language used for the call queue's audio prompts.
11. **Business Hours** / **Closed Hours** / **Holiday Hours**: Customize how inbound calls are routed during [business, close, or holiday hours](#h_5e6b7b0a-8656-41c4-b7d0-f7f656add225).
12. **Voicemail**: [Share the call queue's voicemail inbox](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360033863991#h_738bd945-ebcb-4160-8c44-0f3eb29e62d3).
**Note**: To allow callers to leave messages in the call queue's voicemail, change the **Overflow** setting to route to the current extension's voicemail inbox.
13. **Active Status**: Click the toggle to enable or disable the call queue. Inactive call queues cannot be called but will retain its settings and appear in the **[Call Queues](https://zoom.us/pbx/page/telephone/groups#/groups)** page.

* Fixes an issue where users with scheduling privilege for 20 or more meeting hosts could not view all meetings in the Zoom web portal at the same time
* Fixes an issue where a subset of users received a 402 error when updating credit card information
* Fixes an issue where alternative hosts were not displayed in the webinar details
* Fixes an issue where hosts were unable to enable pre-assigned Breakout Rooms after the meeting had been scheduled
* Minor bug fixes

subTitles: Choosing a spectator or interactive experience for your Attendees
body:
The main difference between a spectator event and an interactive event is how much participation is allowed from the audience (Attendees) during the event.

Attendees are not allowed to turn on their audio and video, but can interact with the Host and Panelists using these features (if feature is enabled for event):


* Chat
* Q&A

Digital Signal Processors or DSP are audio processors that are software based and may have associated hardware which optimizes audio for different applications. There are two methods for processing audio within a Zoom Room. There are two approaches to audio processing in a Zoom Room:


1. Zoom's Software Audio Processing is enabled and the external mic and speaker are independent and unaware of each other.
2. The DSP is external to Zoom and all processing and relationship between mic and speaker is completely external and Zoom's Software Audio Processing has been disabled.

If the input and output device are the same, such as a Logitech Rally System, Logitech Meetup, Aver VB342, Polycom Trio, or rack-mounted DSP, that device will handle all of the audio logic that is needed to have an optimal audio experience. Since Zoom is not handling the DSP in this instance, the [Software Audio Processing setting](#h_7de6e201-aae2-4d47-93fd-75426199063a) should be disabled.

It is important to note that certain devices have been developed to **automatically disable**Zoom SAP upon selection. If any **adjustment** is made after the initial setup, Zoom SAP may be **automatically enabled**, which would not be desired in this situation.

For external DSP designs, please reference:


* [Phone Room (1-2 people)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360000269386-Zoom-Rooms-Phone-Room-1-2-people-)
* [Huddle (2-7 People)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360021806872-Huddle-2-7-People-)
* [ProAV Conference (7-13 People w/table mics)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360021948272-ProAV-Conference-7-13-People-)
* [ProAV Conference (9-19 People w/ceiling mics)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360022280591-ProAV-Conference-9-19-People-)
* [ProAV 3-Screen (6-10 people w/speaker tracking camera)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360022101072-ProAV-3-Screen-6-10-People-)
* [ProAV All Hands Space (w/ presenter mics only)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360022158292-ProAV-All-Hands-Space)
* [ProAV Training Room/Classroom (w/ ceiling & presenter mics)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360022403651-ProAV-Training-Room-Classroom)
* [ProAV Divisible Space (w/ ceiling & presenter mics)](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/360022463651-ProAV-Divisible-Space)

For security purposes, Zoom has a few requirements that your password must meet. These apply when setting your initial password and when resetting your password.

Note that these only apply when using your email address and Zoom password to login to Zoom. If you login with Google, Facebook, or Single Sign-On, your password must meet their requirements.


* Must be at least 8 characters
* Cannot be longer than 32 characters
* Have at least 1 letter (a, b, c...)
* Have at least 1 number (1, 2, 3...)
* Include both uppercase and lower case letters
* Cannot contain only one character (i.e., "111111" or "aaaaaa")
* Cannot contain consecutive characters (i.e., "123456" or "abcdef")
* Cannot contain spaces (i.e., "Go Zoom")

* **Webinar features**


	+ **Phone audio options for Webinar attendees**Webinar attendees can now access Phone Call and Call Me options for audio, in addition to the Computer Audio option. An admin must enable the premium Call-Out feature on the web portal, which requires the Audio Conferencing add-on.

subTitles: Pairing from the Zoom Desktop Client
body:
1. Dial the IP address (found in the meeting invitation or on your [Cloud Room Connector page](https://zoom.us/account/connector)) from the H.323 or SIP device to reach the splash screen.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/web/advanced/h323-sip-room-connector/enter-meeting-id-2.PNG)
2. Join or start a meeting from PC or Mac client.
3. Press the **Invite** button in the host controls.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/generic/invite-button.PNG)
4. Select the **Invite a Room System** tab.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/mac/invite-room-system-tab.png)
5. Enter the pairing code shown at the splash screen on the SIP/H.323 device.
![](https://assets.zoom.us/images/en-us/desktop/mac/invite-room-system-enter-pairing-code.png)
6. Click **Invite**.

* Minor bug fixes

pageTitle: New updates for Zoom Rooms for Windows
body:
* **In-meeting Features**


	+ **Whiteboard Sharing with a Kaptivo Device**Users can share a whiteboard with one touch from a Zoom Room controller or a Kaptivo device. No HDMI converter is required.
	+ **Added Namibian Call in Number**
* **Management features**


	+ **Always Turn Zoom Rooms Video On for Internal Meetings**Admins can toggle a setting that automatically turns on specific Zoom Room cameras when the room starts or joins an internal meeting. This setting  can be toggled at the account, location, or room level and overrides the settings for the meeting.

The desktop client includes advanced options for audio, video, and [screen sharing](https://support.zoom.us/hc/en-us/articles/201362153). These options provide more control of the audio and video feed, as well as troubleshooting support.

**Note**: These features are intended for advanced technical users. Toggling these options without knowledge of a device's hardware and software configuration can result in a sub-standard user experience.

This article covers:


* [Advanced video options](#h_7f332114-d398-46ae-b0aa-acc4b857c910)
